column1: Comfort Zone 7,500 Watt 240V Digital Fan Ceiling Mount Heater w/ Remote CZ230ER
column4: ["This replaced a 40 y/o unit that worked, but not well. Having the remote control makes temperature control much easier. The high mode provides instant heat when used and the guide vanes direct the flow well. I did replace the circuit breaker as this unit has a max draw of 31.4 amps (7500 watts)on high mode, and insured the wiring and connections were proper. It's below freezing outside and this unit cycles and maintains 63-68 degrees with a 72 degree setting. The area is an insulated 900 sqft and the temperature is read on the wall furthest from the unit. Until I get a better primary heat source this is a great unit to have till then.", "The heater is built pretty tough, which is a good thing. I also found it easy to connect, which interestingly enough was more expensive for the materials than it was for the heater. Only problem is that it doesn't heat as well as advertised. It claimed to heat an area (uninsulated) that was 30x30. my garage is 25x35 so I figured that was basically the same thing. after running for an hour or more it only brought the temp up from 45* to about 52*. I guess that if I left it running all the time it would eventually gey there, but that was not what I was hoping for. Plus, those temps were only for the emediate area around the heater, the far end of the garage was still ice cold. In any account it is a good heater for the price. especially if you already have a place wired for it.", "Havent used it yet, but looks nice. It's smaller than I thought but as long as it heats good then I'm ok with it. I was a little disappointed that it didnt come with the plug. Luckily I have an extra one. I will have it hooked up in a couple of days. Thanks. ", "Installed in my 2 car garage, used the correct 8ga wire and double pole breaker. On high setting, it trips the breaker. Tried a different breaker, no luck. It doesn't heat the garage as well as I anticipated, but better than having no heater at all. I like the remote, it works well. Heater is quiet. Not impressed but whatever. I may end up moving it to my basement, where I believe it may work better. ", 'After researching different heater I found this to be the best deal, but the heat sensor is on the inside witch makes it shut off sooner than it should so I located it on the outside and it now works good. I also looked on youtube to see how to hook up 220w and found it to be really easy but make sure you use 8/3 wire and a 40amp double pull breaker for safety reasons. I have a 24x30 insulated garage with 8 foot ceilings and at 32 degrees it will heat up at about 10 degrees an hour and after a while when the heat is up a little bit it seems to heat up faster so I use my kerosene heater to speed things up a little and when it gets around 68 degrees this heater can maintain very easy. now just so you know I have 4 metal cars in my garage that retain cold air for quite a while so your garage might heat up faster depending what you have in it', "I purchased this unit to replace my old one. The unit arrived very quickly. I think it took 4 days to get to me. Packaging was very stout, no damage to the unit. I did have a friend of mine help me install it but it wasn't really hard and could have done it in a pinch. Instructions were easy to read. I have a 25x25 sq ft shop, insulated to about R4 and this heater does a nice job of warming it with outside temps around around 32F. This unit is also nice in that I have a choice of hi or lo elements used to heat.I would recommend this and install it myself if I go to a larger building.", 'Great price, great size, easy to use', "Not happy with this heater. First of all, the thermostat is not correct, as it is located INSIDE the heater where it stays hot. Must be set much much higher for desired temp. Second, and worst of all, when the heater switches ON or OFF, it makes a extremely loud BANG. Really disappointing for the price and would return it if it wasn't hard wired in. Regret buying the warranty, as I don't plan on keeping past it's first breakdown.", 'The temperature sensor is mounted in a way that the heater cuts off way before room temperature is reached.  Believe the sensor is getting reading from the case rather than ambient temperature.  ', 'Well Made. Easy to use. Shipping was fast, with damage. Easy to install. Easy to hang. Would highly recommend it if the square footage is right and it is insulated.']

column1: Mr. Heater MH9BX Indoor Portable Propane Heater Deluxe Kit
column4: ["I have been hunting working outside and in the elements for the last 25 years. I particularly use this brand and model for most of my outdoor activities when the need for heat rises. This product is one of the best and only ones that I carried for hunting ice fishing and other activities period lightweight excellent instruction dependable and reliable on a scale of 1 to 10 I give it a 9.5. Only for the fact nothing is ever truly perfect. But if I've ever had an issue with one it was sent back one was replaced or fixed with no problems or issues I highly recommend this unit for anyone looking for a portable way to keep warm on the go outdoors in the elements.", "I haven't actually tried it on a camping trip yet but I am confident that this will be sufficient to safely take the chill off my conversion van so I am to catch a few hours nap when traveling without running the gas engine to keep warm. It's very easy to use but be patient after installing the LP gas bottle. You will have to hold the button starer for 30-60 second to purge the fuel line of air before the gas actually starts flowing to the burner. Once purged it starts very quickly!", 'It is a wonderful product.  It is very simple to operate and has an attractive design.  It burns very cleanly with only a faint smell of propane.  Even on the low setting, it warms a 300-ft. area very quickly.  I do not yet know how long a one-pound container of Propane will burn.   It also has a convenient carrying case that holds the heater unit and two one-pound bottles of Propane.  That makes it easy to store, and it takes up very little space. I give it five stars (out of a possible five).  We had an ice storm in Oklahoma last year that knocked out power for over a week; my little apartment was freezing.  With Mr. Heater in the closet, I feel safe and secure for the next power outage.', "Well first of all I started out as a Coleman heater man and I didn't think no other propane heater brand could outdo the Coleman product but Mr heater portable buddy does with greater heat output. The only thing that Mr heater could improve on is a way to regulate the heat temperature. It's just low 4000 btu to high 9000 btu and that can get to hot in a small area. Other than that so far, I find it to be a very good propane heater. Won't be going back to Coleman. For one thing their heaters wear out fast.", "i really like this heater,this is the second one i bought.. the first one is still working fine..i'm writing this review based on that one. it has worked flawlessly. i use it all the time on the boat, all winter..it's a 34 foot boat with a large cabin that i use all winter.10 mins and the chill is gone. in 30 mins we're opening coats and relaxing..a 1 lb tank lasts all night on high..have taken it camping this year.. kept us warm & cozy.the downloaded pdf instruction manual says it's safe for indoor use..but there still a CO2 warning..as with any other fire producing device..haven't had any problems at all with it...although i did have to clean a spider web from the pilot light in the fall.. i took the entire thing apart jut to see how it works.. very simple to work on..and i checked on line for any replacement parts.. all of the parts are available and fairly cheap.that makes it totally fixable..the safety features work almost too well.. a bump and it shuts off.. never had the tip over safety needed, but it has been checked.new in the store for 95$.. bought it used for 65/w shipping..", "If you are considering to buy a portable gas heater, so it's the one you have been looking for. It's very safe, light, has posibility to connect to big tank and looks solid.It has few safety off switches: turn over, flame out and low oxygen (this one I wasn't able to find in any other device) so this means that you can use it almost anywhere. It is very light and it came with carycase with wich it is even more comfartable to have it with you. It use not that much propane compared to how much heat it gives. It has two working modes High an Low. so far I have noticed that it uses about 100 grams (3.5 ounces) per hour in High mode and I think that it might use more than twice in low mode. It gives sufient heat to heat a room of 140 feet. And if it is not enaugh for you it has it's biger version with twice more power.Though it gives a bit of odor, but it is not that much noticible.So as I said, if you are looking for portable gas heater it is the one.", "I bought this heater to take along tent camping when I go to different hunting places throughout the state. The heater seems to be very dependable. It is easy to start and to stop. I have used other Mr. Heater brand heaters for several years and they hold up well. The size is correct for my needs and heats my space easily. The 1 pound bottle attaches easily and is removed easily. It's a great little heater. It is a bit larger than I expected, but that does not effect how I will use it.", "The Buddy Heater is an excellent idea with some flaws. I use mine nearly every day of winter. A ceramic heater is perfect for indoor use. You don't have to worry about carbon monoxide gas, and if you crack a window, the oxygen won't deplete. I love my heater! However, the Buddy Heater is not engineered well. All gas and propane are saturated with a very stinky oil which smells like rotten eggs so you will recognize it when you smell it. The Buddy Heater's small tubing, which delivers the gas to the the pilot light and ceramic heater, will condense out this oil in cold weather. When the tube fills with oil to a certain point, oil will get to the pilot orifice tube; this tube has a special glass filled hole that meters the pilot flame. Once that clogs -no pilot flame. No pilot flame, no worky. Mr Heater will sell you another pilot and ignition set, but this does not address the oil sitting in the tube. It will clog even faster. I have tried to call them to encourage them to change the design, but they just ignore me. My solution, and it works, is to carefully take the back off, remove the pilot assembly, unscrew the pilot orifice and put a pipe cleaner through the supply line. I then take pliers and put the orifice piece over a torch flame and heat it until it is smoking; hot enough to burn out the oil. I put it back together and it will work for another 2 months, (everyday use) before it clogs again. I  tried buying their in-line filter, but it still clogs up. The oil molecules are small enough to get past the filter. So I recommend the heater, but it's a real hassle when it stops working on a cold night!", "Excellent for portability and heating. Easy to use and simple to clean.  The downside of portable heaters it the short heating time.. 3 hours on full... up to 8 hours on ... thrifty usage.  Let alone the high cost of propane items now.For a permanent long time use I recommend the Olympian series heaters for durability.. all metal. The buddy heaters are excellent tho with excellent components and durability.Don't drop em tho.. the thermocouple moves a bit and it'll shut off all the time if you do not know where to move it back to.", 'I already had a good experience with the Mr Heater MH9B since my dad had purchased 3 of these a few years ago for our various hunting shacks. Very pleased with the updated design making the lighting of the heater easier with the pilot ignitor built into the adjustment knob and the swivel connector for the propane tank is a nice feature. Did an excellent job heating my hunting blind and also the area in my garage where we processed our deer. Would strongly recommend this heater to anyone.']

column1: BROAN 174 Rgstr Recssd Elct Wl Heatr,7-3/4" H,240V
column4: ['We bought two heaters by different manufacturers in order to compare. This one is quieter and heats better. The thermostat works better and is more accurate. Great unit, it keeps a 230 square foot room warm even in 10 degree F weather.', 'I bought this heater to replace the same one I installed in my lower level bathroom 20 years ago. The replacement was exactly the same size which made the replacement of the internal parts in the existing sheet metal frame very fast. It works well for this small bath to take the chill of the lower level out between heating seasons. After removing the existing Broan 174 I saw a build up of lint/dust on the back side of the heater eliment and it may not have been bad to begin with, so I will keep that in mind if it starts smelling hot (In the next 20 years). Bottom line is it work well to heat a small room quickly.', 'Very good to use in a small bathroom,I run it 240v for less power consumption ', 'it was exactly what I wanted --keeps my small bathroom very warm', 'Easy to install, heat is fast, fan is quiet, looks great.', 'This is the 5th of these heaters I have purchased.  Mostly used in bathrooms and bedrooms both in my own home and in rental properties.  They are reliable, and very quiet, put forth plenty of gentle warm heat without worrying if a small child is close to them.  Excellent product.', 'this heater does exactly what it is build to do .and the support is great and will work well with you.', 'Good quality heater.  Easy to install.  I have four of these and all work perfectly.', 'Thermostat shuts the heater off too soon.', 'small and heats good']

column1: White Wall-Mount Electric Fan Space Heater Forced Air Quiet Dial Control Indoor
column4: ['When I bought my business, the 4 restrooms were heated only with surface mounted electric heaters. It seemed like I was replacing one at least every 2 years. They were poorly made, noisy, and had to be run with a separate thermostat that also was prone to fail.Then I bought the Stiebel Eltron. It is quiet, attractive looking, works GREAT, and has the thermostat built in. The quality is outstanding. I plan on replacing all of them with these. (And for comparison the cost is only slightly higher.)', 'Very simple to install and provides fairly even heat in a small room or additional heat in areas that need it when extremely cold outside . This is the second unit I bought and would not hesitate to purchase again .', 'Worked well, from the reviews I was expecting better than ones at 1/2 the price.   If the fan produced more volume it might have made the difference.  ', 'Looks great mounted on wall in my studio. Easy to hook up.', 'The best love it.', 'This is not a large heater, but it is just right for my needs.It will heat one small bedroom or bath with ease.Theromostat works great on this unit.Easy to install.This unit is has a sound level, I would say is very low.', "Exactly as described. column1: Magnavox MVH-2000 8 Element Infrared Heater Wood Cabinet
NEW MR HEATER F299720 BLUE FLAME PROPANE GAS HEATER 20K & THERMOSTAT 3311875
column4: ['Our Mr. Heater natural gas heater warms our enclosed deck area quickly.  We leave the pilot light on when we\'re not using the "porch".  The area warms up quickly on #2 setting and we turn the overhead fan on low.  It\'s a much better and faster heat than the small electric heater we\'ve used the past couple years.  Also, it\'s been very cold the past week with highs in the teens and we\'ve been very comfortable.  Love this heater!', 'I wall mount this heater. It consistently works, and heats great! Make sure you leave a window open slightly when using this heater. I highly recommend it!', 'installed in garage approx. 600 sq. ft.  works good, because of garage ceiling is high 12ft.  had to install ceiling fan together works very good', 'SHIPPING WAS AHEAD OF DAY PROMISED. ONLY TOOK 20 MIN. TO HOOK IT UP.HEATER WORK GREAT AND IT HAS VERIBLE HEATER ADJUSTMENTS SO YOU CAN TURN IT WAY DOWN TO SAVE GAS.', "All is good except it doesn't turn on or off properly,  it sputters between cycles, like if the diaphragm isn't closing all the way, bought a blower for it , now thats a waste of money. I was expecting a cold winter and put on the gas line for this heater, instead of electric like last year, so far it hit the low 20's in texas only a time or two, hangs round 30 for overnight lows, never got the dial above 3 and been comfortable, it just sputters", 'Very clean,no gas smell, and it works flawlessly...well done', 'Lit on the first click of the igniter and has been burning ever since.', 'I installed the heater this weekend it was a easy install an works great', 'small and powerful although it does put off a slight odor.', 'Looks good.']

column1: Heat Storm HS-1500-PHX-WIFI Infrared Heater Wifi Wall Mounted
column4: ['This wall furnace is made well and works perfect. Select what ever temp you want and when it reaches that it reduces power by 50 %. All automatic. It heats the room over my garage which is all finished and insulated and is 14 x 26. 364 sf. I wouldnt ask 4 anymore than that. Im in the state of Maine. I may need to add another to bring  the temp up quickly but im sure one of these will maintain from that point. For a 104 bucks you cant beat it. Oh and it eather hangs on wall or it has casters you can install. I hung mine and love it.', 'I used this in my insulated 500sq ft garage. Does a great job. In below freezing temps, warms it up to 50 degrees in only one hour. Perfect for just keeping the garage above freezing.', 'I love the WIFI feature and the heat is perfect for my 525sf space', 'I use this heater in a 250 square foot room and it works very well.It was easy to connect to wifi. I would highly recommend it.', 'Had a issue with my unit but they were quick with helping me out and getting things straightened out. Great heater that works amazingly for a great value.', 'Excellent product, easy mounting, works very well for the size', 'These are great little heaters! And at the best price! Looks good hanging on the wall and out of the way. Perfect for a bathroom.', "i use 2 of these to warm a 2.5 car garage . it does a nice job , quiet , remote control  . temps in NY are in the 30's", 'It‚Äôs a great little heater I put in my fish house/Camper! The remote works awesome too I couldn‚Äôt be happy would definitely recommend!', 'This is a great product for the value. Works flawless with my echo and heats up my bathroom perfectly. I would definitely recommend this product.']

column1: World Marketing 1416874 EUH4000 240V 4000W6-20Plug Electric Heater
column4: ["What works ? It puts out heat ! What doesn't work is the fact that it does not (cycle) on & off like a heater should ...... IT runs all the time and i mean all the time ! By that i mean you are able to turn down the temperature but that's it ! it runs constantly and does not shut off unless you physically turn the switch off ....... My other heater once the garage reached the set temp it would automatically shut off until it needed to come back on again and so on all thru the nite thus saving me money on the electric bill because the temp stayed current ! That being said once i get my other heater repaired I will be putting it back in service and the (dura heat) I will put it away.For this feature alone not cycling on & off is why i gave it only 3-stars.", 'Hope it will be safe to use in my house! I went  through last winter with 2 small box type electric heaters and had to wear a coat in the house part of the time. Hoping this heater will. take the chill off so my smaller ones can keep up!', 'Good unit, seems to be built of good quality. The thermostat does not shut off the fan, only the heat tube.I was looking for something that would shut off completely when the set temp is obtained.', 'My workshop is just a little over 600 sq. feet and this thing heats it up quickly. Make sure you understand that it runs off 220 and not 100!', 'Dura heat 4000 watt hanging heater is well designed, well finished, and easily placed from wall or ceiling.  Resistive electric heat is clean, convenient, economical, and if necessary can be replaced for less cost than a service visit.', 'The only thing i do not like about it is the fan runs all the time it is on, dose not cut off with thermostat turn off.', 'fan never shuts off', 'Great heater !!']

column1: BROAN 170 Rgstr Recssd Elct Wl Heatr,7-3/4" H,240V
column4: ["Put to use in a 8X10 bathroom. It does a great job heating this space to a comfortable temperature while we are taking a shower. Some reviews complained about the output, but I have no complaints. I have it only turned up about 2/3, and I want a warm space to set out of the shower into. I used existing stud on one side and placed a "floating" 2 x 4 on the other side to mount/screw the unit to on either side.  It\'s very sturdy.  Very clean looking.', 'easy to install and works great!', 'this heater worked perfectly from the start.It is quiet but effective and does not draw too much current.', 'Esy to install, works great', 'This is a great little heater for a small room or bathroom.', 'It works very well and it came early üòÅ', 'The wall heater is easy to install,efficient &quiet']

column1: NEW Comfort Zone Industrial Ceiling Mount Heater 5000 Watts 240V Garage Electric
column4: ["easy install, seems to be made well.  love the three heat settingsall parts were present and was packaged well. upon install, turned on power, turned thermostat knob and bam...had instant heat as I had expected...bring on the cold!!.however, one feature that I wish it had was a delayed fan off to cool the heating coils after use. when you rotate the thermostat knob, the fan shuts down immediately, leaving the hot coils to cool off too slowly. also, the unit I received didn't have a visible mark on the thermostat knob for easy identification of position (easily fixed). overall, nice product for the money", "So much easier than installing a gas furnace and vent.  Fan creates a full circular heat draft all the way around my 20x20 detached garage.  Heats up quickly and I can then turn it down.  Thermostat works well.  I had a 30 amp welder plug in a good location, so mounted it on the ceiling and used a 10' dryer plug cord.  Quick and easy installation.  Should have done this years ago.  No more freezing with a little space heater.", 'I recommend knowledg√§ble HVAC guy to add the external thermostat if you need one.  I have high ceilings and wanted to use my mouting system that √¢ttaches to the walls in a corner - no ceiling holes, but two nights of engineering the aluminum mounts.  Hester has been set on low since I installed it and let the Honeywell electronic thermost√¢t do the work.  Waiting for √£ heating bill to begin tuning it for optim√£l settings depending on weather.  But garage can get hot it works so well.', "I purchased this heater to use in a 666 sq ft, 4-car, uninsulated, vaulted ceiling garage.  Obviously this is meant to be used in a smaller, more insulated setting.  I wanted to try just one first, and then add as necessary.The heater itself seems to be well-built as far as structure, and designed well as far as installation and operation.  Including running wiring and building a wall mount (vaulted ceiling so no ceiling studs), it took 2-3hrs to get up and running.In my large uninsulated setting, over the course of 3-4hrs, it was able to raise the temperature from 25*F to 45*F, roughly speaking.  In other words, from intolerable to tolerable.  Which is about what I expected from it.  I think it would do quite well at maintaining a higher temperature if I were to use my propane 'salamander' to initially heat the space.Based on other's reviews and my own experience, there seems to be a major quality control concern in the assembly line for these regarding the fan nut.  I was unaware of this until after it was installed, but I'm almost certain I have the same issue as almost everyone else.  Before mounting the heater there was a nut and washer rattling around inside.  After a semi-thorough check, I figured it was an erroneous leftover.  Having read the reviews and after hearing a small rattle when the heater runs, I will be dismounting and tearing it down to install that nut properly.  This is both an inconvenience and really a potential danger.  For that I've removed a star from the rating.That being said, I will be purchasing another one, possibly two more.  Can't beat the price to performance ratio anywhere.Edit from the future:  I bought another one, slightly updated since the first.  This one had no problems and even runs quieter.  Awesome.", "This heater does a great job heating my 24'x30' insulated shop. I have it on a Honeywell line thermostat, and typically keep it at 40* to keep water lines from freezing, but when I'm ready to work in the ship I just turn it up and in 20 minutes it's nice and toasty. The other day it was 30* outside, but on high this ran for less than 5 minutes every 20-30 minutes.The only potential negative to be aware of is that it has a slight whistle when it's running. It's enough that I think about it every time it starts up, but it's not enough to be a nuisance.Overall I'm very happy with my purchase; it was easy to install, and is cost-effective for the job I needed it to do.", "Fast shipping.Well packaged.All metal construction.Enough detail in instructions,easily installed,best of all:heater works great.No issues so far.I heat a decent size 2 car garage and this is all I need.Recomend a ceiling fan to force the heat down,same thing with all of 'em.I can not stand beneath this heater when it is on high,it is way beyond my expectations.It is not very big or impressive,but do not let that part fool ya,it is a good heater.I have left the thermostat inside the heater,so far this is working fine.", 'I have used 4 times now and I really like it. If you have a insulated two car garage this heater will do the job nicely.It only took about 30 minutes to go from 30¬∞ to  62¬∞ in an hour it was 71¬∞ had to turn it down to work though. I like it 57¬∞ to 63¬∞ when working on a project. This heater is perfect for my needs. Little less than $100 too!üëç', "I'm happy with this heater and wish I'd found it years ago. I installed it in my basement workshop and it is way better than the big baseboard heater and kerosene heater I'd been using for many years. It's quiet and easy to install and heats the basement better than I'd anticipated. The workmanship and quality are great and I especially like that the sheet metal parts are post painted as opposed to crummy pre-paint and so all the sheet metal cut edges and corners are painted and nice and smooth and burr free.", 'I use this heater turned down low just to knock the edge off the cold so I can work comfortably in my 3 car garage shop.  I have it set on about 1/3 of its capacity and it keeps the garage at about 55- 60, the way I like it.  If I were to turn it up on high it would make the garage toasty warm.  The installation was straight forward and simple.  I bought a plug, 15 ft. of 10-3 service cord and a cord grip to make the installation. I plug it into my 220 volt welder receptacle when I want to have heat.  Wish I had found it years ago.', 'Great heat output, replaced my floor oil heater and small plug in with this one.  Only reason I gave it a 4 not 5 is that # 1 the fan blade was loose when I got it and the simple mechanism makes a rattling noise that is not necessary.  It only has a moving fan part but is kinda noisy.  Heats very well.']

column1: Dyson AM05 Hot+Cool Fan Heater - Grey
column4: ["It moves the air as well as can be expected for it's size. It's good for pointing it at you and getting air flow, but don't expect it to cool down a whole room. I haven't really used it in winter so I can't comment on the heat, though I did try it and it works the same as the fan section. You are paying all this money for the novelty and safety of a bladeless fan, not for efficiency. I gave it 4 stars because I like the novelty.", "This is my 2nd Dyson fan. I couldn't be any happier. We set up an office in part of the closed off garage and this keeps it at a normal temperature. I keep my other one on 73, so even if the house is 70, I'm comfortable.", "This is the second Dyson fan I have owned, the first is not a cooling/heating fan. This fan is AMAZING, I definitely prefer this to the regular fan.I love the fact that you can tilt it to blow air up as well as straight on. I really like the fact that you can change it to blow around you instead of directly at you. It heats up quickly and pumps out a lot of heat for a little fan.The only complaint I have is that the magnetic portion of the fan doesn't seem to hold the remote as well as the larger fan.", 'Looking forward to doing business with you again.', 'Love my new fan and heater.  Fun design and very quite and efficient', "This is our second Dyson Hot + Cool Heating Fan Heater Bladeless Tower. They're attractive and easy to use year around.", 'Performs as advertised.', 'The Dyson AM05 heater/fan is an example of Dyson products that are dependable and beautiful but expensive. However, the small, black remote controller that is chic like the unit itself is complicated, not intuitive, and, thus, mysterious.']

column4: ["It's all of the above and easy to install . I took it to my local hardware store and in about 30 minutes I had the coupling hose and fittings and it was burning and glowing . Perfect ! I have others of this  same brand as backup for electric heat. ", "Fantastic! Great price and it works wonderful. We have a built on garage that we converted into an extra room. It's a large room and this heater makes it toastie. Fabulous buy.", 'Instructions easy to follow. Keeps our pressure tank and surrounding pipes toasty warm. Just what we need to get through the Northern Michigan winter.Would be better if it had a thermostat rather than 2 heat settings. My error, did not notice that detail.', 'Like the heater.  Simple to install, provides quick heating for a family/livingroom area', 'Only pros, has 2 settings high and lo and uses both burners on low and both burners on high. Most units will only use single burners at a time which leads to uneven ware on the burners. These do not have that problem. I have used these for over 30 years to heat my whole house and we love them and they are 100% efficient, no wast. Have 3 to heat my house.', 'It‚Äôs nice warm heat easy to install just wish it had a thermostat it gets really hot then too cold when you turn it off', 'was advertised with thermostate  has only low and high  bad advertising not happy i am useing it but not happy ', 'works as good if not better than other heaters at twice the price ...', 'Item is as ordered satisfied recommendation verified.', 'It arrived on time ']

column1: 097308-06 motor For Desa Master Reddy Remington Heaters 079505-01 097300-02
column4: ['The price of the motor is high in relation to the value of the heater you are repairing, esp a smaller unit like a 110k btu. If one also had to pay a repairman it would be better to buy new or  used heater on marketplace. In my case, I was paid to repair a  heater  that was borrowed for many years. This motor worked great, perfect fit.', 'Can‚Äôt really go wrong. Part seems a little pricey but you‚Äôre not going to beat this price with fastnfree shipping. Part was here in 2 days and I ordered it at 10pm. Space heater parts got the order out quickly in time for me to use the heater this weekend. 150k BTU heater New is around $500 so you really can‚Äôt beat the parts swap. Should get me another 20 years of use now.', 'Afeter my 150000btu reddy heater locked up I purchased this replacement motor along with a new rotor and back plate. Install was easy, just like factory.Set the rotor gap and fuel pressure.Now it runs just like when it was new.If your heater needs a new motor, this is the only recommendation.', 'The motor was in great shape when it arrived. The motor and the rotor fit together great the only problem I have is at start up of the heater the motor make a squealing noise and then quits right away. I am not sure if it is a slight binding when starting or is it is in the motor itself.', 'Motor was exact replacement. Works great! Got our space heater running like new!', 'This motor is a direct replacement for the original motor. Works and fits as the original.', 'plug and play good fit.', 'Fits perfect. Easy install!', 'üëç']

column1: Mr. Heater Portable Big Buddy Propane Heater
column4: ["This heater is fairly large.  Don't expect it to fit under your legs in the bleachers.  The handle is really handy, but makes it pretty tall.This heater is very versatile. It can be like the smaller versions with just one element on at half power, full power, or both elements on full power.  It goes through propane about the same as all the other ones I've seen, and full power is a lot of power.  The fan (powered by D cells) blows warm air in your direction, which is nice because otherwise it just goes straight up.IMHO it's way handier than the smaller bottle mounted version because it doesn't tip easily and it's not as tall.  It puts the heat in a better location.It's not a small heater, but is powerful, well built, and looks like it will last.", 'this id the 2nd one I have owned  first one was 5 years old and used every day it was cold it keeps our coach warm enough on low  and very economicl to run do recomend getting the hose with regolator and using a 20 pound bbq grill tank outside  and keeping a couple of the one pound throw aways in reserve incase of a midnight run out of gas senero , teriffic for those emergencies and blizzards requires no electric to run just a couple batteries to run the fan but will still  produce  het with out fan not operating . has the o2 depletion piliot light that lifts off if o2 level gets to low plus tip switch incase it gets tipped over by accident , Like any heating device care should be taken to assure you are opperating it in a safe manner and following the instructions that states the clearences on ll sides ', 'Current house furnace is out and this unit has filled in amazingly well.  Live in MN and have 2 of these with a couple electric room heaters for 2000 sqft plus home and been heating for a month.  Do recommend the 20# Walmart propane tanks w/ gauge for $48 and conversion hose to unit for more economical heating that the small canisters.  CAn heat for nearly a week.  Have CO monitor and never have had it go off once.  They are made to be CO free .  We do not leave them running when not home for safety reason but never yet had an issue.  ', 'I bought this to be able to work in my 2 car garage during cold days. It works very well. The only drawback I could see is that the fan moves very little air. Otherwise, I would have given it a 5 star rating....  Made the garage able to be worked in with no jacket in about 2 hours (on a 15 degree day)  Well worth it...   And would be great thing to have if an ice storm hits and the power (heat) went out...  Costs less than a buck an hour worth of propane to run on High.  I bought a 15 lb tank and ran it for about 18 hours.....    I plan on getting a couple of portable 1 lb bottles and a refill adapter.....', 'Got Mr. Heater for a heater in my outside work area and as an emergency backup heater in case of power failure in a storm or the heat pump went bad in middle of winter. Works perfect and am using hooked up to 20lb propane tank and also little 1lb tanks. Either way is working perfect.  This thing will run you out of house on 18,000 btu setting.  Always vent from a window or door to keep oxygen fresh and will be good for indoor use, you will still be plenty warm and no worries about any pipes freezing. Great product', "This little heater is just the ticket for quickly warming up our home on those chilly mornings. ,I live where we seldom get any colder than 40 degrees at night , we don't run any heater at night for safety reasons ,although I feel this heater is safer than any electric one , no cords to overheat . I turn it on in the morning and in 15 minutes the chill is taken off the house. I use a small fan to circulate the heat more than the one that comes with the heater which is efficient for one room.  I also purchased the 12 foot hose and regulator so I can hook to a 30 lbs bottle out side the house. just ran the hose through an existing tv cable  hole. I can get about a week of heat out of one bottle at 16.00 to refill. That is much cheaper than running electric space heaters.", "The dogs and I have a very comfortable warm environment now that the heater is able to be used. They are so happy that the inside of the motorhome is a lot more comfortable. We have been having nights that are in the upper twenties and low 30s so we're really grateful to have a heater the prize this my cheat on low setting it it basically heats the Whole 30 ft motorhome it generates more than enough heat on low and will run for a hundred hours on that setting .  It is very warm at got my  farm in Coupeville Washington. thanks a lot for a great item!!", 'I\'ve been hunting deer for 42 years now and never worried about the cold weather when I was younger, mostly because pop-up portable blinds and portable heaters like these were not available back then. But my youngest daughter started hunting with me 6 years ago and after watching her brave a particularly cold opening day her first year I decided there had to be a better setup so she could enjoy going with me and I could insure I would get to continue to enjoy spending such moments with her, so I bought my first ground blind and my first Mr. Heater Little Buddy heater, and closing weekend of rifle season was soooooo much more enjoyable. Having a heat source to warm our feet made all the difference in the world being able to sit beside my daughter and just watch her scan our surroundings for her first deer, and did she take a beauty! After realizing how great the difference in the experience having shelter and heat made, I broke down and bought blinds for my Dad, nephew, and great friend who owns the property where we hunt, and then decided everyone should be able to stay warm and enjoy their time in the field as well, so I retired my Little Buddy heater and bought three of the Buddy heaters and one of the heater/cooker models and stocked each blind with a heater. The difference between the Little Buddy and the bigger Buddy models is very noticeably different! Running the bigger Buddy heaters warmed up a two person ground blind sufficiently enough to allow us to take off our coats, even with several windows open, and sit comfortably without creating undue noise or alerts to the deer as we watched many feed and browse around in the field in front of us. Hunting went from a cold and trying event to a greatly enjoyed experience spending time with my daughter, my Dad, my nephew, and friend! I\'ve always said a bad day hunting or fishing is better than a good day working anytime, but having Mr. Heater Buddy heaters warming our ground blinds has made such a difference in our time spent together so much more enjoyable that now my oldest daughter is joining in, and that alone made any expense paid for the equipment one of my best investments! Funny story: My Dad was using the heater I put in the blind he was using and after spending the morning hunting we all went to breakfast and I asked him how well he liked having heat, and his reply was, "great for about 20 minutes and then the damned thing quit and wouldn\'t re-light!" I asked him if he had opened any windows and he said "no, it wasn\'t light yet so I was just enjoying staying warm, until the heater went out!" I started laughing and he was taken aback by my reaction and asked why I was laughing, had I played a joke and given him the junk heater? I said no and told him he should be thankful Mr. Heater saved his life! Not knowing what I was referring to he had a puzzled look on his face, so I told him that the heater has a low oxygen sensor built into it and because he had the windows closed up fresh air could not circulate through the blind and the heater shut off before he could pass out from carbon monoxide poisoning! The look on his face was priceless! All he could say was "glad someone was looking out for him." After breakfast and getting some chores done we all went back to our blinds and my Dad made sure he opened some windows and lit the heater, and spent the rest of the day happy and warm. Moral of the story: The safety features built into Mr. Heater heaters work! Excellent design, quality built, and smart safety features all make Mr. Heater heaters great products you can trust and that make experiences during cold weather so much more enjoyable, and if having one gets a friend or family member to join in the fun, that\'s money well spent! Not to mention having the added insurance of staying warm at home should the power go out for an extended period of time during cold weather!   So, that\'s my experience with Mr. Heater heaters, and I can and do highly recommend to anyone needing and looking for a quality and dependable portable small heater, get one. You will be glad you did! ', 'Due to recently power outage frequently, I brought this protable heater for indoor use for emergency. I did not have chance to try it for hour long but I did try and find out it is very practical make and workable. Only issue to me is I don‚Äôt aware it need 4 D battery to run and how long one will last.Any how it is a very good product,I highly recommend it.', "Will be able to use it in my fish house, heat my area that I use for skinning and tanning the furs that I've trapped.  Like the fact that I can hook up to a larger propane tank.  The fan is a bonus and the 3 different heating levels are great also."]

column1: NEW MR HEATER F299721 BLUE FLAME NATURAL GAS HEATER 20K & THERMOSTAT 3311859
column4: ['Our Mr. Heater natural gas heater warms our enclosed deck area quickly.  We leave the pilot light on when we\'re not using the "porch".  The area warms up quickly on #2 setting and we turn the overhead fan on low.  It\'s a much better and faster heat than the small electric heater we\'ve used the past couple years.  Also, it\'s been very cold the past week with highs in the teens and we\'ve been very comfortable.  Love this heater!', 'I wall mount this heater. It consistently works, and heats great! Make sure you leave a window open slightly when using this heater. I highly recommend it!', 'installed in garage approx. 600 sq. ft.  works good, because of garage ceiling is high 12ft.  had to install ceiling fan together works very good', 'SHIPPING WAS AHEAD OF DAY PROMISED. ONLY TOOK 20 MIN. TO HOOK IT UP.HEATER WORK GREAT AND IT HAS VERIBLE HEATER ADJUSTMENTS SO YOU CAN TURN IT WAY DOWN TO SAVE GAS.', "All is good except it doesn't turn on or off properly,  it sputters between cycles, like if the diaphragm isn't closing all the way, bought a blower for it , now thats a waste of money. I was expecting a cold winter and put on the gas line for this heater, instead of electric like last year, so far it hit the low 20's in texas only a time or two, hangs round 30 for overnight lows, never got the dial above 3 and been comfortable, it just sputters", 'Very clean,no gas smell, and it works flawlessly...well done', 'Lit on the first click of the igniter and has been burning ever since.', 'I installed the heater this weekend it was a easy install an works great', 'small and powerful although it does put off a slight odor.', 'Looks good.']

column1: Gas Heater Mr. Heater MH12HB Hunting Buddy Portable Propane 6000 to 12000 BTU
column4: ["we finally got to use our mr. buddy heater while camping in our pop up tent this past weekend. waking up around 4 or 5 in the morning with the temperature about 45 degrees....that's a little chilly for us desert dwellers. mr. buddy takes the chill off in just a few minutes. the small, green portable propane tanks do get a bit frosty after about 45 minutes and if they are almost empty the unit just stops. I'm not sure if the unit stopping is due to the oxygen sensor or the bottled propane tank chilling because I used a partially filled bottle first, assumed it was empty, but found it still had liquid in it. after a few minutes I reinstalled it and started right up and ran until it was empty. we did have ample ventilation as the old pop up is not so tight and also we had the vent cracked a little. we experienced no headaches or notice of any lack of oxygen. all in all we really like it and recommend this to anyone. even on the low setting this unit does the trick. we found our large propane tank was empty when we got there so we did not get to use with the hose. the built in fan does work but we didn't use it this time. on a scale of 1 to 10 I give this item an automatic 20! I like it that much.", 'I have only 20 amps in my live work space.After running lights, television and other stuff, I did not have enough current left to run a space heater. This little buddy heater solved my heating problem. It works indoors! I have a 5 lb. Propane tank feeding it. I get about two to three 1/2 days ( at night) running time per tank, about 36 hours. I have 6 tanks for backup.', "I purchased this heater for my campervan, kicks off some good heat but it has to be on the floor as the roof gets to hot if on kitchen worktop. Seems to be good quality and seems to be excellent value in the u.s.a, it cost me more as I'm in the uk. All round good heater but expensive to run if your planning on using it for a long period of time", 'This heater is a life saver if your kids play winter outside sports. This heater knock off the chill and make being outside during those cold games not so bad.', 'Easy start up. Works great. Super quiet on high and medium. On low makes some noise. Heats a 2 person hunting blind in a hurry in freezing temperatures. Highly recommend to stay warm siting in them hunting blinds on cool days', "I've always had good luck with mr heater but this one let me down. It's works great other than it wouldn't stay lit on low. The electric ignition is great! Not sure if my issue was a fluke or not.....thanks", 'mr heater has a good reputation and is quality built.......', 'Love the hunting buddy heater works great no problems at all üíØ ++++ from me !! üëèüëèüëè told all my friends about it ! Lol it will work great in my hay bale blind', 'Works good heats up my 38" boat nicely and is economical when refilling the 1 lb tanks about $40 a month', "This heater is plenty warm for ground blinds and very quiet so it isn't heard by the deer/turkeys. That's even without the fan which will be good for ice fishing."]

column1: Comfort Zone Heater Garage Shop Utility Industrial Use 5000W 17000BTU 208/240V
column4: ["easy install, seems to be made well.  love the three heat settingsall parts were present and was packaged well. upon install, turned on power, turned thermostat knob and bam...had instant heat as I had expected...bring on the cold!!.however, one feature that I wish it had was a delayed fan off to cool the heating coils after use. when you rotate the thermostat knob, the fan shuts down immediately, leaving the hot coils to cool off too slowly. also, the unit I received didn't have a visible mark on the thermostat knob for easy identification of position (easily fixed). overall, nice product for the money", "So much easier than installing a gas furnace and vent.  Fan creates a full circular heat draft all the way around my 20x20 detached garage.  Heats up quickly and I can then turn it down.  Thermostat works well.  I had a 30 amp welder plug in a good location, so mounted it on the ceiling and used a 10' dryer plug cord.  Quick and easy installation.  Should have done this years ago.  No more freezing with a little space heater.", 'I recommend knowledg√§ble HVAC guy to add the external thermostat if you need one.  I have high ceilings and wanted to use my mouting system that √¢ttaches to the walls in a corner - no ceiling holes, but two nights of engineering the aluminum mounts.  Hester has been set on low since I installed it and let the Honeywell electronic thermost√¢t do the work.  Waiting for √£ heating bill to begin tuning it for optim√£l settings depending on weather.  But garage can get hot it works so well.', "I purchased this heater to use in a 666 sq ft, 4-car, uninsulated, vaulted ceiling garage.  Obviously this is meant to be used in a smaller, more insulated setting.  I wanted to try just one first, and then add as necessary.The heater itself seems to be well-built as far as structure, and designed well as far as installation and operation.  Including running wiring and building a wall mount (vaulted ceiling so no ceiling studs), it took 2-3hrs to get up and running.In my large uninsulated setting, over the course of 3-4hrs, it was able to raise the temperature from 25*F to 45*F, roughly speaking.  In other words, from intolerable to tolerable.  Which is about what I expected from it.  I think it would do quite well at maintaining a higher temperature if I were to use my propane 'salamander' to initially heat the space.Based on other's reviews and my own experience, there seems to be a major quality control concern in the assembly line for these regarding the fan nut.  I was unaware of this until after it was installed, but I'm almost certain I have the same issue as almost everyone else.  Before mounting the heater there was a nut and washer rattling around inside.  After a semi-thorough check, I figured it was an erroneous leftover.  Having read the reviews and after hearing a small rattle when the heater runs, I will be dismounting and tearing it down to install that nut properly.  This is both an inconvenience and really a potential danger.  For that I've removed a star from the rating.That being said, I will be purchasing another one, possibly two more.  Can't beat the price to performance ratio anywhere.Edit from the future:  I bought another one, slightly updated since the first.  This one had no problems and even runs quieter.  Awesome.", "This heater does a great job heating my 24'x30' insulated shop. I have it on a Honeywell line thermostat, and typically keep it at 40* to keep water lines from freezing, but when I'm ready to work in the ship I just turn it up and in 20 minutes it's nice and toasty. The other day it was 30* outside, but on high this ran for less than 5 minutes every 20-30 minutes.The only potential negative to be aware of is that it has a slight whistle when it's running. It's enough that I think about it every time it starts up, but it's not enough to be a nuisance.Overall I'm very happy with my purchase; it was easy to install, and is cost-effective for the job I needed it to do.", "Fast shipping.Well packaged.All metal construction.Enough detail in instructions,easily installed,best of all:heater works great.No issues so far.I heat a decent size 2 car garage and this is all I need.Recomend a ceiling fan to force the heat down,same thing with all of 'em.I can not stand beneath this heater when it is on high,it is way beyond my expectations.It is not very big or impressive,but do not let that part fool ya,it is a good heater.I have left the thermostat inside the heater,so far this is working fine.", 'I have used 4 times now and I really like it. If you have a insulated two car garage this heater will do the job nicely.It only took about 30 minutes to go from 30¬∞ to  62¬∞ in an hour it was 71¬∞ had to turn it down to work though. I like it 57¬∞ to 63¬∞ when working on a project. This heater is perfect for my needs. Little less than $100 too!üëç', "I'm happy with this heater and wish I'd found it years ago. I installed it in my basement workshop and it is way better than the big baseboard heater and kerosene heater I'd been using for many years. It's quiet and easy to install and heats the basement better than I'd anticipated. The workmanship and quality are great and I especially like that the sheet metal parts are post painted as opposed to crummy pre-paint and so all the sheet metal cut edges and corners are painted and nice and smooth and burr free.", 'I use this heater turned down low just to knock the edge off the cold so I can work comfortably in my 3 car garage shop.  I have it set on about 1/3 of its capacity and it keeps the garage at about 55- 60, the way I like it.  If I were to turn it up on high it would make the garage toasty warm.  The installation was straight forward and simple.  I bought a plug, 15 ft. of 10-3 service cord and a cord grip to make the installation. I plug it into my 220 volt welder receptacle when I want to have heat.  Wish I had found it years ago.', 'Great heat output, replaced my floor oil heater and small plug in with this one.  Only reason I gave it a 4 not 5 is that # 1 the fan blade was loose when I got it and the simple mechanism makes a rattling noise that is not necessary.  It only has a moving fan part but is kinda noisy.  Heats very well.']

column1: Gas Heater Mr. Heater 18,000 BTU Propane Cabinet Portable Odorless Durable Tank
column4: ['I\'ve wrestled with the heating options for my sun room since my wife and daughter through out my "old" kerosene heaters.  I considered the small propane table top heaters but my wife nixed that idea.  The typical outdoor 8 foot high propane heaters would have probably have drawn to much oxygen from the 13\' X 20\' sun room.  As I searched for other heating options, I came across this heater that stored a 20 lb. tank and made it look aesthetically pleasing.  It provides the right amount of heat for various atmospheric conditions!', 'We use the heater to supplement our fuel oil furnace. Works great to give a shot of heat while maintaining an overall lower temperature while we are gone', 'We got the heater shortly before Christmas 2017 here in Texas. Same day it arrived we had a freeze. Heater was installed in a converted barn and temp got up to about 75 in 15min or so. We have been using it for about a week now in below freezing temps with no issues other than it takes a few clicks to get the pilot to light. With all 3 burners going I pointed my temp gun at the front. My gun only goes to 1,000 deg and the heater is over that.', "Great heater for my garage/workshop.  The heater puts out enough heat to warm up my 24' x x24' garage on a cold winters day (in Michigan).  With it's 3 settings (Lo, Med & Hi) I start on Hi to raise the temp, then I set it to Lo to maintain temp.  I like the idea that the LP tank is built into the heater (instead of a separate tank and extension hose).  It makes the heater easy to roll around the shop and set it where the heat is needed.  I've had no issues with it not starting or operating properly.All in all, this is one great little portable heater.  I'd definitely but it again.", 'It is exactly what we needed. Works great and heats fast. Great product.', 'It is used every day sometimes three or four times to take the chill off in my 14 x 30 cabin. Fifteen min. or so is all it takes even when it is 12 fa outside. Wish I had it last year. Thanks Mr Heater !', "I've had this heater for a month now and have used it in my garage. It works great in the garage even when it was 20 degrees outside. On high, I have to sit about 2 feet away or I start to get too hot. I normally turn it to medium setting once I start getting hot. It takes about 5 minutes to get up to full heat, and very minimum fumes.  I'm still using my first tank of gas! I love this heater!", 'This heater holds a 20-pound propane tank. It does a good job of providing radiant heat. The pilot light ignites automatically, making the heater easy to use. I am happy with it, although I have used it only three times so far.', 'fast shipping and heats up the area we needed it for quit fast', 'Works great, Gives off perfect amount of heat with the three settings.Recommended to anyone that is cold, and on a budget for heat.I first learned of these while in Greece in the navy. we used them over winter, where the climate was not so cold, but, you still needed something for quick heat to take the chill off.']

column1: Dr Infrared Heater DR-122 Bedbug Heater with Thermometer and Timer, Big, Black
column4: ["The unit was easy to assemble and we had it quickly up and running in 20 minutes. The quality of components and hardware is good and the instructions were easy to follow. The deciding factor in purchasing this unit was that it ran off of one 110v outlet. Other units that we looked at required multiple circuits (one required 4).In regard to negative feedback, it is nominal but the S clips that hold the center racks in place are very loose and it would be nice if Dr. Infrared would design them a little bit more rigid. The temp gauge/meter is of good quality but you need to understand that the timer counts back and not forward as to how long the unit has been on.We deal with bed bugs daily at our men's homeless shelter and it is so nice to take their belongings and quickly bake the little buggers out in under two hours. We are seriously thinking about getting a couple more tents in the near future.", "Although I am grateful for a solution that doesn't cost thousands of dollars I have three complaints about this bed bug heater:1. The instructions are cursory, especially given how concerned most users will be to do things correctly, and the diagrams for assembly are faint. A link to a video would be great.2. The hooks to hold the shelves on WILL NOT fit in half the holes pre-drilled in the poles. And I mean WILL NOT with the force of two adults twisting and grunting in awkward physical positions. The holes are simply inadequately made. Note that I did get the other half in, so it is not that I cannot figure out how to do it, although a better diagram and an explanation would have helped see complaint #1.3. It takes HOURS to heat up to 120F and it's a really hot summer here! Would have been nice to know that. See #1.A minor disappointment is that the timer has no presets. A huge design bonus would be if the thermometre-timer could shut off the heater at the appropriate time. One really has to monitor over a period of hours, and can't using it overnight.", 'Does the job well, easy set up. You can put so much inside and price was cheaper than most.', 'TOOK SOME TIME TO FIGURE OUT THE SEQUENCE TO PUT TOGETHER.  ONCE WE RE-ASSEMBLED IT A COUPLE OF TIMES IT ALL CAME TOGETHER.', "Worked one time and wouldn't turn on again after that.", 'Everything top  notch', 'POOR']

column1: Hs1500phxwifi Infrared Heater Wifi Wall Mounted
column4: ['This wall furnace is made well and works perfect. Select what ever temp you want and when it reaches that it reduces power by 50 %. All automatic. It heats the room over my garage which is all finished and insulated and is 14 x 26. 364 sf. I wouldnt ask 4 anymore than that. Im in the state of Maine. I may need to add another to bring  the temp up quickly but im sure one of these will maintain from that point. For a 104 bucks you cant beat it. Oh and it eather hangs on wall or it has casters you can install. I hung mine and love it.', 'I used this in my insulated 500sq ft garage. Does a great job. In below freezing temps, warms it up to 50 degrees in only one hour. Perfect for just keeping the garage above freezing.', 'I love the WIFI feature and the heat is perfect for my 525sf space', 'I use this heater in a 250 square foot room and it works very well.It was easy to connect to wifi. I would highly recommend it.', 'Had a issue with my unit but they were quick with helping me out and getting things straightened out. Great heater that works amazingly for a great value.', 'Excellent product, easy mounting, works very well for the size', 'These are great little heaters! And at the best price! Looks good hanging on the wall and out of the way. Perfect for a bathroom.', "i use 2 of these to warm a 2.5 car garage . it does a nice job , quiet , remote control  . temps in NY are in the 30's", 'It‚Äôs a great little heater I put in my fish house/Camper! The remote works awesome too I couldn‚Äôt be happy would definitely recommend!', 'This is a great product for the value. Works flawless with my echo and heats up my bathroom perfectly. I would definitely recommend this product.']

column1: WHT FAN/WALL HEATER
column4: ["It was replacing an aged wall heater that had finally given up the ghost. It was a 1500 watt model, but after installing the Com-Pak, that was only 1000 watts, it's output was higher. And it's construction was obviously of high higher quality.  And it is much quieter than old was, even when it was new. Only problem I had was it was slightly smaller to fit into the original hole in the wall.  Not the fault of the heater. I'm a bit of a handy-man so just shimmed the hole and trimmed it with some molding and it looks pretty good.", 'I have been dealing with electrical items and electricity for 60 years, andthis heater beats any I have ever dealt with. To be as small as it is, easy to mount,,but the most important thing is 2000 watts and only pulling 8.3 amps seems unreal. Most electric heaters 120 v, 1500 watts pull 12...I have just ordered another one and plan on another. A great item, ', 'Purchased five units to heat a few rooms in my vacation home and these were perfect. Very easy to install and works well. Has a built in thermostat.', "small and neat looking. easy to install (BUT WAS REPLACING A DIFFERENT UNIT, SO NO EXTRA WIRING WAS REQUIRED). don't know how it performs yet, as it's not cold out, but easy to operate.", 'Overheat protection device broke on my very similar older style unit.  New unit allowed me to use old mounting and grill after some cutting. New units do not have the same overheat protector.  New unit has much smaller grill which I did not need.', 'Powerful unit, yet small in size. Does exact what we got it for. Bath room early showers are comfortable now. We run it about 10 minutes.', 'The product arrived in excellent condition and performed as needed.  The correct wattages has kept the room very comfortable', 'Installed heater without any problems. It works like a charm!', 'The one I have stopped functioning, so I had to replace it with same.', 'I was very satisfied with this heater. The fan is very powerful and it heat up really fast. Really liked it. Yes I would recommendThis product.']

column1: Mr. Heater Portable Propane Buddy Heater MH 9BX 4,000-9000 BTU Indoor Safe
column4: ["I bought this heater for my small garage workshop. My electric heater kept tripping the breaker while using other equipment. I was afraid of other gas heaters due to their carbon monoxide emissions. This was one of the few gas heaters rated for indoor use. It also has an oxygen depletion detector and tip over cut off feature which I thought was very important.This heater silently keeps my shop warm in even the coldest temperatures and can also be attached to a 20 pound propane tank with an accessory hose ~ which I also purchased. I've run this heater for up to 6 hours uninterrupted with no noticeable fumes and since all the heat is focused out the front, it can be set close to a wall with no worries.I know I'm going to get a lot of use out of this heater. It was a very reasonable price and filled my needs perfectly. Highly recomend the Mr. Heater Buddy for heating small spaces.", 'Here in Monterey County the weather can be colder in the evenings. At my home we cut of the central heating back in ‚Äò88 so we all dress up like eskimos to keep warm. Don‚Äôt get me wrong. We do use electric heaters in certain areas but after purchasing this Portable Propane heater, it was Heaven sent. I recommend this product with all my heart. It is compact. It is durable. It is easy to refuel. It is warm to hot. And now, as we speak, the 5 ft extension hose just arrived. When connected from my Gas Buddy to a 20 lb propane tank, I should get at least 24 hrs of constant heat. Thank you for your time. ', 'The last power outage we only had kerosene heaters.  They are big, bulky, heavy, require pouring fuel and the fumes left us wheezing and coughing.  Therefore, we found these Mr. Heater, bought two and what a difference.  Small enough to be moved from room to room and so much safer.  You will love Mr Heater.', "Small and practical for portable heat when equipped with a disposable bottle, it's even great for a more permanent heat source - just pair this heater up with a hose and a large refillable propane bottle.  It even has a pilot light for easy on and off use.  Two heat settings, 4000 and 9000 BTUs.  The back of the heater stays cool to the touch, so it can be used backed against a wall.  Six stars for this heater.", 'Really nice heater. Relatively easy to operate and has safety features. Heater will not run all night, though with the small propane cylinders. ', "Love this portable propane heater. Can't wait to take it camping. In the meantime, we use it around the house to warm up and enjoy the heat it produces. If the power goes out, we will stay warm with this heater!", "This is a very good product.  What is different about Mr. Heater compared to other small heaters is that it uses 1 lb. propane tanks, thus it does not have to be plugged in or placed near an electrical outlet.  It is easy to use and have a anti tip safety feature that will cut the unit off if the unit is tipped.  Keep on hand a few 1 lb. propane cylinders, and you're good to go.  Very good heater for small spaces and can be used indoors.", 'Great propane heater with 2 settings. I also bought a 12ft hose to connect to a 5 Gallon propane tank. The low setting was enough to warm my 29ft motor home. Perfect.', 'Purchased the additional Mr. Heater 10\' hose (item F273704) that you don\'t have to use a filter and connected it to a 20 lb. bottle of propane.   Easy to light and ran all night on low to keep my greenhouse warm.  I used a 1.5" PVC water pipe and ran the pipe under the foundation of my greenhouse and then ran the hose through it outside where the tank was located.  For safety reasons, you aren\'t supposed to have the 20 lb. tank inside near the heater.  I cut up an old wash cloth and stuck it inside the pvc pipe to keep bugs and cold air from entering into my greenhouse. So easy to do.  ', 'Product operates exactly as advertised, which nowadays is not always the case. It functions easily and simply. Really like the option to go to larger capacity tank for longer use periods or not having to change out bottles constantly.']

column1: Comfort Zone CZ220  5000  Watts Fan-Forced Ceiling Mount Heater 240 V
column4: ["easy install, seems to be made well.  love the three heat settingsall parts were present and was packaged well. upon install, turned on power, turned thermostat knob and bam...had instant heat as I had expected...bring on the cold!!.however, one feature that I wish it had was a delayed fan off to cool the heating coils after use. when you rotate the thermostat knob, the fan shuts down immediately, leaving the hot coils to cool off too slowly. also, the unit I received didn't have a visible mark on the thermostat knob for easy identification of position (easily fixed). overall, nice product for the money", "So much easier than installing a gas furnace and vent.  Fan creates a full circular heat draft all the way around my 20x20 detached garage.  Heats up quickly and I can then turn it down.  Thermostat works well.  I had a 30 amp welder plug in a good location, so mounted it on the ceiling and used a 10' dryer plug cord.  Quick and easy installation.  Should have done this years ago.  No more freezing with a little space heater.", 'I recommend knowledg√§ble HVAC guy to add the external thermostat if you need one.  I have high ceilings and wanted to use my mouting system that √¢ttaches to the walls in a corner - no ceiling holes, but two nights of engineering the aluminum mounts.  Hester has been set on low since I installed it and let the Honeywell electronic thermost√¢t do the work.  Waiting for √£ heating bill to begin tuning it for optim√£l settings depending on weather.  But garage can get hot it works so well.', "I purchased this heater to use in a 666 sq ft, 4-car, uninsulated, vaulted ceiling garage.  Obviously this is meant to be used in a smaller, more insulated setting.  I wanted to try just one first, and then add as necessary.The heater itself seems to be well-built as far as structure, and designed well as far as installation and operation.  Including running wiring and building a wall mount (vaulted ceiling so no ceiling studs), it took 2-3hrs to get up and running.In my large uninsulated setting, over the course of 3-4hrs, it was able to raise the temperature from 25*F to 45*F, roughly speaking.  In other words, from intolerable to tolerable.  Which is about what I expected from it.  I think it would do quite well at maintaining a higher temperature if I were to use my propane 'salamander' to initially heat the space.Based on other's reviews and my own experience, there seems to be a major quality control concern in the assembly line for these regarding the fan nut.  I was unaware of this until after it was installed, but I'm almost certain I have the same issue as almost everyone else.  Before mounting the heater there was a nut and washer rattling around inside.  After a semi-thorough check, I figured it was an erroneous leftover.  Having read the reviews and after hearing a small rattle when the heater runs, I will be dismounting and tearing it down to install that nut properly.  This is both an inconvenience and really a potential danger.  For that I've removed a star from the rating.That being said, I will be purchasing another one, possibly two more.  Can't beat the price to performance ratio anywhere.Edit from the future:  I bought another one, slightly updated since the first.  This one had no problems and even runs quieter.  Awesome.", "This heater does a great job heating my 24'x30' insulated shop. I have it on a Honeywell line thermostat, and typically keep it at 40* to keep water lines from freezing, but when I'm ready to work in the ship I just turn it up and in 20 minutes it's nice and toasty. The other day it was 30* outside, but on high this ran for less than 5 minutes every 20-30 minutes.The only potential negative to be aware of is that it has a slight whistle when it's running. It's enough that I think about it every time it starts up, but it's not enough to be a nuisance.Overall I'm very happy with my purchase; it was easy to install, and is cost-effective for the job I needed it to do.", "Fast shipping.Well packaged.All metal construction.Enough detail in instructions,easily installed,best of all:heater works great.No issues so far.I heat a decent size 2 car garage and this is all I need.Recomend a ceiling fan to force the heat down,same thing with all of 'em.I can not stand beneath this heater when it is on high,it is way beyond my expectations.It is not very big or impressive,but do not let that part fool ya,it is a good heater.I have left the thermostat inside the heater,so far this is working fine.", 'I have used 4 times now and I really like it. If you have a insulated two car garage this heater will do the job nicely.It only took about 30 minutes to go from 30¬∞ to  62¬∞ in an hour it was 71¬∞ had to turn it down to work though. I like it 57¬∞ to 63¬∞ when working on a project. This heater is perfect for my needs. Little less than $100 too!üëç', "I'm happy with this heater and wish I'd found it years ago. I installed it in my basement workshop and it is way better than the big baseboard heater and kerosene heater I'd been using for many years. It's quiet and easy to install and heats the basement better than I'd anticipated. The workmanship and quality are great and I especially like that the sheet metal parts are post painted as opposed to crummy pre-paint and so all the sheet metal cut edges and corners are painted and nice and smooth and burr free.", 'I use this heater turned down low just to knock the edge off the cold so I can work comfortably in my 3 car garage shop.  I have it set on about 1/3 of its capacity and it keeps the garage at about 55- 60, the way I like it.  If I were to turn it up on high it would make the garage toasty warm.  The installation was straight forward and simple.  I bought a plug, 15 ft. of 10-3 service cord and a cord grip to make the installation. I plug it into my 220 volt welder receptacle when I want to have heat.  Wish I had found it years ago.', 'Great heat output, replaced my floor oil heater and small plug in with this one.  Only reason I gave it a 4 not 5 is that # 1 the fan blade was loose when I got it and the simple mechanism makes a rattling noise that is not necessary.  It only has a moving fan part but is kinda noisy.  Heats very well.']

column1: WHT FAN/WALL HEATER
column4: ["Product is as described. A 120-volt heater doesn't have the power to deliver heat that will melt the wall paint. It's fine to take the chill away from a small space. There's nothing innovative about this. Such items are much the same as they were decades ago. That's not bad.", 'This had not been indicated in the listing. Since it has not been yet installed in this location yet, I cannot give an accurate assessment of its quality.', 'As expected, works well.', 'Very quiet fan.  Decent air flow.  Used it for supplemental heat for sitting room. Highly recommend unit.', 'Keeps the bathroom warm on cold  winter mornings. Thanks. RS', 'As advertised.  easy to install. works great!', 'Very well made and easy to install.', 'Awesome product works great for size', 'eficient']

column1: Dyna-Glo - Tank Top Propane Gas Heater - 40,000 BTU - Portable - Outdoor Indoor
column4: ['This heater is easily assembled (mounting bracket) and attaches quickly to the propane tank.  If using outside, the heat disbursement can be a narrow range around the setup due to not having a large reflector above the unit. That being said, it still works well when gathered around it.  If using within a ventilated enclosure, such as a garage, this heater when warm the area quickly and keep it that way.  I have yet to use a complete tank with the unit but have put a lot of hours on it.  It seems to not consume propane as fast as I thought it might.. which is a pleasant surprise.', 'This is quite a useful unit. The 360¬∞ heat output is perfect for chilly outside events and for use in case of a power outage as a back up, temporary source of heat. Although the burner itself is covered you would need to keep small children in away to avoid burns if touched.', "Well, it was cold as heck at the last race event we had in Andalusia Alabama. I had to keep my truck running while I was there all day and sat in it between motos. I researched heaters from every avenue I could come up with. HF has a two head burner type that only points in one direction. Other resources sold the same 360 for what I'd consider too much expense. When I saw the price at an affordable cost via this ebay seller I jumped at it so fast I think Paypal felt the wind blowing. The shipping was faster that the ETA date which made it nice. Right now our weather reports conflict from one TV broadcast to the next. All I know is from what I read if it operates at all and I didn't buy a lemon then I feel like I am in luck. Needless to say I haven't used it yet. The weather report for this coming weekend 05 FEB 17 at GAMX in Andalusia doesn't have the temperature dropping to an uncomfortable low like our last event. I will still bring it because I have to be there before 7am so the temperature might be below 40 degrees. Which that might make me want to take it out of the box. One thing I am looking forward to is not having to stand by a bonfire and having the wind shift blow smoke in my face. I understand from what I read it could be possible to roast a mashmellow or cook a hotdog on a stick. But I think I am smart enough even though I live in the bottom of Alabama to step back from the heat at a comfortable distance. I did build a safety feature to hold the 20 lbs propane bottle upright using a stabilizer platform Lowes sold me attached to  a piece of plywood. I hope some person not paying attention doesn' t make a fool out of themselves or blow us all to smiterinez. My finger are starting to get writing cramps and my spell'g is fadin' plus I did the 1st thru the 6th grade twice. The school sytem gut tired of me sitten in class especially sinc I was bigger than the odder chilrenz. I tink I werz intemitaten the odder kids and sum of the mommies piken up there kids see to want to take me home for won reasen or aknotter. My ma and pa warned me about those kind of ladyz' and my giblets were rumbling with some sort of ovr pwerg  oh my lord what the heck am I writing", "the unit heats you at waist height so there no wasted fuel and the tip shut off is a great featureI'm going to buy a couple more they heat my hangar great", "I bought this heater for my un-insulated 14x24 foot shop. I've used a kerosene heater for years but when it really gets cold, it just doesn't cut it. I haven't used this Dyna-Glo a lot BUT  when you fire this up, it makes big heat RIGHT NOW! So far, the only drawback I see is that propane is a lot more expensive than kerosene. An $18 20lb bottle will last about 8 hours (I think) and the same time on my kerosene would cost about $5. I'll only use the propane when it's really cold. Bottom line is still....I'd recommend this heater.", 'The Dyna-Glo heater is the best gas heater i have ever owned. I use it to heat my garage when im gonna be out there working for any length of time. It heats my garage very fast. Before i would use my kerosene heater for this purpose and it would take around an hour whereas the Dyna-Glo only takes about 8 to 10 minutes. I tested them both at the same time the other day and the Dyna-Glo on the( low setting) was out heating the kerosene heater on high. This is a great heater, and without the strong kerosene smell. The Dyna-Glo is lightweight and very simple to use and burns very clean. Also has some great safety features and cools off fast after using. I may never use the kerosene heater again." Sorry ole Friend ".', 'Works great, wish it had an electronic start or even push button, but other than that, love it', 'This heater works PERFECTLY! There\'s a ton of heat generated by this unit which totally and pleasantly surprised me. I use it in my garage for a small gathering of adult beverage consumers and it really kept us warm. One little tip though and that is that so much heat rises from the top of this unit that I rigged a "hanging" dome (such as a Weber Grill type lid) about 2 feet above it to keep the heat at a lower level, and this also added a great hand warming option. PERFECT item!!!', 'I used it once.  It hooked up easily.  I had no problems lighting it.  It got hot like it should.', 'This heater is small but works big. It is easy to operate and works good . It was a good buy']
