column1: Cadet Electric Wall Heater 12" H x 9" W 120-Volt 1,500-Watt Compact White
column4: ['I have used this product for years. I originally had one in my small greenhouse but moved it into my bathroom. The family uses it to toast up the room before showers. I recently purchased another to put back into the greenhouse due to the extended cold weather this spring. My greenhouse is 10 X 8 and the heater has no problem keeping it warm.', "I installed this heater in my home brewery, which is 12'X15'. It is the quietest wall heater I have ever owned, and it puts out a lot of heat. Installation was a breeze, and it looks great.", 'This product seems to be a good value. Looks good in mounted in bathroom wall and provides heat as desired in bathroom.', 'The compact size is surely awesome and it puts out adequate heat I love it I would recommend it the price is affordable a lot of bang for the buck', "It was an exact replacement for an old one that had burnt out. Very easy to switch it out. It's nice to see they still make the heater and not replace it with a new cheap plastic thing.", 'Great unit. Good quality. Easy to install.', 'Heats quickly and is small enough to blend in', 'excellent product ese to install and good price', 'Great little heater for small room.', 'awesome heater']

column1: Stiebel Eltron 074058 120-Volt 1500-Watts Heater
column4: ['When I bought my business, the 4 restrooms were heated only with surface mounted electric heaters. It seemed like I was replacing one at least every 2 years. They were poorly made, noisy, and had to be run with a separate thermostat that also was prone to fail.Then I bought the Stiebel Eltron. It is quiet, attractive looking, works GREAT, and has the thermostat built in. The quality is outstanding. I plan on replacing all of them with these. (And for comparison the cost is only slightly higher.)', 'Very simple to install and provides fairly even heat in a small room or additional heat in areas that need it when extremely cold outside . This is the second unit I bought and would not hesitate to purchase again .', 'Worked well, from the reviews I was expecting better than ones at 1/2 the price.   If the fan produced more volume it might have made the difference.  ', 'Looks great mounted on wall in my studio. Easy to hook up.', 'The best love it.', 'This is not a large heater, but it is just right for my needs.It will heat one small bedroom or bath with ease.Theromostat works great on this unit.Easy to install.This unit is has a sound level, I would say is very low.', "Exactly as described. But it doesn't come with electrical cord. So plan on supplying your own.", 'Great little heater. easy to install andlooks great!']

column1: Mr. Heater MH9BX 9000 BTU Propane Portable Buddy Heater, MH9BX New
column4: ["I bought this heater for my small garage workshop. My electric heater kept tripping the breaker while using other equipment. I was afraid of other gas heaters due to their carbon monoxide emissions. This was one of the few gas heaters rated for indoor use. It also has an oxygen depletion detector and tip over cut off feature which I thought was very important.This heater silently keeps my shop warm in even the coldest temperatures and can also be attached to a 20 pound propane tank with an accessory hose ~ which I also purchased. I've run this heater for up to 6 hours uninterrupted with no noticeable fumes and since all the heat is focused out the front, it can be set close to a wall with no worries.I know I'm going to get a lot of use out of this heater. It was a very reasonable price and filled my needs perfectly. Highly recomend the Mr. Heater Buddy for heating small spaces.", 'Here in Monterey County the weather can be colder in the evenings. At my home we cut of the central heating back in ‚Äò88 so we all dress up like eskimos to keep warm. Don‚Äôt get me wrong. We do use electric heaters in certain areas but after purchasing this Portable Propane heater, it was Heaven sent. I recommend this product with all my heart. It is compact. It is durable. It is easy to refuel. It is warm to hot. And now, as we speak, the 5 ft extension hose just arrived. When connected from my Gas Buddy to a 20 lb propane tank, I should get at least 24 hrs of constant heat. Thank you for your time. ', 'The last power outage we only had kerosene heaters.  They are big, bulky, heavy, require pouring fuel and the fumes left us wheezing and coughing.  Therefore, we found these Mr. Heater, bought two and what a difference.  Small enough to be moved from room to room and so much safer.  You will love Mr Heater.', "Small and practical for portable heat when equipped with a disposable bottle, it's even great for a more permanent heat source - just pair this heater up with a hose and a large refillable propane bottle.  It even has a pilot light for easy on and off use.  Two heat settings, 4000 and 9000 BTUs.  The back of the heater stays cool to the touch, so it can be used backed against a wall.  Six stars for this heater.", 'Really nice heater. Relatively easy to operate and has safety features. Heater will not run all night, though with the small propane cylinders. ', "Love this portable propane heater. Can't wait to take it camping. In the meantime, we use it around the house to warm up and enjoy the heat it produces. If the power goes out, we will stay warm with this heater!", "This is a very good product.  What is different about Mr. Heater compared to other small heaters is that it uses 1 lb. propane tanks, thus it does not have to be plugged in or placed near an electrical outlet.  It is easy to use and have a anti tip safety feature that will cut the unit off if the unit is tipped.  Keep on hand a few 1 lb. propane cylinders, and you're good to go.  Very good heater for small spaces and can be used indoors.", 'Great propane heater with 2 settings. I also bought a 12ft hose to connect to a 5 Gallon propane tank. The low setting was enough to warm my 29ft motor home. Perfect.', 'Purchased the additional Mr. Heater 10\' hose (item F273704) that you don\'t have to use a filter and connected it to a 20 lb. bottle of propane.   Easy to light and ran all night on low to keep my greenhouse warm.  I used a 1.5" PVC water pipe and ran the pipe under the foundation of my greenhouse and then ran the hose through it outside where the tank was located.  For safety reasons, you aren\'t supposed to have the 20 lb. tank inside near the heater.  I cut up an old wash cloth and stuck it inside the pvc pipe to keep bugs and cold air from entering into my greenhouse. So easy to do.  ', 'Product operates exactly as advertised, which nowadays is not always the case. It functions easily and simply. Really like the option to go to larger capacity tank for longer use periods or not having to change out bottles constantly.']

column1: Mr. Heater Corporation Convection Heater 75k to 200 BTU/HR
column4: ["I have a 24x30 building 720sq ft it got it up to 75 to 80 in about 30mins its really loud on low. I think it's to much heater for my garage its putting out to much gas fumes for this garbage. I would recommend the 80,000 btu for this size of garage.", "Works great. I have a 1200 square ft shop and it can heat it up in about 20 minutes on low. The only bad thing I would say is, it is loud and if you have a t.v. or radio in your shop you can't hear it. If you hook up surround sound then you probably could hear a tv then", 'Two connections easy instructions and started up on the first push! No matches just set on lowest setting and ignite. I left it on low the first time it works fast.', 'Perfect find for my large work shed...', "This is one of the best outdoor  Heaters I ever had don't take long for it to get warm inside give it a 5 star.", 'this unit is high quality strongly built and adjusts to fit demand I would recommend this to any and all construction outfits for it is dependable and of top quality. I also recommend this because the company who ships it is fast friendly and honest.', "This heater is amazing keeps my garage very warm in the cold Colorado winter days and also works great to cook with while I'm camping. ", 'excellent source of heat for my garage, works great', 'This heater is very compact , an hears my 3 car garage up n minutes on the lowest setting ! I would recommend this too anyone .', 'works very well,heats up room fast,great price']

column1: Mr Heater F299710 Vent-Free Blue Flame Propane Gas Heater, 10,000 BTU
column4: ["I have used a Mr. Heater radiant ng 30k for years, the LP models are the same high quality.  The blue flame is perfect for my non-drafty house. Follow the instructions and don't hesitate to call the manufacturer if you have any questions, these are easy and worry free.", 'Great little heater, heats good, burns clean.  Used a 5 ft. hose with a regulator, a 3/8 inch brass street elbow and a brass 3/8 inch NPT (pipe thread) to 3/8 inch flare adapter attached to a 20 LP tank.  Works great on low (7000 BTU) or high (10000 BTU).', "This is my 1st ventless propane heater, it REALLY puts out heat for only a 10,000 btu, I had some problems with it shutting itself off at first, but found opening a small window works ( the ODS system is very sensitive, I live in a 26' 5th wheel older camper, with big windows, and drafty so I thought air would not be an issue, but need window left open )  my only regret is not getting one with a thermostat, which few 10k btu's seem to have, but 18k and up do, we are having a mild winter, and I usually do not even put on high, just leave it on low, but if it was bad winter I'd probably need a larger model, or would have to leave this one on high constantly. ( our mild winter has just been no colder than single digits, maybe one night has been 0 F , and many nights have been teens, and 20's )", 'Awesome heater, the seller dont communicate well but its a store so I distant expect much, other reviews says missing parts but to use it on the propane side you will need a .80 cent brass adapter at any hardware store to use the Mr heater hose adapter, they is a kit that Mr heater sells to get the heater operational on propane for $50 if I find it cheaper ill post it but this product is fine and advertised to exactly what your getting. It says propane or natural gas..propane takes a few more dollars to setup where gas is plug and play', "This heater doesn't come with propane regulator, hose or the 3/8-Inch male pipe to 3/8-Inch male flare propane heater adapter.", "Unit works fine , just wasn't big enough for the 22' x 24' garage. no problem, I'll put another on other side of workshop.", 'Installing heater was a major pain because, we had to re-thread the regulator and there were numerous gas leaks..  We would not recommend this product to friends.', 'Great heater, easy to read directions. Easy to light. Maintains a blue clean flame for knocking chill off in my garage. ', 'Good value works great.  Next time buy the model that has an automatic thermostat.', "This product has know handle to move it around.  You don't dare wall mout it as the heat flows straight up and will catch things on fire.  I have a 5th wheel toy hauler with 9 foot ceilings.  All the heat goes straight up to the ceiling then to the front of the 5th wheel.  Know warmth in down stairs area even if you place it right in front of you."]

Follow the instructions and don't hesitate to call the manufacturer if you have any questions, these are easy and worry free.", 'Great little heater, heats good, burns clean.  Used a 5 ft. hose with a regulator, a 3/8 inch brass street elbow and a brass 3/8 inch NPT (pipe thread) to 3/8 inch flare adapter attached to a 20 LP tank.  Works great on low (7000 BTU) or high (10000 BTU).', "This is my 1st ventless propane heater, it REALLY puts out heat for only a 10,000 btu, I had some problems with it shutting itself off at first, but found opening a small window works ( the ODS system is very sensitive, I live in a 26' 5th wheel older camper, with big windows, and drafty so I thought air would not be an issue, but need window left open )  my only regret is not getting one with a thermostat, which few 10k btu's seem to have, but 18k and up do, we are having a mild winter, and I usually do not even put on high, just leave it on low, but if it was bad winter I'd probably need a larger model, or would have to leave this one on high constantly. ( our mild winter has just been no colder than single digits, maybe one night has been 0 F , and many nights have been teens, and 20's )", 'Awesome heater, the seller dont communicate well but its a store so I distant expect much, other reviews says missing parts but to use it on the propane side you will need a .80 cent brass adapter at any hardware store to use the Mr heater hose adapter, they is a kit that Mr heater sells to get the heater operational on propane for $50 if I find it cheaper ill post it but this product is fine and advertised to exactly what your getting. It says propane or natural gas..propane takes a few more dollars to setup where gas is plug and play', "This heater doesn't come with propane regulator, hose or the 3/8-Inch male pipe to 3/8-Inch male flare propane heater adapter.", "Unit works fine , just wasn't big enough for the 22' x 24' garage. no problem, I'll put another on other side of workshop.", 'Installing heater was a major pain because, we had to re-thread the regulator and there were numerous gas leaks..  We would not recommend this product to friends.', 'Great heater, easy to read directions. Easy to light. Maintains a blue clean flame for knocking chill off in my garage. ', 'Good value works great.  Next time buy the model that has an automatic thermostat.', "This product has know handle to move it around.  You don't dare wall mout it as the heat flows straight up and will catch things on fire.  I have a 5th wheel toy hauler with 9 foot ceilings.  All the heat goes straight up to the ceiling then to the front of the 5th wheel.  Know warmth in down stairs area even if you place it right in front of you."]

column1: Mr. Heater F274805 Big Buddy Propane Portable Heater, 18000 BTU
column4: ["This heater is fairly large.  Don't expect it to fit under your legs in the bleachers.  The handle is really handy, but makes it pretty tall.This heater is very versatile. It can be like the smaller versions with just one element on at half power, full power, or both elements on full power.  It goes through propane about the same as all the other ones I've seen, and full power is a lot of power.  The fan (powered by D cells) blows warm air in your direction, which is nice because otherwise it just goes straight up.IMHO it's way handier than the smaller bottle mounted version because it doesn't tip easily and it's not as tall.  It puts the heat in a better location.It's not a small heater, but is powerful, well built, and looks like it will last.", 'this id the 2nd one I have owned  first one was 5 years old and used every day it was cold it keeps our coach warm enough on low  and very economicl to run do recomend getting the hose with regolator and using a 20 pound bbq grill tank outside  and keeping a couple of the one pound throw aways in reserve incase of a midnight run out of gas senero , teriffic for those emergencies and blizzards requires no electric to run just a couple batteries to run the fan but will still  produce  het with out fan not operating . has the o2 depletion piliot light that lifts off if o2 level gets to low plus tip switch incase it gets tipped over by accident , Like any heating device care should be taken to assure you are opperating it in a safe manner and following the instructions that states the clearences on ll sides ', 'Current house furnace is out and this unit has filled in amazingly well.  Live in MN and have 2 of these with a couple electric room heaters for 2000 sqft plus home and been heating for a month.  Do recommend the 20# Walmart propane tanks w/ gauge for $48 and conversion hose to unit for more economical heating that the small canisters.  CAn heat for nearly a week.  Have CO monitor and never have had it go off once.  They are made to be CO free .  We do not leave them running when not home for safety reason but never yet had an issue.  ', 'I bought this to be able to work in my 2 car garage during cold days. It works very well. The only drawback I could see is that the fan moves very little air. Otherwise, I would have given it a 5 star rating....  Made the garage able to be worked in with no jacket in about 2 hours (on a 15 degree day)  Well worth it...   And would be great thing to have if an ice storm hits and the power (heat) went out...  Costs less than a buck an hour worth of propane to run on High.  I bought a 15 lb tank and ran it for about 18 hours.....    I plan on getting a couple of portable 1 lb bottles and a refill adapter.....', 'Got Mr. Heater for a heater in my outside work area and as an emergency backup heater in case of power failure in a storm or the heat pump went bad in middle of winter. Works perfect and am using hooked up to 20lb propane tank and also little 1lb tanks. Either way is working perfect.  This thing will run you out of house on 18,000 btu setting.  Always vent from a window or door to keep oxygen fresh and will be good for indoor use, you will still be plenty warm and no worries about any pipes freezing. Great product', "This little heater is just the ticket for quickly warming up our home on those chilly mornings. ,I live where we seldom get any colder than 40 degrees at night , we don't run any heater at night for safety reasons ,although I feel this heater is safer than any electric one , no cords to overheat . I turn it on in the morning and in 15 minutes the chill is taken off the house. I use a small fan to circulate the heat more than the one that comes with the heater which is efficient for one room.  I also purchased the 12 foot hose and regulator so I can hook to a 30 lbs bottle out side the house. just ran the hose through an existing tv cable  hole. I can get about a week of heat out of one bottle at 16.00 to refill. That is much cheaper than running electric space heaters.", "The dogs and I have a very comfortable warm environment now that the heater is able to be used. They are so happy that the inside of the motorhome is a lot more comfortable. We have been having nights that are in the upper twenties and low 30s so we're really grateful to have a heater the prize this my cheat on low setting it it basically heats the Whole 30 ft motorhome it generates more than enough heat on low and will run for a hundred hours on that setting .  It is very warm at got my  farm in Coupeville Washington. thanks a lot for a great item!!", 'I\'ve been hunting deer for 42 years now and never worried about the cold weather when I was younger, mostly because pop-up portable blinds and portable heaters like these were not available back then. But my youngest daughter started hunting with me 6 years ago and after watching her brave a particularly cold opening day her first year I decided there had to be a better setup so she could enjoy going with me and I could insure I would get to continue to enjoy spending such moments with her, so I bought my first ground blind and my first Mr. Heater Little Buddy heater, and closing weekend of rifle season was soooooo much more enjoyable. Having a heat source to warm our feet made all the difference in the world being able to sit beside my daughter and just watch her scan our surroundings for her first deer, and did she take a beauty! After realizing how great the difference in the experience having shelter and heat made, I broke down and bought blinds for my Dad, nephew, and great friend who owns the property where we hunt, and then decided everyone should be able to stay warm and enjoy their time in the field as well, so I retired my Little Buddy heater and bought three of the Buddy heaters and one of the heater/cooker models and stocked each blind with a heater. The difference between the Little Buddy and the bigger Buddy models is very noticeably different! Running the bigger Buddy heaters warmed up a two person ground blind sufficiently enough to allow us to take off our coats, even with several windows open, and sit comfortably without creating undue noise or alerts to the deer as we watched many feed and browse around in the field in front of us. Hunting went from a cold and trying event to a greatly enjoyed experience spending time with my daughter, my Dad, my nephew, and friend! I\'ve always said a bad day hunting or fishing is better than a good day working anytime, but having Mr. Heater Buddy heaters warming our ground blinds has made such a difference in our time spent together so much more enjoyable that now my oldest daughter is joining in, and that alone made any expense paid for the equipment one of my best investments! Funny story: My Dad was using the heater I put in the blind he was using and after spending the morning hunting we all went to breakfast and I asked him how well he liked having heat, and his reply was, "great for about 20 minutes and then the damned thing quit and wouldn\'t re-light!" I asked him if he had opened any windows and he said "no, it wasn\'t light yet so I was just enjoying staying warm, until the heater went out!" I started laughing and he was taken aback by my reaction and asked why I was laughing, had I played a joke and given him the junk heater? I said no and told him he should be thankful Mr. Heater saved his life! Not knowing what I was referring to he had a puzzled look on his face, so I told him that the heater has a low oxygen sensor built into it and because he had the windows closed up fresh air could not circulate through the blind and the heater shut off before he could pass out from carbon monoxide poisoning! The look on his face was priceless! All he could say was "glad someone was looking out for him." After breakfast and getting some chores done we all went back to our blinds and my Dad made sure he opened some windows and lit the heater, and spent the rest of the day happy and warm. Moral of the story: The safety features built into Mr. Heater heaters work! Excellent design, quality built, and smart safety features all make Mr. Heater heaters great products you can trust and that make experiences during cold weather so much more enjoyable, and if having one gets a friend or family member to join in the fun, that\'s money well spent! Not to mention having the added insurance of staying warm at home should the power go out for an extended period of time during cold weather!   So, that\'s my experience with Mr. Heater heaters, and I can and do highly recommend to anyone needing and looking for a quality and dependable portable small heater, get one. You will be glad you did! ', 'Due to recently power outage frequently, I brought this protable heater for indoor use for emergency. I did not have chance to try it for hour long but I did try and find out it is very practical make and workable. Only issue to me is I don‚Äôt aware it need 4 D battery to run and how long one will last.Any how it is a very good product,I highly recommend it.', "Will be able to use it in my fish house, heat my area that I use for skinning and tanning the furs that I've trapped.  Like the fact that I can hook up to a larger propane tank.  The fan is a bonus and the 3 different heating levels are great also."]

column1: Mr. Heater F299810 Vent Free Radiant Propane Heater, 10,000 BTU's
column4: ['These Radiant Plaque heaters are the ‚ÄúBest‚ÄùHeaters on the Market!! Been using them for over 20 plus years! Very Efficient! ', 'Nice unit and great price but it does not have a thermostat. Only low and high.', "This heater works better than I thought. I only ever use in on the low setting, as that puts out a good amount of heat. I love having it! Using it on low keeps our furnace off (which in my situation, the furnace costs way more) so we're saving a good deal of money!", 'I converted a garage into living space and added this heater, was skeptical about its ability to warm the room, as it is 440 sq., but surprisingly enough, does a fantastic job! and that is just keeping it on the low setting.', 'I‚Äôm disappointed that this heater doesn‚Äôt have a thermostat.  Otherwise it‚Äôs a nice heater.  It comes with feet and a 90 degree nipple for the gas line if you use the feet, very nice.', 'Perfect fit for what i need, will probably order another one for backup down the road.', 'good value---good quality', "I bought this to heat a 7 x 14 cargo trailer. It does so very well at 30 degrees outside temp. the trailer is not insulated but this heater still makes it nice and warm. I didn't know about the 2.5 psi pressure regulator that is needed when using a propane bottle. I couldn't get it to work right away since the emergency pressure switch was activated but once I figured it out I was able to get the heater on and working.", 'excellent quality', 'Very big upgrade for my deer blind works very well very happy with this would buy again immediately']

column1: Broan 157 Aluminum Radiant Heater With Long Life Element & Built-In Fan - 1250W
column4: ['the product shown is not what I received.  the illustration is the wire coil unit and the 157 is a solid core heat unit, kinda like an electric stove top.  I have not used it enough to know if it works as well as the coiled wire.  It takes longer to heat up than the coil type.  I am unsure what happens if the unit overheats.  It has some type of thermal overload resistor, but not sure if it will reset like the thermal unit on the coil type.also my unit had been opened and was missing a screw and the center name plate, but I was able to use those parts from the old unit I was replacing.', 'The heater was purchased to replace an old model ceiling heater.  This one, manufactured by Broan, is installed in an elevator.  Normally, elevators are placed inside the building for use and uses the ambient air to heat/cool the space.  This particular elevator is installed on an outside wall and ambient temperatures are hard to come by.The Broan unit is turned on during the fall/winter season and runs almost constantly.  It keeps the elevator well heated.  The installation of the unit is very simple and can readily be installed over a 4x4 electrical box.  After the unit has been in use for awhile, the metal screen covering may begin to rattle.  There is a single phillips-head screw that holds the screen on.  This screw will loosen and requires tightening periodically.  Another alternative is to use a "Lock-Tite" product to secure the screw.  I\'ve tried using lock washers, but they do not hold very well.Overall, the unit is durable.  The small motor that rotates the fan needs to be cleaned and lubricated periodically.  At times, I\'ve found the fan speed slowing down and have had to clean/lubricate the motor to get the fan up to speed.  If the fan motor decreases too much, there is a thermal heat sensor that will cause the heater element to turn off.  This prevents the heater element to overheat and cause a fire.  Overall, a decent little unit that thats the chill off the space during the winter months.  Because of my search for this product, I purchased two of them.  One of them is in \'bench stock\' in case the first one should fail.', 'Don\'t know why I waited so long to purchase and install a ceiling heater in our Master Bath.  After one week of use, I am very pleased and hoping that it will provide many years of service and comfort.  I was disappointed to discover that there was no  installation  hardware included with the fan.  The instructions indicated that it was  "easy to install" - only if you have your own hardware available.', 'I bought this to replace a Broan model 154 that lasted about 2 years.  So far it works great.  It heats the bathroom nicely and is much quieter because it has a solid metal heating element instead of the thin coiled wire element of the model 154.  This type of element should be more efficient and last longer as well, but only time will tell.', 'Installed it overhead just as I step out of the shower. Works on a timer that I set for approx. 10 minutes. The family likes it also.', 'Improved design replaced old one like it that stopped working after several years', 'This device stopped working in a week after installation. The power to the heater tested good.', "Love this little heater, just renivating my Mum's home.   It's so nice to have this little heater in the basement bath.  Very reasonable in price and a nice touch!!!", 'Brand new unused, unopened.  Excellent purchase. ', 'The Broan 157 ceiling heater is a great upgrade from the " twisted wire element " heater. This unit has a solid element like on a stove top burner and heats my bathroom better.  You will be very happy with this unit.']

column1: Broan-Nutone Kickspace Heater w Built-In Thermostat
column4: ["The Broan 112 heater came just as advertised as an open box item.  Once opened it was perfect, no scratches or dents.  The heater was received and installed in mid September and it worked great, quiet and smooth.  This week when we went to turn it on as the weather got colder, the fan spun up but made this awful clatter.  I took off the top but could not see anything that was causing the noise.  Then the unit stopped altogether, the fan wouldn't start up and no heat was emitted.  This unit replaced the same model that we had for the last 6 to 7 years with no problems.  We really like the heater but we're upset that this unit did not work.", 'This is kick space heater replaced one of same model. Worked well and quiet', 'Only issue is could be quieter', 'Product was advertised as 240 but was used and rewired to 120', 'the heater works great, but is a bit loud.  perfect otherwise', 'Work really great easily install heat great. Not a cheap built real tough. Not noisy at all. For a built in thermostat heat control is perfect.']

column1: Dyna Glo Glow Kerosene Radiant Heater RMC 55R7 Indoor 10000 BTU
column4: ['It is a good heater for a small tool shed or whatever. It is very easy to light and good on fuel.You do need to read the directions on shutting heater down, these newer ones are not likethe older models, whereas you could just hit the shut down button. You do need to turn knob regulator for heat down and hold shut off button in, if not the glass bowl will jump and cause the balancer inside to malfunction which it will not light again until taken apart and fixed. happy withproduct here in Vermont where it is COLD. It takes it time to heat my 160 sq. ft. tool shed butthis is Vermont. Very happy and satisfied with this product. Also my tool shed is well insulated ceiling and all walls.', "Great heater easy to use and way cheaper than electricity !!!!!!!also great for when the power go's out .!", 'This is a great supplement to my power. I am working to get off the grid and this is keeping me nice and toasty.Very quick shipping too', "I have found this model to be reliable enough to rely on for primary heating, not just an occasional use.  My home electric service the only fuel utility in a rural area available for heating short of the purchase of a propane tank and full house heating system - an unregulated (Ohio) electric co-operative with an average winter electric bill exceeding $600 per month when used for heat.  The unit burns well with little to no odor or unburned fuel, lasts on the tank provided for the time rated (10 hours or more), is very safe when located properly, radiates heat in only the direction designed, and very easy to operate.  For $129 it is an excellent value, and this makes my third (not replacements but additional).  It out performs Dyna-Glo's later model 10K which can be distinguished as the newer one's dimensions are taller.  Comes in the beige here or brown.  Safe, well-engineered, cost effective to use, and reasonably priced at $129.", 'I got this heater to take the chill off of my Woodshop. Electricity is way to expensive and not as efficient in this application. Two and a half gallons of kerosine in three weeks is cheaper than electric heater. Works well and was easy to set up. Would recommend to anyone.', 'have not needed it but it looks great hope I never do', 'Good quality, Good fit, works very well, Includes good instructions and associated information to help make it safe, long-lasting, and function well.', 'Best Kerosene heater on the market. Works like a charm. Quality construction. This is my second one. ', 'Works good 2nd heater I have had like this', 'Great person to do business with']

column1: Space Heater Infrared Quartz Wall Mount Electric Remote Control 1500 Watt White
column4: ["As a secondary heating source this is the best I've found. One in the basement and one in the hallway facing the front door.two pictures from the basement, white wall, two pictures from hallway facing front door..green wall.", 'Only installed this heater yesterday, so it might be a little early to write a review. So far no issues.Heats as it should. After you turn it off, the fan continues running for a few minutes to cool the heating element. I like that. This unit it not heavy and is easy to hang. Time will tell how good the quality is.', 'This is just great. Love the full auto part and its doing a great job. Love the fail safe features as well', 'Easy to install. Works as advertised. Nice features including remote control', 'This is a fairly good quality product and does a good job but it will not heat the area that it claims to but I am happy with my purchase and I do like the fact that it turns completely off after cooling down', 'Easy to install, puts out the needed heart and does it quickly.', 'Works good only thing it be nice if it put out a little more heat', 'Using this in my garage and love it.', 'Bought as a replacement for a lost unit. Works great!', 'Seems like it is strong']

column1: 17065 Btu Ceiling Mount Fan-forced Industrial Utility Electric Heater Furnace
column4: ["easy install, seems to be made well.  love the three heat settingsall parts were present and was packaged well. upon install, turned on power, turned thermostat knob and bam...had instant heat as I had expected...bring on the cold!!.however, one feature that I wish it had was a delayed fan off to cool the heating coils after use. when you rotate the thermostat knob, the fan shuts down immediately, leaving the hot coils to cool off too slowly. also, the unit I received didn't have a visible mark on the thermostat knob for easy identification of position (easily fixed). overall, nice product for the money", "So much easier than installing a gas furnace and vent.  Fan creates a full circular heat draft all the way around my 20x20 detached garage.  Heats up quickly and I can then turn it down.  Thermostat works well.  I had a 30 amp welder plug in a good location, so mounted it on the ceiling and used a 10' dryer plug cord.  Quick and easy installation.  Should have done this years ago.  No more freezing with a little space heater.", 'I recommend knowledg√§ble HVAC guy to add the external thermostat if you need one.  I have high ceilings and wanted to use my mouting system that √¢ttaches to the walls in a corner - no ceiling holes, but two nights of engineering the aluminum mounts.  Hester has been set on low since I installed it and let the Honeywell electronic thermost√¢t do the work.  Waiting for √£ heating bill to begin tuning it for optim√£l settings depending on weather.  But garage can get hot it works so well.', "I purchased this heater to use in a 666 sq ft, 4-car, uninsulated, vaulted ceiling garage.  Obviously this is meant to be used in a smaller, more insulated setting.  I wanted to try just one first, and then add as necessary.The heater itself seems to be well-built as far as structure, and designed well as far as installation and operation.  Including running wiring and building a wall mount (vaulted ceiling so no ceiling studs), it took 2-3hrs to get up and running.In my large uninsulated setting, over the course of 3-4hrs, it was able to raise the temperature from 25*F to 45*F, roughly speaking.  In other words, from intolerable to tolerable.  Which is about what I expected from it.  I think it would do quite well at maintaining a higher temperature if I were to use my propane 'salamander' to initially heat the space.Based on other's reviews and my own experience, there seems to be a major quality control concern in the assembly line for these regarding the fan nut.  I was unaware of this until after it was installed, but I'm almost certain I have the same issue as almost everyone else.  Before mounting the heater there was a nut and washer rattling around inside.  After a semi-thorough check, I figured it was an erroneous leftover.  Having read the reviews and after hearing a small rattle when the heater runs, I will be dismounting and tearing it down to install that nut properly.  This is both an inconvenience and really a potential danger.  For that I've removed a star from the rating.That being said, I will be purchasing another one, possibly two more.  Can't beat the price to performance ratio anywhere.Edit from the future:  I bought another one, slightly updated since the first.  This one had no problems and even runs quieter.  Awesome.", "This heater does a great job heating my 24'x30' insulated shop. I have it on a Honeywell line thermostat, and typically keep it at 40* to keep water lines from freezing, but when I'm ready to work in the ship I just turn it up and in 20 minutes it's nice and toasty. The other day it was 30* outside, but on high this ran for less than 5 minutes every 20-30 minutes.The only potential negative to be aware of is that it has a slight whistle when it's running. It's enough that I think about it every time it starts up, but it's not enough to be a nuisance.Overall I'm very happy with my purchase; it was easy to install, and is cost-effective for the job I needed it to do.", "Fast shipping.Well packaged.All metal construction.Enough detail in instructions,easily installed,best of all:heater works great.No issues so far.I heat a decent size 2 car garage and this is all I need.Recomend a ceiling fan to force the heat down,same thing with all of 'em.I can not stand beneath this heater when it is on high,it is way beyond my expectations.It is not very big or impressive,but do not let that part fool ya,it is a good heater.I have left the thermostat inside the heater,so far this is working fine.", 'I have used 4 times now and I really like it. If you have a insulated two car garage this heater will do the job nicely.It only took about 30 minutes to go from 30¬∞ to  62¬∞ in an hour it was 71¬∞ had to turn it down to work though. I like it 57¬∞ to 63¬∞ when working on a project. This heater is perfect for my needs. Little less than $100 too!üëç', "I'm happy with this heater and wish I'd found it years ago. I installed it in my basement workshop and it is way better than the big baseboard heater and kerosene heater I'd been using for many years. It's quiet and easy to install and heats the basement better than I'd anticipated. The workmanship and quality are great and I especially like that the sheet metal parts are post painted as opposed to crummy pre-paint and so all the sheet metal cut edges and corners are painted and nice and smooth and burr free.", 'I use this heater turned down low just to knock the edge off the cold so I can work comfortably in my 3 car garage shop.  I have it set on about 1/3 of its capacity and it keeps the garage at about 55- 60, the way I like it.  If I were to turn it up on high it would make the garage toasty warm.  The installation was straight forward and simple.  I bought a plug, 15 ft. of 10-3 service cord and a cord grip to make the installation. I plug it into my 220 volt welder receptacle when I want to have heat.  Wish I had found it years ago.', 'Great heat output, replaced my floor oil heater and small plug in with this one.  Only reason I gave it a 4 not 5 is that # 1 the fan blade was loose when I got it and the simple mechanism makes a rattling noise that is not necessary.  It only has a moving fan part but is kinda noisy.  Heats very well.']

column1: Heater Garage Electric Portable 5600 Watt Adjustable Built-In Thermostat, Black
column4: ['This heater was offered as "Manufacturer refurbished".I was willing to accept cosmetic damage to save somemoney.  When the heater came, it was in almost newcosmetic and like new operational condition!  I was veryhappy!I have used it for 3 weeks so far in my 625 Sq. Ft. garagewith outside air temperatures as low as 24F.   At 24F, ittakes about an hour to heat the garage to 65F+; then itcycles on and off after that and maintains thetemperature just fine.  I haven\'t had to turn the thermostatup more than 2/3 of the way to be able to work in asummer shirt and jeans.BTW my garage is insulated and sheet-rocked on all thewalls and the ceiling.  (The ceiling is 9 1/2\' high.)  Thegarage doors are also insulated with foam sheets in thepanels.I put the heater on the floor (as required by the safetyinstructions) facing into the garage.  It sits on and blowsacross a carpet which never gets warm as the heat goesup.  The heater fan keeps the air mixed well and keepsthe temperature even throughout the garage. ', "I think this is a decent heater. Easy install, quiet, simple, but it does take a while to get room heat up. On a cold day I might need 3+ hours to get the room to working temp here in the Northeast.. But, I would suggest counting on it for less than the rated SqFt in your shop application.I may need a second one, and now I am faced with the fact that I should have gone with higher BTU's on a single unit to begin with.", 'Very happy with this heater, especially for the price! I have a 1225 sq ft garage with tall ceilings and this keeps it a nice 60 degrees at all times. I was not expecting it to keep the garage so nice and warm. Very happy with it, the blower is a little noisy at times but that doesn‚Äôt bother me, especially at this price. ', 'I Purchased this for a restaurant and was not quite sure it would work. Well it turned out it was better then I had hoped for. I have it up high so it blows across the ceiling, fans pick up the heat and send it gently down. Wow Just Wow. It works fantastic..', "Haven't had it very long, but I believe it is going to work great for what I intended to use it for and that is too heat my work shop.", 'Not sure as of yet for I have not used it. Have to wait till it get cold out side', 'I love this item but doesn‚Äôt fit the socket ', 'a little small for me other wise good heater', 'Looks and feels solid!']

column1: Mr. Heater MH60QFAV 60000 BTU Portable Propane Forced Air Heater
column4: ['This Mr Heater is great.  I use it in a 1000 sqft shop and it warms it up in minutes.  I replaced a radiant kerosene heater and am glad I did.  Years ago I had a kerosene tube heater that was extremely loud but the Mr Heater is very quiet.  Highly recommend.', 'I am convinced ALL Mr Heater products are nothing buy JUNK!  Lights right up first time - worked for about 20 minutes.2nd use - lights right up - runs for 10 minutes shuts off - Re-light -works for 10 minutes - shuts off TRIED to re-light - no dice - boxed it back up and sent it back,This is not the first Mr Heater item I have had issue with -They use to make a quality product - something changed - LGB!', 'Dont heat up as everyone say. Ran it about an hour in my garage at 32f didnt get much warmer, maybe to 34 in an hour with door closed. Smelled like burned propane and my eyes were burning, had to shut it off it was so bad. Looks to me that people that review them on YouTube are people that sell them. Will be selling this heater get something electric. Would not recommend at all, i was very disappointed. ', 'Had it on low setting and thawed out all my frozen water pipes in a 2 bay garage that was under 10 degrees F. ', 'I recommend this heater.  It works well and heats up my shop quickly and easily.', 'This thing heats my garage in less than 5 minutes. I very impressed. Very happy with this purchase.', 'Great to use in a garage environment.', 'Good little heater. 400 sq foot garage. Gets it up to 80 easy.  , I have to turn it off to keep from sweating!! They should make them more efficient. A little costly if used a lot.', 'Set up is a cinch. Physical was smaller than expect which was a plus.  It is a bit noisy; but it raised the temperature in my 750 ft2 shop 30 degrees within a couple of hours. I will be getting another one for my garage and home. ', 'compact works great will take the chill out of 1200 square feet shop']

column1: BROAN Recessed Electric Wall-Mount Heater, Recessed or Surface, 208/240V AC 174
column4: ['We bought two heaters by different manufacturers in order to compare. This one is quieter and heats better. The thermostat works better and is more accurate. Great unit, it keeps a 230 square foot room warm even in 10 degree F weather.', 'I bought this heater to replace the same one I installed in my lower level bathroom 20 years ago. The replacement was exactly the same size which made the replacement of the internal parts in the existing sheet metal frame very fast. It works well for this small bath to take the chill of the lower level out between heating seasons. After removing the existing Broan 174 I saw a build up of lint/dust on the back side of the heater eliment and it may not have been bad to begin with, so I will keep that in mind if it starts smelling hot (In the next 20 years). Bottom line is it work well to heat a small room quickly.', 'Very good to use in a small bathroom,I run it 240v for less power consumption ', 'it was exactly what I wanted --keeps my small bathroom very warm', 'Easy to install, heat is fast, fan is quiet, looks great.', 'This is the 5th of these heaters I have purchased.  Mostly used in bathrooms and bedrooms both in my own home and in rental properties.  They are reliable, and very quiet, put forth plenty of gentle warm heat without worrying if a small child is close to them.  Excellent product.', 'this heater does exactly what it is build to do .and the support is great and will work well with you.', 'Good quality heater.  Easy to install.  I have four of these and all work perfectly.', 'Thermostat shuts the heater off too soon.', 'small and heats good']

column1: Mr. Heater Big Buddy 18000 Btu/Hr. 450 Sq. Ft. Portable Propane Heater
column4: ["This heater is fairly large.  Don't expect it to fit under your legs in the bleachers.  The handle is really handy, but makes it pretty tall.This heater is very versatile. It can be like the smaller versions with just one element on at half power, full power, or both elements on full power.  It goes through propane about the same as all the other ones I've seen, and full power is a lot of power.  The fan (powered by D cells) blows warm air in your direction, which is nice because otherwise it just goes straight up.IMHO it's way handier than the smaller bottle mounted version because it doesn't tip easily and it's not as tall.  It puts the heat in a better location.It's not a small heater, but is powerful, well built, and looks like it will last.", 'this id the 2nd one I have owned  first one was 5 years old and used every day it was cold it keeps our coach warm enough on low  and very economicl to run do recomend getting the hose with regolator and using a 20 pound bbq grill tank outside  and keeping a couple of the one pound throw aways in reserve incase of a midnight run out of gas senero , teriffic for those emergencies and blizzards requires no electric to run just a couple batteries to run the fan but will still  produce  het with out fan not operating . has the o2 depletion piliot light that lifts off if o2 level gets to low plus tip switch incase it gets tipped over by accident , Like any heating device care should be taken to assure you are opperating it in a safe manner and following the instructions that states the clearences on ll sides ', 'Current house furnace is out and this unit has filled in amazingly well.  Live in MN and have 2 of these with a couple electric room heaters for 2000 sqft plus home and been heating for a month.  Do recommend the 20# Walmart propane tanks w/ gauge for $48 and conversion hose to unit for more economical heating that the small canisters.  CAn heat for nearly a week.  Have CO monitor and never have had it go off once.  They are made to be CO free .  We do not leave them running when not home for safety reason but never yet had an issue.  ', 'I bought this to be able to work in my 2 car garage during cold days. It works very well. The only drawback I could see is that the fan moves very little air. Otherwise, I would have given it a 5 star rating....  Made the garage able to be worked in with no jacket in about 2 hours (on a 15 degree day)  Well worth it...   And would be great thing to have if an ice storm hits and the power (heat) went out...  Costs less than a buck an hour worth of propane to run on High.  I bought a 15 lb tank and ran it for about 18 hours.....    I plan on getting a couple of portable 1 lb bottles and a refill adapter.....', 'Got Mr. Heater for a heater in my outside work area and as an emergency backup heater in case of power failure in a storm or the heat pump went bad in middle of winter. Works perfect and am using hooked up to 20lb propane tank and also little 1lb tanks. Either way is working perfect.  This thing will run you out of house on 18,000 btu setting.  Always vent from a window or door to keep oxygen fresh and will be good for indoor use, you will still be plenty warm and no worries about any pipes freezing. Great product', "This little heater is just the ticket for quickly warming up our home on those chilly mornings. ,I live where we seldom get any colder than 40 degrees at night , we don't run any heater at night for safety reasons ,although I feel this heater is safer than any electric one , no cords to overheat . I turn it on in the morning and in 15 minutes the chill is taken off the house. I use a small fan to circulate the heat more than the one that comes with the heater which is efficient for one room.  I also purchased the 12 foot hose and regulator so I can hook to a 30 lbs bottle out side the house. just ran the hose through an existing tv cable  hole. I can get about a week of heat out of one bottle at 16.00 to refill. That is much cheaper than running electric space heaters.", "The dogs and I have a very comfortable warm environment now that the heater is able to be used. They are so happy that the inside of the motorhome is a lot more comfortable. We have been having nights that are in the upper twenties and low 30s so we're really grateful to have a heater the prize this my cheat on low setting it it basically heats the Whole 30 ft motorhome it generates more than enough heat on low and will run for a hundred hours on that setting .  It is very warm at got my  farm in Coupeville Washington. thanks a lot for a great item!!", 'I\'ve been hunting deer for 42 years now and never worried about the cold weather when I was younger, mostly because pop-up portable blinds and portable heaters like these were not available back then. But my youngest daughter started hunting with me 6 years ago and after watching her brave a particularly cold opening day her first year I decided there had to be a better setup so she could enjoy going with me and I could insure I would get to continue to enjoy spending such moments with her, so I bought my first ground blind and my first Mr. Heater Little Buddy heater, and closing weekend of rifle season was soooooo much more enjoyable. Having a heat source to warm our feet made all the difference in the world being able to sit beside my daughter and just watch her scan our surroundings for her first deer, and did she take a beauty! After realizing how great the difference in the experience having shelter and heat made, I broke down and bought blinds for my Dad, nephew, and great friend who owns the property where we hunt, and then decided everyone should be able to stay warm and enjoy their time in the field as well, so I retired my Little Buddy heater and bought three of the Buddy heaters and one of the heater/cooker models and stocked each blind with a heater. The difference between the Little Buddy and the bigger Buddy models is very noticeably different! Running the bigger Buddy heaters warmed up a two person ground blind sufficiently enough to allow us to take off our coats, even with several windows open, and sit comfortably without creating undue noise or alerts to the deer as we watched many feed and browse around in the field in front of us. Hunting went from a cold and trying event to a greatly enjoyed experience spending time with my daughter, my Dad, my nephew, and friend! I\'ve always said a bad day hunting or fishing is better than a good day working anytime, but having Mr. Heater Buddy heaters warming our ground blinds has made such a difference in our time spent together so much more enjoyable that now my oldest daughter is joining in, and that alone made any expense paid for the equipment one of my best investments! Funny story: My Dad was using the heater I put in the blind he was using and after spending the morning hunting we all went to breakfast and I asked him how well he liked having heat, and his reply was, "great for about 20 minutes and then the damned thing quit and wouldn\'t re-light!" I asked him if he had opened any windows and he said "no, it wasn\'t light yet so I was just enjoying staying warm, until the heater went out!" I started laughing and he was taken aback by my reaction and asked why I was laughing, had I played a joke and given him the junk heater? I said no and told him he should be thankful Mr. Heater saved his life! Not knowing what I was referring to he had a puzzled look on his face, so I told him that the heater has a low oxygen sensor built into it and because he had the windows closed up fresh air could not circulate through the blind and the heater shut off before he could pass out from carbon monoxide poisoning! The look on his face was priceless! All he could say was "glad someone was looking out for him." After breakfast and getting some chores done we all went back to our blinds and my Dad made sure he opened some windows and lit the heater, and spent the rest of the day happy and warm. Moral of the story: The safety features built into Mr. Heater heaters work! Excellent design, quality built, and smart safety features all make Mr. Heater heaters great products you can trust and that make experiences during cold weather so much more enjoyable, and if having one gets a friend or family member to join in the fun, that\'s money well spent! Not to mention having the added insurance of staying warm at home should the power go out for an extended period of time during cold weather!   So, that\'s my experience with Mr. Heater heaters, and I can and do highly recommend to anyone needing and looking for a quality and dependable portable small heater, get one. You will be glad you did! ', 'Due to recently power outage frequently, I brought this protable heater for indoor use for emergency. I did not have chance to try it for hour long but I did try and find out it is very practical make and workable. Only issue to me is I don‚Äôt aware it need 4 D battery to run and how long one will last.Any how it is a very good product,I highly recommend it.', "Will be able to use it in my fish house, heat my area that I use for skinning and tanning the furs that I've trapped.  Like the fact that I can hook up to a larger propane tank.  The fan is a bonus and the 3 different heating levels are great also."]

column1: Broan-Nutone Kickspace Heater w Built-In Thermostat
column4: ["The Broan 112 heater came just as advertised as an open box item.  Once opened it was perfect, no scratches or dents.  The heater was received and installed in mid September and it worked great, quiet and smooth.  This week when we went to turn it on as the weather got colder, the fan spun up but made this awful clatter.  I took off the top but could not see anything that was causing the noise.  Then the unit stopped altogether, the fan wouldn't start up and no heat was emitted.  This unit replaced the same model that we had for the last 6 to 7 years with no problems.  We really like the heater but we're upset that this unit did not work.", 'This is kick space heater replaced one of same model. Worked well and quiet', 'Only issue is could be quieter', 'Product was advertised as 240 but was used and rewired to 120', 'the heater works great, but is a bit loud.  perfect otherwise', 'Work really great easily install heat great. Not a cheap built real tough. Not noisy at all. For a built in thermostat heat control is perfect.']

column1: Dyna Glo Glow Kerosene Radiant Heater RMC 55R7 Indoor 10000 BTU
column4: ['It is a good heater for a small tool shed or whatever. It is very easy to light and good on fuel.You do need to read the directions on shutting heater down, these newer ones are not likethe older models, whereas you could just hit the shut down button. You do need to turn knob regulator for heat down and hold shut off button in, if not the glass bowl will jump and cause the balancer inside to malfunction which it will not light again until taken apart and fixed. happy withproduct here in Vermont where it is COLD. It takes it time to heat my 160 sq. ft. tool shed butthis is Vermont. Very happy and satisfied with this product. Also my tool shed is well insulated ceiling and all walls.', "Great heater easy to use and way cheaper than electricity !!!!!!!also great for when the power go's out .!", 'This is a great supplement to my power. I am working to get off the grid and this is keeping me nice and toasty.Very quick shipping too', "I have found this model to be reliable enough to rely on for primary heating, not just an occasional use.  My home electric service the only fuel utility in a rural area available for heating short of the purchase of a propane tank and full house heating system - an unregulated (Ohio) electric co-operative with an average winter electric bill exceeding $600 per month when used for heat.  The unit burns well with little to no odor or unburned fuel, lasts on the tank provided for the time rated (10 hours or more), is very safe when located properly, radiates heat in only the direction designed, and very easy to operate.  For $129 it is an excellent value, and this makes my third (not replacements but additional).  It out performs Dyna-Glo's later model 10K which can be distinguished as the newer one's dimensions are taller.  Comes in the beige here or brown.  Safe, well-engineered, cost effective to use, and reasonably priced at $129.", 'I got this heater to take the chill off of my Woodshop. Electricity is way to expensive and not as efficient in this application. Two and a half gallons of kerosine in three weeks is cheaper than electric heater. Works well and was easy to set up. Would recommend to anyone.', 'have not needed it but it looks great hope I never do', 'Good quality, Good fit, works very well, Includes good instructions and associated information to help make it safe, long-lasting, and function well.', 'Best Kerosene heater on the market. Works like a charm. Quality construction. This is my second one. ', 'Works good 2nd heater I have had like this', 'Great person to do business with']

column1: 17065 Btu Ceiling Mount Fan-forced Industrial Utility Electric Heater Furnace
column4: ["easy install, seems to be made well.  love the three heat settingsall parts were present and was packaged well. upon install, turned on power, turned thermostat knob and bam...had instant heat as I had expected...bring on the cold!!.however, one feature that I wish it had was a delayed fan off to cool the heating coils after use. when you rotate the thermostat knob, the fan shuts down immediately, leaving the hot coils to cool off too slowly. also, the unit I received didn't have a visible mark on the thermostat knob for easy identification of position (easily fixed). overall, nice product for the money", "So much easier than installing a gas furnace and vent.  Fan creates a full circular heat draft all the way around my 20x20 detached garage.  Heats up quickly and I can then turn it down.  Thermostat works well.  I had a 30 amp welder plug in a good location, so mounted it on the ceiling and used a 10' dryer plug cord.  Quick and easy installation.  Should have done this years ago.  No more freezing with a little space heater.", 'I recommend knowledg√§ble HVAC guy to add the external thermostat if you need one.  I have high ceilings and wanted to use my mouting system that √¢ttaches to the walls in a corner - no ceiling holes, but two nights of engineering the aluminum mounts.  Hester has been set on low since I installed it and let the Honeywell electronic thermost√¢t do the work.  Waiting for √£ heating bill to begin tuning it for optim√£l settings depending on weather.  But garage can get hot it works so well.', "I purchased this heater to use in a 666 sq ft, 4-car, uninsulated, vaulted ceiling garage.  Obviously this is meant to be used in a smaller, more insulated setting.  I wanted to try just one first, and then add as necessary.The heater itself seems to be well-built as far as structure, and designed well as far as installation and operation.  Including running wiring and building a wall mount (vaulted ceiling so no ceiling studs), it took 2-3hrs to get up and running.In my large uninsulated setting, over the course of 3-4hrs, it was able to raise the temperature from 25*F to 45*F, roughly speaking.  In other words, from intolerable to tolerable.  Which is about what I expected from it.  I think it would do quite well at maintaining a higher temperature if I were to use my propane 'salamander' to initially heat the space.Based on other's reviews and my own experience, there seems to be a major quality control concern in the assembly line for these regarding the fan nut.  I was unaware of this until after it was installed, but I'm almost certain I have the same issue as almost everyone else.  Before mounting the heater there was a nut and washer rattling around inside.  After a semi-thorough check, I figured it was an erroneous leftover.  Having read the reviews and after hearing a small rattle when the heater runs, I will be dismounting and tearing it down to install that nut properly.  This is both an inconvenience and really a potential danger.  For that I've removed a star from the rating.That being said, I will be purchasing another one, possibly two more.  Can't beat the price to performance ratio anywhere.Edit from the future:  I bought another one, slightly updated since the first.  This one had no problems and even runs quieter.  Awesome.", "This heater does a great job heating my 24'x30' insulated shop. I have it on a Honeywell line thermostat, and typically keep it at 40* to keep water lines from freezing, but when I'm ready to work in the ship I just turn it up and in 20 minutes it's nice and toasty. The other day it was 30* outside, but on high this ran for less than 5 minutes every 20-30 minutes.The only potential negative to be aware of is that it has a slight whistle when it's running. It's enough that I think about it every time it starts up, but it's not enough to be a nuisance.Overall I'm very happy with my purchase; it was easy to install, and is cost-effective for the job I needed it to do.", "Fast shipping.Well packaged.All metal construction.Enough detail in instructions,easily installed,best of all:heater works great.No issues so far.I heat a decent size 2 car garage and this is all I need.Recomend a ceiling fan to force the heat down,same thing with all of 'em.I can not stand beneath this heater when it is on high,it is way beyond my expectations.It is not very big or impressive,but do not let that part fool ya,it is a good heater.I have left the thermostat inside the heater,so far this is working fine.", 'I have used 4 times now and I really like it. If you have a insulated two car garage this heater will do the job nicely.It only took about 30 minutes to go from 30¬∞ to  62¬∞ in an hour it was 71¬∞ had to turn it down to work though. I like it 57¬∞ to 63¬∞ when working on a project. This heater is perfect for my needs. Little less than $100 too!üëç', "I'm happy with this heater and wish I'd found it years ago. I installed it in my basement workshop and it is way better than the big baseboard heater and kerosene heater I'd been using for many years. It's quiet and easy to install and heats the basement better than I'd anticipated. The workmanship and quality are great and I especially like that the sheet metal parts are post painted as opposed to crummy pre-paint and so all the sheet metal cut edges and corners are painted and nice and smooth and burr free.", 'I use this heater turned down low just to knock the edge off the cold so I can work comfortably in my 3 car garage shop.  I have it set on about 1/3 of its capacity and it keeps the garage at about 55- 60, the way I like it.  If I were to turn it up on high it would make the garage toasty warm.  The installation was straight forward and simple.  I bought a plug, 15 ft. of 10-3 service cord and a cord grip to make the installation. I plug it into my 220 volt welder receptacle when I want to have heat.  Wish I had found it years ago.', 'Great heat output, replaced my floor oil heater and small plug in with this one.  Only reason I gave it a 4 not 5 is that # 1 the fan blade was loose when I got it and the simple mechanism makes a rattling noise that is not necessary.  It only has a moving fan part but is kinda noisy.  Heats very well.']

column1: Comfort Zone Industrial Steel Electric Ceiling Mount Heater, 3 Heat Levels
column4: ["easy install, seems to be made well.  love the three heat settingsall parts were present and was packaged well. upon install, turned on power, turned thermostat knob and bam...had instant heat as I had expected...bring on the cold!!.however, one feature that I wish it had was a delayed fan off to cool the heating coils after use. when you rotate the thermostat knob, the fan shuts down immediately, leaving the hot coils to cool off too slowly. also, the unit I received didn't have a visible mark on the thermostat knob for easy identification of position (easily fixed). overall, nice product for the money", "So much easier than installing a gas furnace and vent.  Fan creates a full circular heat draft all the way around my 20x20 detached garage.  Heats up quickly and I can then turn it down.  Thermostat works well.  I had a 30 amp welder plug in a good location, so mounted it on the ceiling and used a 10' dryer plug cord.  Quick and easy installation.  Should have done this years ago.  No more freezing with a little space heater.", 'I recommend knowledg√§ble HVAC guy to add the external thermostat if you need one.  I have high ceilings and wanted to use my mouting system that √¢ttaches to the walls in a corner - no ceiling holes, but two nights of engineering the aluminum mounts.  Hester has been set on low since I installed it and let the Honeywell electronic thermost√¢t do the work.  Waiting for √£ heating bill to begin tuning it for optim√£l settings depending on weather.  But garage can get hot it works so well.', "I purchased this heater to use in a 666 sq ft, 4-car, uninsulated, vaulted ceiling garage.  Obviously this is meant to be used in a smaller, more insulated setting.  I wanted to try just one first, and then add as necessary.The heater itself seems to be well-built as far as structure, and designed well as far as installation and operation.  Including running wiring and building a wall mount (vaulted ceiling so no ceiling studs), it took 2-3hrs to get up and running.In my large uninsulated setting, over the course of 3-4hrs, it was able to raise the temperature from 25*F to 45*F, roughly speaking.  In other words, from intolerable to tolerable.  Which is about what I expected from it. column1: Heater Garage Electric Portable 5600 Watt Adjustable Built-In Thermostat, Black
column4: ['This heater was offered as "Manufacturer refurbished".I was willing to accept cosmetic damage to save somemoney.  When the heater came, it was in almost newcosmetic and like new operational condition!  I was veryhappy!I have used it for 3 weeks so far in my 625 Sq. Ft. garagewith outside air temperatures as low as 24F.   At 24F, ittakes about an hour to heat the garage to 65F+; then itcycles on and off after that and maintains thetemperature just fine.  I haven\'t had to turn the thermostatup more than 2/3 of the way to be able to work in asummer shirt and jeans.BTW my garage is insulated and sheet-rocked on all thewalls and the ceiling.  (The ceiling is 9 1/2\' high.)  Thegarage doors are also insulated with foam sheets in thepanels.I put the heater on the floor (as required by the safetyinstructions) facing into the garage.  It sits on and blowsacross a carpet which never gets warm as the heat goesup.  The heater fan keeps the air mixed well and keepsthe temperature even throughout the garage. ', "I think this is a decent heater. Easy install, quiet, simple, but it does take a while to get room heat up. On a cold day I might need 3+ hours to get the room to working temp here in the Northeast.. But, I would suggest counting on it for less than the rated SqFt in your shop application.I may need a second one, and now I am faced with the fact that I should have gone with higher BTU's on a single unit to begin with.", 'Very happy with this heater, especially for the price! I have a 1225 sq ft garage with tall ceilings and this keeps it a nice 60 degrees at all times. I was not expecting it to keep the garage so nice and warm. Very happy with it, the blower is a little noisy at times but that doesn‚Äôt bother me, especially at this price. ', 'I Purchased this for a restaurant and was not quite sure it would work. Well it turned out it was better then I had hoped for. I have it up high so it blows across the ceiling, fans pick up the heat and send it gently down. Wow Just Wow. It works fantastic..', "Haven't had it very long, but I believe it is going to work great for what I intended to use it for and that is too heat my work shop.", 'Not sure as of yet for I have not used it. Have to wait till it get cold out side', 'I love this item but doesn‚Äôt fit the socket ', 'a little small for me other wise good heater', 'Looks and feels solid!']

column1: Mr. Heater MH60QFAV 60000 BTU Portable Propane Forced Air Heater
column4: ['This Mr Heater is great.  I use it in a 1000 sqft shop and it warms it up in minutes.  I replaced a radiant kerosene heater and am glad I did.  Years ago I had a kerosene tube heater that was extremely loud but the Mr Heater is very quiet.  Highly recommend.', 'I am convinced ALL Mr Heater products are nothing buy JUNK!  Lights right up first time - worked for about 20 minutes.2nd use - lights right up - runs for 10 minutes shuts off - Re-light -works for 10 minutes - shuts off TRIED to re-light - no dice - boxed it back up and sent it back,This is not the first Mr Heater item I have had issue with -They use to make a quality product - something changed - LGB!', 'Dont heat up as everyone say. Ran it about an hour in my garage at 32f didnt get much warmer, maybe to 34 in an hour with door closed. Smelled like burned propane and my eyes were burning, had to shut it off it was so bad. Looks to me that people that review them on YouTube are people that sell them. Will be selling this heater get something electric. Would not recommend at all, i was very disappointed. ', 'Had it on low setting and thawed out all my frozen water pipes in a 2 bay garage that was under 10 degrees F. ', 'I recommend this heater.  It works well and heats up my shop quickly and easily.', 'This thing heats my garage in less than 5 minutes. I very impressed. Very happy with this purchase.', 'Great to use in a garage environment.', 'Good little heater. 400 sq foot garage. Gets it up to 80 easy.  , I have to turn it off to keep from sweating!! They should make them more efficient. A little costly if used a lot.', 'Set up is a cinch. Physical was smaller than expect which was a plus.  It is a bit noisy; but it raised the temperature in my 750 ft2 shop 30 degrees within a couple of hours. I will be getting another one for my garage and home. ', 'compact works great will take the chill out of 1200 square feet shop']

column1: BROAN Recessed Electric Wall-Mount Heater, Recessed or Surface, 208/240V AC 174
column4: ['We bought two heaters by different manufacturers in order to compare. This one is quieter and heats better. The thermostat works better and is more accurate. Great unit, it keeps a 230 square foot room warm even in 10 degree F weather.', 'I bought this heater to replace the same one I installed in my lower level bathroom 20 years ago. The replacement was exactly the same size which made the replacement of the internal parts in the existing sheet metal frame very fast. It works well for this small bath to take the chill of the lower level out between heating seasons. After removing the existing Broan 174 I saw a build up of lint/dust on the back side of the heater eliment and it may not have been bad to begin with, so I will keep that in mind if it starts smelling hot (In the next 20 years). Bottom line is it work well to heat a small room quickly.', 'Very good to use in a small bathroom,I run it 240v for less power consumption ', 'it was exactly what I wanted --keeps my small bathroom very warm', 'Easy to install, heat is fast, fan is quiet, looks great.', 'This is the 5th of these heaters I have purchased.  Mostly used in bathrooms and bedrooms both in my own home and in rental properties.  They are reliable, and very quiet, put forth plenty of gentle warm heat without worrying if a small child is close to them.  Excellent product.', 'this heater does exactly what it is build to do .and the support is great and will work well with you.', 'Good quality heater.  Easy to install.  I have four of these and all work perfectly.', 'Thermostat shuts the heater off too soon.', 'small and heats good']
