column1: New Mr Heater Big Buddy Portable Propane Heater 18,000 BTU For Up To 450 Sq Ft
column4: ["This heater is fairly large.  Don't expect it to fit under your legs in the bleachers.  The handle is really handy, but makes it pretty tall.This heater is very versatile. It can be like the smaller versions with just one element on at half power, full power, or both elements on full power.  It goes through propane about the same as all the other ones I've seen, and full power is a lot of power.  The fan (powered by D cells) blows warm air in your direction, which is nice because otherwise it just goes straight up.IMHO it's way handier than the smaller bottle mounted version because it doesn't tip easily and it's not as tall.  It puts the heat in a better location.It's not a small heater, but is powerful, well built, and looks like it will last.", 'this id the 2nd one I have owned  first one was 5 years old and used every day it was cold it keeps our coach warm enough on low  and very economicl to run do recomend getting the hose with regolator and using a 20 pound bbq grill tank outside  and keeping a couple of the one pound throw aways in reserve incase of a midnight run out of gas senero , teriffic for those emergencies and blizzards requires no electric to run just a couple batteries to run the fan but will still  produce  het with out fan not operating . has the o2 depletion piliot light that lifts off if o2 level gets to low plus tip switch incase it gets tipped over by accident , Like any heating device care should be taken to assure you are opperating it in a safe manner and following the instructions that states the clearences on ll sides ', 'Current house furnace is out and this unit has filled in amazingly well.  Live in MN and have 2 of these with a couple electric room heaters for 2000 sqft plus home and been heating for a month.  Do recommend the 20# Walmart propane tanks w/ gauge for $48 and conversion hose to unit for more economical heating that the small canisters.  CAn heat for nearly a week.  Have CO monitor and never have had it go off once.  They are made to be CO free .  We do not leave them running when not home for safety reason but never yet had an issue.  ', 'I bought this to be able to work in my 2 car garage during cold days. It works very well. The only drawback I could see is that the fan moves very little air. Otherwise, I would have given it a 5 star rating....  Made the garage able to be worked in with no jacket in about 2 hours (on a 15 degree day)  Well worth it...   And would be great thing to have if an ice storm hits and the power (heat) went out...  Costs less than a buck an hour worth of propane to run on High.  I bought a 15 lb tank and ran it for about 18 hours.....    I plan on getting a couple of portable 1 lb bottles and a refill adapter.....', 'Got Mr. Heater for a heater in my outside work area and as an emergency backup heater in case of power failure in a storm or the heat pump went bad in middle of winter. Works perfect and am using hooked up to 20lb propane tank and also little 1lb tanks. Either way is working perfect.  This thing will run you out of house on 18,000 btu setting.  Always vent from a window or door to keep oxygen fresh and will be good for indoor use, you will still be plenty warm and no worries about any pipes freezing. Great product', "This little heater is just the ticket for quickly warming up our home on those chilly mornings. ,I live where we seldom get any colder than 40 degrees at night , we don't run any heater at night for safety reasons ,although I feel this heater is safer than any electric one , no cords to overheat . I turn it on in the morning and in 15 minutes the chill is taken off the house. I use a small fan to circulate the heat more than the one that comes with the heater which is efficient for one room.  I also purchased the 12 foot hose and regulator so I can hook to a 30 lbs bottle out side the house. just ran the hose through an existing tv cable  hole. I can get about a week of heat out of one bottle at 16.00 to refill. That is much cheaper than running electric space heaters.", "The dogs and I have a very comfortable warm environment now that the heater is able to be used. They are so happy that the inside of the motorhome is a lot more comfortable. We have been having nights that are in the upper twenties and low 30s so we're really grateful to have a heater the prize this my cheat on low setting it it basically heats the Whole 30 ft motorhome it generates more than enough heat on low and will run for a hundred hours on that setting .  It is very warm at got my  farm in Coupeville Washington. thanks a lot for a great item!!", 'I\'ve been hunting deer for 42 years now and never worried about the cold weather when I was younger, mostly because pop-up portable blinds and portable heaters like these were not available back then. But my youngest daughter started hunting with me 6 years ago and after watching her brave a particularly cold opening day her first year I decided there had to be a better setup so she could enjoy going with me and I could insure I would get to continue to enjoy spending such moments with her, so I bought my first ground blind and my first Mr. Heater Little Buddy heater, and closing weekend of rifle season was soooooo much more enjoyable. Having a heat source to warm our feet made all the difference in the world being able to sit beside my daughter and just watch her scan our surroundings for her first deer, and did she take a beauty! After realizing how great the difference in the experience having shelter and heat made, I broke down and bought blinds for my Dad, nephew, and great friend who owns the property where we hunt, and then decided everyone should be able to stay warm and enjoy their time in the field as well, so I retired my Little Buddy heater and bought three of the Buddy heaters and one of the heater/cooker models and stocked each blind with a heater. The difference between the Little Buddy and the bigger Buddy models is very noticeably different! Running the bigger Buddy heaters warmed up a two person ground blind sufficiently enough to allow us to take off our coats, even with several windows open, and sit comfortably without creating undue noise or alerts to the deer as we watched many feed and browse around in the field in front of us. Hunting went from a cold and trying event to a greatly enjoyed experience spending time with my daughter, my Dad, my nephew, and friend! I\'ve always said a bad day hunting or fishing is better than a good day working anytime, but having Mr. Heater Buddy heaters warming our ground blinds has made such a difference in our time spent together so much more enjoyable that now my oldest daughter is joining in, and that alone made any expense paid for the equipment one of my best investments! Funny story: My Dad was using the heater I put in the blind he was using and after spending the morning hunting we all went to breakfast and I asked him how well he liked having heat, and his reply was, "great for about 20 minutes and then the damned thing quit and wouldn\'t re-light!" I asked him if he had opened any windows and he said "no, it wasn\'t light yet so I was just enjoying staying warm, until the heater went out!" I started laughing and he was taken aback by my reaction and asked why I was laughing, had I played a joke and given him the junk heater? I said no and told him he should be thankful Mr. Heater saved his life! Not knowing what I was referring to he had a puzzled look on his face, so I told him that the heater has a low oxygen sensor built into it and because he had the windows closed up fresh air could not circulate through the blind and the heater shut off before he could pass out from carbon monoxide poisoning! The look on his face was priceless! All he could say was "glad someone was looking out for him." After breakfast and getting some chores done we all went back to our blinds and my Dad made sure he opened some windows and lit the heater, and spent the rest of the day happy and warm. Moral of the story: The safety features built into Mr. Heater heaters work! Excellent design, quality built, and smart safety features all make Mr. Heater heaters great products you can trust and that make experiences during cold weather so much more enjoyable, and if having one gets a friend or family member to join in the fun, that\'s money well spent! Not to mention having the added insurance of staying warm at home should the power go out for an extended period of time during cold weather!   So, that\'s my experience with Mr. Heater heaters, and I can and do highly recommend to anyone needing and looking for a quality and dependable portable small heater, get one. You will be glad you did! ', 'Due to recently power outage frequently, I brought this protable heater for indoor use for emergency. I did not have chance to try it for hour long but I did try and find out it is very practical make and workable. Only issue to me is I don‚Äôt aware it need 4 D battery to run and how long one will last.Any how it is a very good product,I highly recommend it.', "Will be able to use it in my fish house, heat my area that I use for skinning and tanning the furs that I've trapped.  Like the fact that I can hook up to a larger propane tank.  The fan is a bonus and the 3 different heating levels are great also."]

column1: 18K LP CABINET HEATER
column4: ['I\'ve wrestled with the heating options for my sun room since my wife and daughter through out my "old" kerosene heaters.  I considered the small propane table top heaters but my wife nixed that idea.  The typical outdoor 8 foot high propane heaters would have probably have drawn to much oxygen from the 13\' X 20\' sun room.  As I searched for other heating options, I came across this heater that stored a 20 lb. tank and made it look aesthetically pleasing.  It provides the right amount of heat for various atmospheric conditions!', 'We use the heater to supplement our fuel oil furnace. Works great to give a shot of heat while maintaining an overall lower temperature while we are gone', 'We got the heater shortly before Christmas 2017 here in Texas. Same day it arrived we had a freeze. Heater was installed in a converted barn and temp got up to about 75 in 15min or so. We have been using it for about a week now in below freezing temps with no issues other than it takes a few clicks to get the pilot to light. With all 3 burners going I pointed my temp gun at the front. My gun only goes to 1,000 deg and the heater is over that.', "Great heater for my garage/workshop.  The heater puts out enough heat to warm up my 24' x x24' garage on a cold winters day (in Michigan).  With it's 3 settings (Lo, Med & Hi) I start on Hi to raise the temp, then I set it to Lo to maintain temp.  I like the idea that the LP tank is built into the heater (instead of a separate tank and extension hose).  It makes the heater easy to roll around the shop and set it where the heat is needed.  I've had no issues with it not starting or operating properly.All in all, this is one great little portable heater.  I'd definitely but it again.", 'It is exactly what we needed. Works great and heats fast. Great product.', 'It is used every day sometimes three or four times to take the chill off in my 14 x 30 cabin. Fifteen min. or so is all it takes even when it is 12 fa outside. Wish I had it last year. Thanks Mr Heater !', "I've had this heater for a month now and have used it in my garage. It works great in the garage even when it was 20 degrees outside. On high, I have to sit about 2 feet away or I start to get too hot. I normally turn it to medium setting once I start getting hot. It takes about 5 minutes to get up to full heat, and very minimum fumes.  I'm still using my first tank of gas! I love this heater!", 'This heater holds a 20-pound propane tank. It does a good job of providing radiant heat. The pilot light ignites automatically, making the heater easy to use. I am happy with it, although I have used it only three times so far.', 'fast shipping and heats up the area we needed it for quit fast', 'Works great, Gives off perfect amount of heat with the three settings.Recommended to anyone that is cold, and on a budget for heat.I first learned of these while in Greece in the navy. we used them over winter, where the climate was not so cold, but, you still needed something for quick heat to take the chill off.']

column1: LP GAS INFRARED HEATER
column4: ['The weather here in New Mexico has been quite cold, however, with my Mr. Heater,  I am able to continue my hobbies in our garage.  I is a super-comfortable source of heat!  My wife and I plan on having our evening glass of wine today using this heater.  It applies significant heat to keep out table area comfortable even if we have guests come over.  All-in-all it is a great source of instant heat for a multitude of uses.  Thanks.  Alfredo R. Padilla', "I used this heater for a home that was in the process of being converted from propane to natural gas. It maintained a 700+ sq-ft room between 67-70F with outside temps in the high 20's to low 30's and relative humidity %60+ with one burner on lowest setting. All you have to do is run it at max (all burners on high) until you get the room to the desired temperature, and then drop it down to one burner on low. If your room has decent insulation (mine is average) one burner on low will maintain the temp. With a FULL 40lb cylinder expect every bit of the manual's stated 70hr runtime with one burner on low.", 'It‚Äôs great and heats up my 20x50 un-insulated shop in about an hr in 30* weather.  I wish I‚Äôd got one a long time ago', 'So far it works well. The garage is around 600 square feet so this heats up to 750. so It should be enough for the hole garage. I also have the 2 burner so with both so be plenty on those real cold days.', 'This is my second "MR. Heater". My other heater was 11 years old. This newer model puts out greater amount of heat and I like the burners because of the adjustable heads. Well worth the money.', 'Used this item a few times Warms up area. Starts easy, Great item. Will get a lot of use out of item.', 'Pohhhhhhh dat tings hot hot baw. ', 'Great heater ', "BOUGHT A PROPANE TANK AT MENARD'S, $109.00. HEATER DOES EXACTLY  WHAT I WANTED, HEATS AN AREA IN MY GARAGE. TOTALLY HAPPY.", 'heats my 3 car garage in no time.']

column1: Stiebel Eltron 074058 120-Volt 1500-Watts Wall Mounted Electric Fan Heater
column4: ['When I bought my business, the 4 restrooms were heated only with surface mounted electric heaters. It seemed like I was replacing one at least every 2 years. They were poorly made, noisy, and had to be run with a separate thermostat that also was prone to fail.Then I bought the Stiebel Eltron. It is quiet, attractive looking, works GREAT, and has the thermostat built in. The quality is outstanding. I plan on replacing all of them with these. (And for comparison the cost is only slightly higher.)', 'Very simple to install and provides fairly even heat in a small room or additional heat in areas that need it when extremely cold outside . This is the second unit I bought and would not hesitate to purchase again .', 'Worked well, from the reviews I was expecting better than ones at 1/2 the price.   If the fan produced more volume it might have made the difference.  ', 'Looks great mounted on wall in my studio. Easy to hook up.', 'The best love it.', 'This is not a large heater, but it is just right for my needs.It will heat one small bedroom or bath with ease.Theromostat works great on this unit.Easy to install.This unit is has a sound level, I would say is very low.', "Exactly as described. But it doesn't come with electrical cord. So plan on supplying your own.", 'Great little heater. easy to install andlooks great!']

column4: ['This wall furnace is made well and works perfect. Select what ever temp you want and when it reaches that it reduces power by 50 %. All automatic. I may need to add another to bring  the temp up quickly but im sure one of these will maintain from that point. For a 104 bucks you cant beat it. column1: New Mr Heater Big Buddy Portable Propane Heater 18,000 BTU For Up To 450 Sq Ft
column4: ["This heater is fairly large.  Don't expect it to fit under your legs in the bleachers.  The handle is really handy, but makes it pretty tall.This heater is very versatile. It can be like the smaller versions with just one element on at half power, full power, or both elements on full power.  It goes through propane about the same as all the other ones I've seen, and full power is a lot of power.  The fan (powered by D cells) blows warm air in your direction, which is nice because otherwise it just goes straight up.IMHO it's way handier than the smaller bottle mounted version because it doesn't tip easily and it's not as tall.  It puts the heat in a better location.It's not a small heater, but is powerful, well built, and looks like it will last.", 'this id the 2nd one I have owned  first one was 5 years old and used every day it was cold it keeps our coach warm enough on low  and very economicl to run do recomend getting the hose with regolator and using a 20 pound bbq grill tank outside  and keeping a couple of the one pound throw aways in reserve incase of a midnight run out of gas senero , teriffic for those emergencies and blizzards requires no electric to run just a couple batteries to run the fan but will still  produce  het with out fan not operating . has the o2 depletion piliot light that lifts off if o2 level gets to low plus tip switch incase it gets tipped over by accident , Like any heating device care should be taken to assure you are opperating it in a safe manner and following the instructions that states the clearences on ll sides ', 'Current house furnace is out and this unit has filled in amazingly well.  Live in MN and have 2 of these with a couple electric room heaters for 2000 sqft plus home and been heating for a month.  Do recommend the 20# Walmart propane tanks w/ gauge for $48 and conversion hose to unit for more economical heating that the small canisters.  CAn heat for nearly a week.  Have CO monitor and never have had it go off once.  They are made to be CO free .  We do not leave them running when not home for safety reason but never yet had an issue.  ', 'I bought this to be able to work in my 2 car garage during cold days. It works very well. The only drawback I could see is that the fan moves very little air. Otherwise, I would have given it a 5 star rating....  Made the garage able to be worked in with no jacket in about 2 hours (on a 15 degree day)  Well worth it...   And would be great thing to have if an ice storm hits and the power (heat) went out...  Costs less than a buck an hour worth of propane to run on High.  I bought a 15 lb tank and ran it for about 18 hours.....    I plan on getting a couple of portable 1 lb bottles and a refill adapter.....', 'Got Mr. Heater for a heater in my outside work area and as an emergency backup heater in case of power failure in a storm or the heat pump went bad in middle of winter. Works perfect and am using hooked up to 20lb propane tank and also little 1lb tanks. Either way is working perfect.  This thing will run you out of house on 18,000 btu setting.  Always vent from a window or door to keep oxygen fresh and will be good for indoor use, you will still be plenty warm and no worries about any pipes freezing. Great product', "This little heater is just the ticket for quickly warming up our home on those chilly mornings. ,I live where we seldom get any colder than 40 degrees at night , we don't run any heater at night for safety reasons ,although I feel this heater is safer than any electric one , no cords to overheat . I turn it on in the morning and in 15 minutes the chill is taken off the house. I use a small fan to circulate the heat more than the one that comes with the heater which is efficient for one room.  I also purchased the 12 foot hose and regulator so I can hook to a 30 lbs bottle out side the house. just ran the hose through an existing tv cable  hole. I can get about a week of heat out of one bottle at 16.00 to refill. That is much cheaper than running electric space heaters.", "The dogs and I have a very comfortable warm environment now that the heater is able to be used. They are so happy that the inside of the motorhome is a lot more comfortable. We have been having nights that are in the upper twenties and low 30s so we're really grateful to have a heater the prize this my cheat on low setting it it basically heats the Whole 30 ft motorhome it generates more than enough heat on low and will run for a hundred hours on that setting .  It is very warm at got my  farm in Coupeville Washington. thanks a lot for a great item!!", 'I\'ve been hunting deer for 42 years now and never worried about the cold weather when I was younger, mostly because pop-up portable blinds and portable heaters like these were not available back then. But my youngest daughter started hunting with me 6 years ago and after watching her brave a particularly cold opening day her first year I decided there had to be a better setup so she could enjoy going with me and I could insure I would get to continue to enjoy spending such moments with her, so I bought my first ground blind and my first Mr. Heater Little Buddy heater, and closing weekend of rifle season was soooooo much more enjoyable. Having a heat source to warm our feet made all the difference in the world being able to sit beside my daughter and just watch her scan our surroundings for her first deer, and did she take a beauty! After realizing how great the difference in the experience having shelter and heat made, I broke down and bought blinds for my Dad, nephew, and great friend who owns the property where we hunt, and then decided everyone should be able to stay warm and enjoy their time in the field as well, so I retired my Little Buddy heater and bought three of the Buddy heaters and one of the heater/cooker models and stocked each blind with a heater. The difference between the Little Buddy and the bigger Buddy models is very noticeably different! Running the bigger Buddy heaters warmed up a two person ground blind sufficiently enough to allow us to take off our coats, even with several windows open, and sit comfortably without creating undue noise or alerts to the deer as we watched many feed and browse around in the field in front of us. Hunting went from a cold and trying event to a greatly enjoyed experience spending time with my daughter, my Dad, my nephew, and friend! I\'ve always said a bad day hunting or fishing is better than a good day working anytime, but having Mr. Heater Buddy heaters warming our ground blinds has made such a difference in our time spent together so much more enjoyable that now my oldest daughter is joining in, and that alone made any expense paid for the equipment one of my best investments! Funny story: My Dad was using the heater I put in the blind he was using and after spending the morning hunting we all went to breakfast and I asked him how well he liked having heat, and his reply was, "great for about 20 minutes and then the damned thing quit and wouldn\'t re-light!" I asked him if he had opened any windows and he said "no, it wasn\'t light yet so I was just enjoying staying warm, until the heater went out!" I started laughing and he was taken aback by my reaction and asked why I was laughing, had I played a joke and given him the junk heater? I said no and told him he should be thankful Mr. Heater saved his life! Not knowing what I was referring to he had a puzzled look on his face, so I told him that the heater has a low oxygen sensor built into it and because he had the windows closed up fresh air could not circulate through the blind and the heater shut off before he could pass out from carbon monoxide poisoning! The look on his face was priceless! All he could say was "glad someone was looking out for him." After breakfast and getting some chores done we all went back to our blinds and my Dad made sure he opened some windows and lit the heater, and spent the rest of the day happy and warm. Moral of the story: The safety features built into Mr. Heater heaters work! Excellent design, quality built, and smart safety features all make Mr. Heater heaters great products you can trust and that make experiences during cold weather so much more enjoyable, and if having one gets a friend or family member to join in the fun, that\'s money well spent! Not to mention having the added insurance of staying warm at home should the power go out for an extended period of time during cold weather!   So, that\'s my experience with Mr. Heater heaters, and I can and do highly recommend to anyone needing and looking for a quality and dependable portable small heater, get one. You will be glad you did! ', 'Due to recently power outage frequently, I brought this protable heater for indoor use for emergency. I did not have chance to try it for hour long but I did try and find out it is very practical make and workable. Only issue to me is I don‚Äôt aware it need 4 D battery to run and how long one will last.Any how it is a very good product,I highly recommend it.', "Will be able to use it in my fish house, heat my area that I use for skinning and tanning the furs that I've trapped.  Like the fact that I can hook up to a larger propane tank.  The fan is a bonus and the 3 different heating levels are great also."]

column1: 18K LP CABINET HEATER
column4: ['I\'ve wrestled with the heating options for my sun room since my wife and daughter through out my "old" kerosene heaters.  I considered the small propane table top heaters but my wife nixed that idea.  The typical outdoor 8 foot high propane heaters would have probably have drawn to much oxygen from the 13\' X 20\' sun room.  As I searched for other heating options, I came across this heater that stored a 20 lb. tank and made it look aesthetically pleasing.  It provides the right amount of heat for various atmospheric conditions!', 'We use the heater to supplement our fuel oil furnace. Works great to give a shot of heat while maintaining an overall lower temperature while we are gone', 'We got the heater shortly before Christmas 2017 here in Texas. Same day it arrived we had a freeze. Heater was installed in a converted barn and temp got up to about 75 in 15min or so. We have been using it for about a week now in below freezing temps with no issues other than it takes a few clicks to get the pilot to light. With all 3 burners going I pointed my temp gun at the front. My gun only goes to 1,000 deg and the heater is over that.', "Great heater for my garage/workshop.  The heater puts out enough heat to warm up my 24' x x24' garage on a cold winters day (in Michigan).  With it's 3 settings (Lo, Med & Hi) I start on Hi to raise the temp, then I set it to Lo to maintain temp.  I like the idea that the LP tank is built into the heater (instead of a separate tank and extension hose).  It makes the heater easy to roll around the shop and set it where the heat is needed.  I've had no issues with it not starting or operating properly.All in all, this is one great little portable heater.  I'd definitely but it again.", 'It is exactly what we needed. Works great and heats fast. Great product.', 'It is used every day sometimes three or four times to take the chill off in my 14 x 30 cabin. Fifteen min. or so is all it takes even when it is 12 fa outside. Wish I had it last year. Thanks Mr Heater !', "I've had this heater for a month now and have used it in my garage. It works great in the garage even when it was 20 degrees outside. On high, I have to sit about 2 feet away or I start to get too hot. I normally turn it to medium setting once I start getting hot. It takes about 5 minutes to get up to full heat, and very minimum fumes.  I'm still using my first tank of gas! I love this heater!", 'This heater holds a 20-pound propane tank. It does a good job of providing radiant heat. The pilot light ignites automatically, making the heater easy to use. I am happy with it, although I have used it only three times so far.', 'fast shipping and heats up the area we needed it for quit fast', 'Works great, Gives off perfect amount of heat with the three settings.Recommended to anyone that is cold, and on a budget for heat.I first learned of these while in Greece in the navy. we used them over winter, where the climate was not so cold, but, you still needed something for quick heat to take the chill off.']

column1: LP GAS INFRARED HEATER
column4: ['The weather here in New Mexico has been quite cold, however, with my Mr. Heater,  I am able to continue my hobbies in our garage.  I is a super-comfortable source of heat!  My wife and I plan on having our evening glass of wine today using this heater.  It applies significant heat to keep out table area comfortable even if we have guests come over.  All-in-all it is a great source of instant heat for a multitude of uses.  Thanks.  Alfredo R. Padilla', "I used this heater for a home that was in the process of being converted from propane to natural gas. It maintained a 700+ sq-ft room between 67-70F with outside temps in the high 20's to low 30's and relative humidity %60+ with one burner on lowest setting. All you have to do is run it at max (all burners on high) until you get the room to the desired temperature, and then drop it down to one burner on low. If your room has decent insulation (mine is average) one burner on low will maintain the temp. With a FULL 40lb cylinder expect every bit of the manual's stated 70hr runtime with one burner on low.", 'It‚Äôs great and heats up my 20x50 un-insulated shop in about an hr in 30* weather.  I wish I‚Äôd got one a long time ago', 'So far it works well. The garage is around 600 square feet so this heats up to 750. so It should be enough for the hole garage. I also have the 2 burner so with both so be plenty on those real cold days.', 'This is my second "MR. Heater". My other heater was 11 years old. This newer model puts out greater amount of heat and I like the burners because of the adjustable heads. Well worth the money.', 'Used this item a few times Warms up area. Starts easy, Great item. column4: ['When I bought my business, the 4 restrooms were heated only with surface mounted electric heaters. It seemed like I was replacing one at least every 2 years. column1: New Mr Heater Big Buddy Portable Propane Heater 18,000 BTU For Up To 450 Sq Ft
column4: ["This heater is fairly large.  Don't expect it to fit under your legs in the bleachers.  The handle is really handy, but makes it pretty tall.This heater is very versatile. It can be like the smaller versions with just one element on at half power, full power, or both elements on full power.  It goes through propane about the same as all the other ones I've seen, and full power is a lot of power.  The fan (powered by D cells) blows warm air in your direction, which is nice because otherwise it just goes straight up.IMHO it's way handier than the smaller bottle mounted version because it doesn't tip easily and it's not as tall.  It puts the heat in a better location.It's not a small heater, but is powerful, well built, and looks like it will last.", 'this id the 2nd one I have owned  first one was 5 years old and used every day it was cold it keeps our coach warm enough on low  and very economicl to run do recomend getting the hose with regolator and using a 20 pound bbq grill tank outside  and keeping a couple of the one pound throw aways in reserve incase of a midnight run out of gas senero , teriffic for those emergencies and blizzards requires no electric to run just a couple batteries to run the fan but will still  produce  het with out fan not operating . has the o2 depletion piliot light that lifts off if o2 level gets to low plus tip switch incase it gets tipped over by accident , Like any heating device care should be taken to assure you are opperating it in a safe manner and following the instructions that states the clearences on ll sides ', 'Current house furnace is out and this unit has filled in amazingly well.  Live in MN and have 2 of these with a couple electric room heaters for 2000 sqft plus home and been heating for a month.  Do recommend the 20# Walmart propane tanks w/ gauge for $48 and conversion hose to unit for more economical heating that the small canisters.  CAn heat for nearly a week.  Have CO monitor and never have had it go off once.  They are made to be CO free .  We do not leave them running when not home for safety reason but never yet had an issue.  ', 'I bought this to be able to work in my 2 car garage during cold days. It works very well. The only drawback I could see is that the fan moves very little air. Otherwise, I would have given it a 5 star rating....  Made the garage able to be worked in with no jacket in about 2 hours (on a 15 degree day)  Well worth it...   And would be great thing to have if an ice storm hits and the power (heat) went out...  Costs less than a buck an hour worth of propane to run on High.  I bought a 15 lb tank and ran it for about 18 hours.....    I plan on getting a couple of portable 1 lb bottles and a refill adapter.....', 'Got Mr. Heater for a heater in my outside work area and as an emergency backup heater in case of power failure in a storm or the heat pump went bad in middle of winter. Works perfect and am using hooked up to 20lb propane tank and also little 1lb tanks. Either way is working perfect.  This thing will run you out of house on 18,000 btu setting.  Always vent from a window or door to keep oxygen fresh and will be good for indoor use, you will still be plenty warm and no worries about any pipes freezing. Great product', "This little heater is just the ticket for quickly warming up our home on those chilly mornings. ,I live where we seldom get any colder than 40 degrees at night , we don't run any heater at night for safety reasons ,although I feel this heater is safer than any electric one , no cords to overheat . I turn it on in the morning and in 15 minutes the chill is taken off the house. I use a small fan to circulate the heat more than the one that comes with the heater which is efficient for one room.  I also purchased the 12 foot hose and regulator so I can hook to a 30 lbs bottle out side the house. just ran the hose through an existing tv cable  hole. I can get about a week of heat out of one bottle at 16.00 to refill. That is much cheaper than running electric space heaters.", "The dogs and I have a very comfortable warm environment now that the heater is able to be used. They are so happy that the inside of the motorhome is a lot more comfortable. We have been having nights that are in the upper twenties and low 30s so we're really grateful to have a heater the prize this my cheat on low setting it it basically heats the Whole 30 ft motorhome it generates more than enough heat on low and will run for a hundred hours on that setting .  It is very warm at got my  farm in Coupeville Washington. thanks a lot for a great item!!", 'I\'ve been hunting deer for 42 years now and never worried about the cold weather when I was younger, mostly because pop-up portable blinds and portable heaters like these were not available back then. But my youngest daughter started hunting with me 6 years ago and after watching her brave a particularly cold opening day her first year I decided there had to be a better setup so she could enjoy going with me and I could insure I would get to continue to enjoy spending such moments with her, so I bought my first ground blind and my first Mr. Heater Little Buddy heater, and closing weekend of rifle season was soooooo much more enjoyable. Having a heat source to warm our feet made all the difference in the world being able to sit beside my daughter and just watch her scan our surroundings for her first deer, and did she take a beauty! After realizing how great the difference in the experience having shelter and heat made, I broke down and bought blinds for my Dad, nephew, and great friend who owns the property where we hunt, and then decided everyone should be able to stay warm and enjoy their time in the field as well, so I retired my Little Buddy heater and bought three of the Buddy heaters and one of the heater/cooker models and stocked each blind with a heater. The difference between the Little Buddy and the bigger Buddy models is very noticeably different! Running the bigger Buddy heaters warmed up a two person ground blind sufficiently enough to allow us to take off our coats, even with several windows open, and sit comfortably without creating undue noise or alerts to the deer as we watched many feed and browse around in the field in front of us. Hunting went from a cold and trying event to a greatly enjoyed experience spending time with my daughter, my Dad, my nephew, and friend! I\'ve always said a bad day hunting or fishing is better than a good day working anytime, but having Mr. Heater Buddy heaters warming our ground blinds has made such a difference in our time spent together so much more enjoyable that now my oldest daughter is joining in, and that alone made any expense paid for the equipment one of my best investments! Funny story: My Dad was using the heater I put in the blind he was using and after spending the morning hunting we all went to breakfast and I asked him how well he liked having heat, and his reply was, "great for about 20 minutes and then the damned thing quit and wouldn\'t re-light!" I asked him if he had opened any windows and he said "no, it wasn\'t light yet so I was just enjoying staying warm, until the heater went out!" I started laughing and he was taken aback by my reaction and asked why I was laughing, had I played a joke and given him the junk heater? I said no and told him he should be thankful Mr. Heater saved his life! Not knowing what I was referring to he had a puzzled look on his face, so I told him that the heater has a low oxygen sensor built into it and because he had the windows closed up fresh air could not circulate through the blind and the heater shut off before he could pass out from carbon monoxide poisoning! The look on his face was priceless! All he could say was "glad someone was looking out for him." After breakfast and getting some chores done we all went back to our blinds and my Dad made sure he opened some windows and lit the heater, and spent the rest of the day happy and warm. Moral of the story: The safety features built into Mr. Heater heaters work! Excellent design, quality built, and smart safety features all make Mr. Heater heaters great products you can trust and that make experiences during cold weather so much more enjoyable, and if having one gets a friend or family member to join in the fun, that\'s money well spent! Not to mention having the added insurance of staying warm at home should the power go out for an extended period of time during cold weather!   So, that\'s my experience with Mr. Heater heaters, and I can and do highly recommend to anyone needing and looking for a quality and dependable portable small heater, get one. You will be glad you did! ', 'Due to recently power outage frequently, I brought this protable heater for indoor use for emergency. I did not have chance to try it for hour long but I did try and find out it is very practical make and workable. Only issue to me is I don‚Äôt aware it need 4 D battery to run and how long one will last.Any how it is a very good product,I highly recommend it.', "Will be able to use it in my fish house, heat my area that I use for skinning and tanning the furs that I've trapped.  Like the fact that I can hook up to a larger propane tank.  The fan is a bonus and the 3 different heating levels are great also."]

column1: 18K LP CABINET HEATER
column4: ['I\'ve wrestled with the heating options for my sun room since my wife and daughter through out my "old" kerosene heaters.  I considered the small propane table top heaters but my wife nixed that idea.  The typical outdoor 8 foot high propane heaters would have probably have drawn to much oxygen from the 13\' X 20\' sun room.  As I searched for other heating options, I came across this heater that stored a 20 lb. tank and made it look aesthetically pleasing.  It provides the right amount of heat for various atmospheric conditions!', 'We use the heater to supplement our fuel oil furnace. Works great to give a shot of heat while maintaining an overall lower temperature while we are gone', 'We got the heater shortly before Christmas 2017 here in Texas. Same day it arrived we had a freeze. Heater was installed in a converted barn and temp got up to about 75 in 15min or so. We have been using it for about a week now in below freezing temps with no issues other than it takes a few clicks to get the pilot to light. With all 3 burners going I pointed my temp gun at the front. My gun only goes to 1,000 deg and the heater is over that.', "Great heater for my garage/workshop.  The heater puts out enough heat to warm up my 24' x x24' garage on a cold winters day (in Michigan).  With it's 3 settings (Lo, Med & Hi) I start on Hi to raise the temp, then I set it to Lo to maintain temp.  I like the idea that the LP tank is built into the heater (instead of a separate tank and extension hose).  It makes the heater easy to roll around the shop and set it where the heat is needed.  I've had no issues with it not starting or operating properly.All in all, this is one great little portable heater.  I'd definitely but it again.", 'It is exactly what we needed. Works great and heats fast. Great product.', 'It is used every day sometimes three or four times to take the chill off in my 14 x 30 cabin. Fifteen min. or so is all it takes even when it is 12 fa outside. Wish I had it last year. Thanks Mr Heater !', "I've had this heater for a month now and have used it in my garage. It works great in the garage even when it was 20 degrees outside. On high, I have to sit about 2 feet away or I start to get too hot. I normally turn it to medium setting once I start getting hot. It takes about 5 minutes to get up to full heat, and very minimum fumes.  I'm still using my first tank of gas! I love this heater!", 'This heater holds a 20-pound propane tank. It does a good job of providing radiant heat. The pilot light ignites automatically, making the heater easy to use. I am happy with it, although I have used it only three times so far.', 'fast shipping and heats up the area we needed it for quit fast', 'Works great, Gives off perfect amount of heat with the three settings.Recommended to anyone that is cold, and on a budget for heat.I first learned of these while in Greece in the navy. we used them over winter, where the climate was not so cold, but, you still needed something for quick heat to take the chill off.']

column1: LP GAS INFRARED HEATER
column4: ['The weather here in New Mexico has been quite cold, however, with my Mr. Heater,  I am able to continue my hobbies in our garage.  I is a super-comfortable source of heat!  My wife and I plan on having our evening glass of wine today using this heater.  It applies significant heat to keep out table area comfortable even if we have guests come over.  All-in-all it is a great source of instant heat for a multitude of uses.  Thanks.  Alfredo R. Padilla', "I used this heater for a home that was in the process of being converted from propane to natural gas. It maintained a 700+ sq-ft room between 67-70F with outside temps in the high 20's to low 30's and relative humidity %60+ with one burner on lowest setting. All you have to do is run it at max (all burners on high) until you get the room to the desired temperature, and then drop it down to one burner on low. If your room has decent insulation (mine is average) one burner on low will maintain the temp. With a FULL 40lb cylinder expect every bit of the manual's stated 70hr runtime with one burner on low.", 'It‚Äôs great and heats up my 20x50 un-insulated shop in about an hr in 30* weather.  I wish I‚Äôd got one a long time ago', 'So far it works well. The garage is around 600 square feet so this heats up to 750. so It should be enough for the hole garage. I also have the 2 burner so with both so be plenty on those real cold days.', 'This is my second "MR. Heater". My other heater was 11 years old. This newer model puts out greater amount of heat and I like the burners because of the adjustable heads. Well worth the money.', 'Used this item a few times Warms up area. Starts easy, Great item. Will get a lot of use out of item.', 'Pohhhhhhh dat tings hot hot baw. ', 'Great heater ', "BOUGHT A PROPANE TANK AT MENARD'S, $109.00. HEATER DOES EXACTLY  WHAT I WANTED, HEATS AN AREA IN MY GARAGE. TOTALLY HAPPY.", 'heats my 3 car garage in no time.']

column1: Stiebel Eltron 074058 120-Volt 1500-Watts Wall Mounted Electric Fan Heater
column4: ['When I bought my business, the 4 restrooms were heated only with surface mounted electric heaters. It seemed like I was replacing one at least every 2 years. They were poorly made, noisy, and had to be run with a separate thermostat that also was prone to fail.Then I bought the Stiebel Eltron. It is quiet, attractive looking, works GREAT, and has the thermostat built in. The quality is outstanding. I plan on replacing all of them with these. (And for comparison the cost is only slightly higher.)', 'Very simple to install and provides fairly even heat in a small room or additional heat in areas that need it when extremely cold outside . This is the second unit I bought and would not hesitate to purchase again .', 'Worked well, from the reviews I was expecting better than ones at 1/2 the price.   If the fan produced more volume it might have made the difference.  ', 'Looks great mounted on wall in my studio. Easy to hook up.', 'The best love it.', 'This is not a large heater, but it is just right for my needs.It will heat one small bedroom or bath with ease.Theromostat works great on this unit.Easy to install.This unit is has a sound level, I would say is very low.', "Exactly as described. But it doesn't come with electrical cord. So plan on supplying your own.", 'Great little heater. easy to install andlooks great!']

column1: Dyna-Glo RA18LPDG 18,000 BTU Portable Rolling Propane Cabinet Heater 600sq ft
column4: ['A bit smelly at the beginning due that the paint is burning. Smell will go away in the 1st week. The front grill (chromed) will turn dark a bit but that‚Äôs to be expected. Enough heat for a 4x6m room when usign Liquid Propane gas. I used Butane and it was amazingly efficient (you feel the heat even with the pilot! Not even a single burner) but butane is difficult to find where i live.Comes with gas regulator, ready for a left internal thread. Easy to operate and very light to move around the house. Planning to buy another one for the 1st floor of the house. ', 'Amazing.  Really throws out a lot of heat.  Easy to set up, easy to use.  Cools off super fast too.  I use it on a front porch that has vinyl covers the open areas and open holes through the concrete base.  Maybe 100 square feet and on low it gets warm and toasty.  ', 'comes with wheels easy to install, and heat comes clean. tested with my CO (carbon monoxide) detector and is good for indoors. been using it on a rental property for couple days now. 3 settings for heat intensity. propane bottle doesnt go out as fast like other heaters.', "This is a dyna-glo brand 6-18K BTU.3 burner panels knob controls 1,2,3 burner lighted.This would create 6,12,18k btu of heating output.Easy to setup with 20lb tank counter clockwise to tighten.Heats my 5-700 sq ft up to 70+ with 2 burners active in less /hr 50F ambient.Be safe with enclosed spaces with this, needs adequate ventilation.Have a carbon monoxide detector in airspace proximity.Doesn't produce much of a smell when burning, only during first few hours of being new.", "this is my 3rd one, have one in my living room, one in family room. this one is just a backup. saw this advertised on five sights  3 said not for indoor use but others said that was just a disclaimer. i've used it indoors for 3 years with no problems.  i did disconnect the tipover device because it would not reset sometimes. great backup heating system", "This is a great heater. I have a 1500sq ft house that I heat with this heater and it will roast you out of the house. I usually run it on low and I put a little clamp on fan on top to push the heat out. The break in took awhile to burn off the new of it but after that there is no smell what so ever. It's easy to operate. I use it in the evening just to keep my electric bill down.", "the buddy company makes one similar but this one makes the same heat it is a construction heater so not intended for use in your home(but that is just for the lawyers it is meant to heat a small area but one without clutter since items should be away from a 3 foot radius of 180 deg of the front the pilot lighting can be confusing for the stupid since you have to constantly hold down the pilot position for a few seconds then click the ignitor and leave it held down till the thermocouple heats which takes about 15 secondsso if you are a moron just buy an electric heateri heat my front room on setting 3 till it gets as warm as i like it  than outside then switch it to position 2 only complaints are the wheels don't roll well(yes i have the locking wheels unlocked)and the tank fitting is the old left hand  type instead of the easier to use new plastic (righty tighty)acme type that is on all propane tanks made after 1996also taking off and putting on the flimsy rear tank retainer is a bit annoying it would be better if it had a hinge and latch  instead of tabs and slots", 'Needed something for back up heat due to our electricity being off frequently during storms and etc. This is an excellent source of quick and versatile heat. The ability to adjust from 6,000 to 18,000 BTUs makes it perfect. Build quality seems to be adequate. This is really a no brainer.', "By every measure, this is wonderful heater. This heater quickly heats a 144 sqft room in 3-4 mins when using it at full capacity going from 40F to 70F. Excellent starting with the pilot light and it is easy to move (but the castors are probably not the greatest). At minimum capacity keeps an entire 2000sqft house from going below 62F when it is 22F outside (but this will also be dependent on air allowed in and insulation as well). Unlike electric, this gives off a pleasant infrared light that will heat things it is pointed at. This is quite nice since heated air is lighter than colder air and rises, but a chair or clothing 3-10ft away will warm from the light emissions. You can sit 3 ft away from it and warm your hands as if it was a camp fire from this light. You can also feel the hot air going straight up into the air.  Make sure you keep clear of the grill as in loose clothes or your leg. Also according to directions you are not suppose to leave it on unattended. But, one of the first things we did was roast marshmallows using long metal rods. For s'mores, you can get the perfect golden marshmallow. (even though it's not marketed as a marshmallow toaster).Between medium-to-high quality, portability, cost efficiency, and the shear fact that it paid for itself in less than one month from switching away from heating with electricity, I give it five stars.  ", 'We have heat pumps in our house and on those really cold nights they just don‚Äôt do the trick. We got this heater just for a little extra warmth and we have been shocked on how easy and warm it is. I found out that we only need to run it on low because medium and height is way to much. Great product.']

column1: DYNA-GLO RMC-LPC200DG Convctn Prtble Gas Flr Heatr,LP,4700sqft
column4: ['Recently we‚Äôve had some really cold days in the northeast. My little 60k propane heater just wasn‚Äôt cutting it in my 2 car garage. Decided after reading reviews of this heater that I‚Äôd give it a try. It met all expectations. On high, It got my garage from 25 to about 90 in 30 minutes, then a low setting keeps the garage really comfortable. But warned, on high, its loud. My next project is a ceiling fan to force the heat down. I definitely recommend this heater. ', 'Really good heater, using it for a 3000 sq ft shop.  Shop has 16ft walls and 23 ft to the peak, insulated it heats up enough to take the chill off in 20-30 mins.  Increase of approx 20 degrees.  A little loud on full blast, but what to expect at 200k btu?', 'I started it and ran it on high with my garage door open to burn the paint off then after the paint was all cooked I closed the door still on high came back to my single car garage 5min later and my garage was at 80 degreeson the high setting it is quite loudIt puts out a lot of heatI wish I had one of these heater years ago', 'You will want a bigger propane tank than a 20 pounder. This beast heats well and quick  but it loves propane.', 'Great product, I use it to heat a 1200sq ft shop. awesome.', 'This only took 5 minutes to assemble.  It started quickly and gave off plenty of heat.  Just what I need to warm up my garage on a cold day.', 'this is a great buy got to heat the shop an does a excellent job.', 'Follow the instructions manual with common sense and sit back and enjoy the warmth radiating quickly.', 'Metal seems a little thin but puts out a lot of heat when on max setting.', "This unit seems cheaply made when you first open it, however you are not using it to carry anything. When it comes to heat output, man don't get to close. It works and sounds like a torpedo heater, but stands upright. Great heater, highly recommend."]

column1: MR. HEATER F242540 Pack of 2
column4: ["Easy to set-up and really puts out the heat.  On the lowest setting this thing gets super hot!  I live in Wisconsin, on a 18 degree November morning this heater warmed our non-insulated 2-1/2 car garage to 72 degrees in a little over 2 hours (on the highest setting).  Does not come with electronic ignition but that's not a deal breaker.  Starts easily (just don't stand above it when lighting)    Seems well made.  Quality product with very good packaging.  I do not regret this purchase!", 'I use to have a smaller, 15000 size tank top and the winters in the cinder block garage were tough. This product is faster and I feel more efficient to operate, thumbs up here', 'I use this out in my 20x12 shed, keeps me warm when I am working or just sitting out there. It get pretty cold where I live and it is nice to go out and fire it up. Within a couple minutes, it‚Äôs toasty, ready to work. ', "I think that it's ok for use inside a shop but not for what I wanted to use it for which is outside use. now that's not the fault of the seller, it was on me and this by no means is a bad review.  I take full responsibility for this purchase. thanks ", 'Easy assembly and has plenty of heating power, its also a low profile so is space saving, also simple to light with a wood match or long lighter', 'Great emergency heater!  It took no time to heat up a couple rooms of a little trailer, and the heater was only on low!  At that setting a tank of propane should last around 14hrs.  I imagine on high it would be the type of heater that several people could stand around in some pretty cold weather and keep warm, like during ice skating.  Even on high, a tank should last about 9.5hrs.  A good value!', "I love this little gadget. We've had the tall metal heaters for years and they've gotten so rusty and nasty and they take up so much room on our deck. This one is small, easy to hook up, easy to use, and it really heats the place up.", 'I really like it. Type this into YouTube and see my video reviewType... Mr. Heater F242540 45,000 BTU 540 Degree Propane Heater.I made the review I was looking for and could not find. My gas meter and regulator went bad in Pennsylvania on one of the coldest days of the year. I was caught unprepared. Now at least I have a backup portable heat source. I wish I could add my video to this post but it will only let me add pictures. So go check out my video.', 'It works awesome but eats up propane fast. On low a 20 lb tank only lasts about 6 hrs. But i still love it', 'I got it because i use in in my outside carport So i can  work on my snowblower or generator when its cold i have no other place to do this i put up a plastic sheet at the opening of the carport which is still well ventilated so it works good but takes more time since its not a garage but for now i can keep warm while i work  I am glad i got it. ']

column1: Mr. Heater MH9BX Portable Propane Buddy Heater NEW!
column4: ["I have been hunting working outside and in the elements for the last 25 years. I particularly use this brand and model for most of my outdoor activities when the need for heat rises. This product is one of the best and only ones that I carried for hunting ice fishing and other activities period lightweight excellent instruction dependable and reliable on a scale of 1 to 10 I give it a 9.5. Only for the fact nothing is ever truly perfect. But if I've ever had an issue with one it was sent back one was replaced or fixed with no problems or issues I highly recommend this unit for anyone looking for a portable way to keep warm on the go outdoors in the elements.", "I haven't actually tried it on a camping trip yet but I am confident that this will be sufficient to safely take the chill off my conversion van so I am to catch a few hours nap when traveling without running the gas engine to keep warm. It's very easy to use but be patient after installing the LP gas bottle. You will have to hold the button starer for 30-60 second to purge the fuel line of air before the gas actually starts flowing to the burner. Once purged it starts very quickly!", 'It is a wonderful product.  It is very simple to operate and has an attractive design.  It burns very cleanly with only a faint smell of propane.  Even on the low setting, it warms a 300-ft. area very quickly.  I do not yet know how long a one-pound container of Propane will burn.   It also has a convenient carrying case that holds the heater unit and two one-pound bottles of Propane.  That makes it easy to store, and it takes up very little space. I give it five stars (out of a possible five).  We had an ice storm in Oklahoma last year that knocked out power for over a week; my little apartment was freezing.  With Mr. Heater in the closet, I feel safe and secure for the next power outage.', "Well first of all I started out as a Coleman heater man and I didn't think no other propane heater brand could outdo the Coleman product but Mr heater portable buddy does with greater heat output. The only thing that Mr heater could improve on is a way to regulate the heat temperature. It's just low 4000 btu to high 9000 btu and that can get to hot in a small area. Other than that so far, I find it to be a very good propane heater. Won't be going back to Coleman. For one thing their heaters wear out fast.", "i really like this heater,this is the second one i bought.. the first one is still working fine..i'm writing this review based on that one. it has worked flawlessly. i use it all the time on the boat, all winter..it's a 34 foot boat with a large cabin that i use all winter.10 mins and the chill is gone. in 30 mins we're opening coats and relaxing..a 1 lb tank lasts all night on high..have taken it camping this year.. kept us warm & cozy.the downloaded pdf instruction manual says it's safe for indoor use..but there still a CO2 warning..as with any other fire producing device..haven't had any problems at all with it...although i did have to clean a spider web from the pilot light in the fall.. i took the entire thing apart jut to see how it works.. very simple to work on..and i checked on line for any replacement parts.. all of the parts are available and fairly cheap.that makes it totally fixable..the safety features work almost too well.. a bump and it shuts off.. never had the tip over safety needed, but it has been checked.new in the store for 95$.. bought it used for 65/w shipping..", "If you are considering to buy a portable gas heater, so it's the one you have been looking for. It's very safe, light, has posibility to connect to big tank and looks solid.It has few safety off switches: turn over, flame out and low oxygen (this one I wasn't able to find in any other device) so this means that you can use it almost anywhere. It is very light and it came with carycase with wich it is even more comfartable to have it with you. It use not that much propane compared to how much heat it gives. It has two working modes High an Low. so far I have noticed that it uses about 100 grams (3.5 ounces) per hour in High mode and I think that it might use more than twice in low mode. It gives sufient heat to heat a room of 140 feet. And if it is not enaugh for you it has it's biger version with twice more power.Though it gives a bit of odor, but it is not that much noticible.So as I said, if you are looking for portable gas heater it is the one.", "I bought this heater to take along tent camping when I go to different hunting places throughout the state. The heater seems to be very dependable. It is easy to start and to stop. I have used other Mr. Heater brand heaters for several years and they hold up well. The size is correct for my needs and heats my space easily. The 1 pound bottle attaches easily and is removed easily. It's a great little heater. It is a bit larger than I expected, but that does not effect how I will use it.", "The Buddy Heater is an excellent idea with some flaws. I use mine nearly every day of winter. A ceramic heater is perfect for indoor use. You don't have to worry about carbon monoxide gas, and if you crack a window, the oxygen won't deplete. I love my heater! However, the Buddy Heater is not engineered well. All gas and propane are saturated with a very stinky oil which smells like rotten eggs so you will recognize it when you smell it. The Buddy Heater's small tubing, which delivers the gas to the the pilot light and ceramic heater, will condense out this oil in cold weather. When the tube fills with oil to a certain point, oil will get to the pilot orifice tube; this tube has a special glass filled hole that meters the pilot flame. Once that clogs -no pilot flame. No pilot flame, no worky. Mr Heater will sell you another pilot and ignition set, but this does not address the oil sitting in the tube. It will clog even faster. I have tried to call them to encourage them to change the design, but they just ignore me. My solution, and it works, is to carefully take the back off, remove the pilot assembly, unscrew the pilot orifice and put a pipe cleaner through the supply line. I then take pliers and put the orifice piece over a torch flame and heat it until it is smoking; hot enough to burn out the oil. I put it back together and it will work for another 2 months, (everyday use) before it clogs again. I  tried buying their in-line filter, but it still clogs up. The oil molecules are small enough to get past the filter. So I recommend the heater, but it's a real hassle when it stops working on a cold night!", "Excellent for portability and heating. Easy to use and simple to clean.  The downside of portable heaters it the short heating time.. 3 hours on full... up to 8 hours on ... thrifty usage.  Let alone the high cost of propane items now.For a permanent long time use I recommend the Olympian series heaters for durability.. all metal. The buddy heaters are excellent tho with excellent components and durability.Don't drop em tho.. the thermocouple moves a bit and it'll shut off all the time if you do not know where to move it back to.", 'I already had a good experience with the Mr Heater MH9B since my dad had purchased 3 of these a few years ago for our various hunting shacks. Very pleased with the updated design making the lighting of the heater easier with the pilot ignitor built into the adjustment knob and the swivel connector for the propane tank is a nice feature. Did an excellent job heating my hunting blind and also the area in my garage where we processed our deer. Would strongly recommend this heater to anyone.']

column1: Broan 112 Kickspace Fan-Forced Wall Heater with Built-In Thermostat White
column4: ["The Broan 112 heater came just as advertised as an open box item.  Once opened it was perfect, no scratches or dents.  The heater was received and installed in mid September and it worked great, quiet and smooth.  This week when we went to turn it on as the weather got colder, the fan spun up but made this awful clatter.  I took off the top but could not see anything that was causing the noise.  Then the unit stopped altogether, the fan wouldn't start up and no heat was emitted.  This unit replaced the same model that we had for the last 6 to 7 years with no problems.  We really like the heater but we're upset that this unit did not work.", 'This is kick space heater replaced one of same model. Worked well and quiet', 'Only issue is could be quieter', 'Product was advertised as 240 but was used and rewired to 120', 'the heater works great, but is a bit loud.  perfect otherwise', 'Work really great easily install heat great. Not a cheap built real tough. Not noisy at all. For a built in thermostat heat control is perfect.']

column4: ['We bought two heaters by different manufacturers in order to compare. This one is quieter and heats better. The thermostat works better and is more accurate. Great unit, it keeps a 230 square foot room warm even in 10 degree F weather.', 'I bought this heater to replace the same one I installed in my lower level bathroom 20 years ago. The replacement was exactly the same size which made the replacement of the internal parts in the existing sheet metal frame very fast. It works well for this small bath to take the chill of the lower level out between heating seasons. After removing the existing Broan 174 I saw a build up of lint/dust on the back side of the heater eliment and it may not have been bad to begin with, so I will keep that in mind if it starts smelling hot (In the next 20 years). Bottom line is it work well to heat a small room quickly.', 'Very good to use in a small bathroom,I run it 240v for less power consumption ', 'it was exactly what I wanted --keeps my small bathroom very warm', 'Easy to install, heat is fast, fan is quiet, looks great.', 'This is the 5th of these heaters I have purchased.  Mostly used in bathrooms and bedrooms both in my own home and in rental properties.  They are reliable, and very quiet, put forth plenty of gentle warm heat without worrying if a small child is close to them.  Excellent product.', 'this heater does exactly what it is build to do .and the support is great and will work well with you.', 'Good quality heater.  Easy to install. column4: ["The Broan 112 heater came just as advertised as an open box item.  Once opened it was perfect, no scratches or dents.  The heater was received and installed in mid September and it worked great, quiet and smooth.  This week when we went to turn it on as the weather got colder, the fan spun up but made this awful clatter.  I took off the top but could not see anything that was causing the noise.  Then the unit stopped altogether, the fan wouldn't start up and no heat was emitted.  This unit replaced the same model that we had for the last 6 to 7 years with no problems.  We really like the heater but we're upset that this unit did not work.", 'This is kick space heater replaced one of same model. Worked well and quiet', 'Only issue is could be quieter', 'Product was advertised as 240 but was used and rewired to 120', 'the heater works great, but is a bit loud.  perfect otherwise', 'Work really great easily install heat great. Not a cheap built real tough. Not noisy at all. For a built in thermostat heat control is perfect.']

column1: Portable Propane Heater Indoor-Safe Odor-Free 18,000 BTU Outdoor Camping
column4: ["This heater is fairly large.  Don't expect it to fit under your legs in the bleachers.  The handle is really handy, but makes it pretty tall.This heater is very versatile. It can be like the smaller versions with just one element on at half power, full power, or both elements on full power.  It goes through propane about the same as all the other ones I've seen, and full power is a lot of power.  The fan (powered by D cells) blows warm air in your direction, which is nice because otherwise it just goes straight up.IMHO it's way handier than the smaller bottle mounted version because it doesn't tip easily and it's not as tall.  It puts the heat in a better location.It's not a small heater, but is powerful, well built, and looks like it will last.", 'this id the 2nd one I have owned  first one was 5 years old and used every day it was cold it keeps our coach warm enough on low  and very economicl to run do recomend getting the hose with regolator and using a 20 pound bbq grill tank outside  and keeping a couple of the one pound throw aways in reserve incase of a midnight run out of gas senero , teriffic for those emergencies and blizzards requires no electric to run just a couple batteries to run the fan but will still  produce  het with out fan not operating . has the o2 depletion piliot light that lifts off if o2 level gets to low plus tip switch incase it gets tipped over by accident , Like any heating device care should be taken to assure you are opperating it in a safe manner and following the instructions that states the clearences on ll sides ', 'Current house furnace is out and this unit has filled in amazingly well.  Live in MN and have 2 of these with a couple electric room heaters for 2000 sqft plus home and been heating for a month.  Do recommend the 20# Walmart propane tanks w/ gauge for $48 and conversion hose to unit for more economical heating that the small canisters.  CAn heat for nearly a week.  Have CO monitor and never have had it go off once.  They are made to be CO free .  We do not leave them running when not home for safety reason but never yet had an issue.  ', 'I bought this to be able to work in my 2 car garage during cold days. It works very well. The only drawback I could see is that the fan moves very little air. Otherwise, I would have given it a 5 star rating....  Made the garage able to be worked in with no jacket in about 2 hours (on a 15 degree day)  Well worth it...   And would be great thing to have if an ice storm hits and the power (heat) went out...  Costs less than a buck an hour worth of propane to run on High.  I bought a 15 lb tank and ran it for about 18 hours.....    I plan on getting a couple of portable 1 lb bottles and a refill adapter.....', 'Got Mr. Heater for a heater in my outside work area and as an emergency backup heater in case of power failure in a storm or the heat pump went bad in middle of winter. Works perfect and am using hooked up to 20lb propane tank and also little 1lb tanks. Either way is working perfect.  This thing will run you out of house on 18,000 btu setting.  Always vent from a window or door to keep oxygen fresh and will be good for indoor use, you will still be plenty warm and no worries about any pipes freezing. Great product', "This little heater is just the ticket for quickly warming up our home on those chilly mornings. ,I live where we seldom get any colder than 40 degrees at night , we don't run any heater at night for safety reasons ,although I feel this heater is safer than any electric one , no cords to overheat . I turn it on in the morning and in 15 minutes the chill is taken off the house. I use a small fan to circulate the heat more than the one that comes with the heater which is efficient for one room.  I also purchased the 12 foot hose and regulator so I can hook to a 30 lbs bottle out side the house. just ran the hose through an existing tv cable  hole. I can get about a week of heat out of one bottle at 16.00 to refill. That is much cheaper than running electric space heaters.", "The dogs and I have a very comfortable warm environment now that the heater is able to be used. They are so happy that the inside of the motorhome is a lot more comfortable. We have been having nights that are in the upper twenties and low 30s so we're really grateful to have a heater the prize this my cheat on low setting it it basically heats the Whole 30 ft motorhome it generates more than enough heat on low and will run for a hundred hours on that setting .  It is very warm at got my  farm in Coupeville Washington. thanks a lot for a great item!!", 'I\'ve been hunting deer for 42 years now and never worried about the cold weather when I was younger, mostly because pop-up portable blinds and portable heaters like these were not available back then. But my youngest daughter started hunting with me 6 years ago and after watching her brave a particularly cold opening day her first year I decided there had to be a better setup so she could enjoy going with me and I could insure I would get to continue to enjoy spending such moments with her, so I bought my first ground blind and my first Mr. Heater Little Buddy heater, and closing weekend of rifle season was soooooo much more enjoyable. Having a heat source to warm our feet made all the difference in the world being able to sit beside my daughter and just watch her scan our surroundings for her first deer, and did she take a beauty! After realizing how great the difference in the experience having shelter and heat made, I broke down and bought blinds for my Dad, nephew, and great friend who owns the property where we hunt, and then decided everyone should be able to stay warm and enjoy their time in the field as well, so I retired my Little Buddy heater and bought three of the Buddy heaters and one of the heater/cooker models and stocked each blind with a heater. The difference between the Little Buddy and the bigger Buddy models is very noticeably different! Running the bigger Buddy heaters warmed up a two person ground blind sufficiently enough to allow us to take off our coats, even with several windows open, and sit comfortably without creating undue noise or alerts to the deer as we watched many feed and browse around in the field in front of us. Hunting went from a cold and trying event to a greatly enjoyed experience spending time with my daughter, my Dad, my nephew, and friend! I\'ve always said a bad day hunting or fishing is better than a good day working anytime, but having Mr. Heater Buddy heaters warming our ground blinds has made such a difference in our time spent together so much more enjoyable that now my oldest daughter is joining in, and that alone made any expense paid for the equipment one of my best investments! Funny story: My Dad was using the heater I put in the blind he was using and after spending the morning hunting we all went to breakfast and I asked him how well he liked having heat, and his reply was, "great for about 20 minutes and then the damned thing quit and wouldn\'t re-light!" I asked him if he had opened any windows and he said "no, it wasn\'t light yet so I was just enjoying staying warm, until the heater went out!" I started laughing and he was taken aback by my reaction and asked why I was laughing, had I played a joke and given him the junk heater? I said no and told him he should be thankful Mr. Heater saved his life! Not knowing what I was referring to he had a puzzled look on his face, so I told him that the heater has a low oxygen sensor built into it and because he had the windows closed up fresh air could not circulate through the blind and the heater shut off before he could pass out from carbon monoxide poisoning! The look on his face was priceless! All he could say was "glad someone was looking out for him." After breakfast and getting some chores done we all went back to our blinds and my Dad made sure he opened some windows and lit the heater, and spent the rest of the day happy and warm. Moral of the story: The safety features built into Mr. Heater heaters work! Excellent design, quality built, and smart safety features all make Mr. Heater heaters great products you can trust and that make experiences during cold weather so much more enjoyable, and if having one gets a friend or family member to join in the fun, that\'s money well spent! Not to mention having the added insurance of staying warm at home should the power go out for an extended period of time during cold weather!   So, that\'s my experience with Mr. Heater heaters, and I can and do highly recommend to anyone needing and looking for a quality and dependable portable small heater, get one. You will be glad you did! ', 'Due to recently power outage frequently, I brought this protable heater for indoor use for emergency. I did not have chance to try it for hour long but I did try and find out it is very practical make and workable. Only issue to me is I don‚Äôt aware it need 4 D battery to run and how long one will last.Any how it is a very good product,I highly recommend it.', "Will be able to use it in my fish house, heat my area that I use for skinning and tanning the furs that I've trapped.  Like the fact that I can hook up to a larger propane tank.  The fan is a bonus and the 3 different heating levels are great also."]

column4: ["I have a 24x30 building 720sq ft it got it up to 75 to 80 in about 30mins its really loud on low. I think it's to much heater for my garage its putting out to much gas fumes for this garbage. I would recommend the 80,000 btu for this size of garage.", "Works great. I have a 1200 square ft shop and it can heat it up in about 20 minutes on low. The only bad thing I would say is, it is loud and if you have a t.v. or radio in your shop you can't hear it. If you hook up surround sound then you probably could hear a tv then", 'Two connections easy instructions and started up on the first push! No matches just set on lowest setting and ignite. I left it on low the first time it works fast.', 'Perfect find for my large work shed...', "This is one of the best outdoor  Heaters I ever had don't take long for it to get warm inside give it a 5 star.", 'this unit is high quality strongly built and adjusts to fit demand I would recommend this to any and all construction outfits for it is dependable and of top quality. I also recommend this because the company who ships it is fast friendly and honest.', "This heater is amazing keeps my garage very warm in the cold Colorado winter days and also works great to cook with while I'm camping.
