column1: Stiebel Eltron 074058 120-Volt 1500-Watts Heater
column4: ['When I bought my business, the 4 restrooms were heated only with surface mounted electric heaters. It seemed like I was replacing one at least every 2 years. They were poorly made, noisy, and had to be run with a separate thermostat that also was prone to fail.Then I bought the Stiebel Eltron. It is quiet, attractive looking, works GREAT, and has the thermostat built in. The quality is outstanding. I plan on replacing all of them with these. (And for comparison the cost is only slightly higher.)', 'Very simple to install and provides fairly even heat in a small room or additional heat in areas that need it when extremely cold outside . This is the second unit I bought and would not hesitate to purchase again .', 'Worked well, from the reviews I was expecting better than ones at 1/2 the price.   If the fan produced more volume it might have made the difference.  ', 'Looks great mounted on wall in my studio. Easy to hook up.', 'The best love it.', 'This is not a large heater, but it is just right for my needs.It will heat one small bedroom or bath with ease.Theromostat works great on this unit.Easy to install.This unit is has a sound level, I would say is very low.', "Exactly as described. But it doesn't come with electrical cord. So plan on supplying your own.", 'Great little heater. easy to install andlooks great!']

column1: Mr. Heater Natural Gas Blue Flame Heater 30,000 BTU
column4: ["Only portable type heater that can connect to a continuous feed natural gas source without the worry about venting.   It's quite and in a properly sized room very effective and efficient.   A properly sized room being in the 300 to 500 sq.ft. range.   It would be taxed to do a 1,000 sq.ft.", 'Reasonably easy to install, puts out decidedly more heat than my forced air wall furnace. Heats my 1000 sq ft easily. I have used a small version in my RV for years.', 'We bought a similar 30K ng heater in the Fall of 1999, as a hedge against Y2K.  Just in case, bc, with natural gas, you don‚Äôt need any electricity. Bottom line, we wore some of the parts out and it became a pain to fiddle with, didn‚Äôt heat evenly, you get the picture. It‚Äôs 20 years old and neede tweaking to make it work properly. I‚Äôm retired now and don‚Äôt want to fiddle with it anymore. Fast forward to March 2019, my Wife said, let‚Äôs see what a new one goes for, it was $70 cheaper than our 1999 model, starts instantly, heats way better, and with the newer style thermostatic controller, heats evenly. You can‚Äôt beat this new Ng 30,000 btu MR. HEATER. BTW, OUR HOUSE IS A 1850 sq ft tri-Level. As long as it stays above Zero, this thing can maintain 65 deg easily, even shutting off the flame occasionally. {!!WARNING!!} this non-vented, ng heater requires an outside air suppy!! We also mounted a carbon monoxide detector nearby in our family room. I hooked up our MR HEATER to the ng starter in our fireplace, that has an outside fresh air vent(not the flu).  This 30k Ng Mr. Heater is the best, very happy with this space heater. You cannot beat the price either, got it in 4 days free shipping, plus $10 extra off!', "My 2nd Mr heater. Really enjoy the comfort and convenience. I heat my small cottage (1000 sq ft) house efficiently. Only difference now is they aren't being offered with a fan. Just a kit for extra. Save your money buy small fan set behind it. Helps circulation.", 'I replaced an older wall unit with Mr Heater 30,000btu unit. Use new gas line to unit. Looking forward to many years of use.', 'It was put in basement to keep it warmer, along with a carbon monoxide detecter. The heater worksjust fine. Thanks', 'Very nice heater easy to install works great', 'Hooked it up ... works great ...', 'fan not auto work ']

column1: DeLonghi Space Heater Electric Portable Dragon Radiant Room Heat 1500W USA New
column4: ['Takes a little getting use to in that my last one had a temperature display but this one is excellent in its output and will stay on for 24 hours (continuously).  I am becoming a DELONGHI brand type of guy, I guess. The only reason I did not give it a 5 was because there is no visible temperature display so it takes a little longer to figure out where the setting should be.', "This Heater works well, but there are a few 'clunky' things about it:- The extension chord comes from the front of the heater.  This may be a safety thing - maybe?   It is inconvenient having the chord in the front- Also, the 'timer' is manual, very clunky and directly from the 1970's.   Wasn't expecting digital, but something more advanced than this.  Also, if the unit gets unplugged (which I try to do for safety reasons when not in use), the timer does not run and needs to be reset......bummer.Overall, it is a nice unit, does what it is supposed to do!", 'Compact and easy to use. Heats my 10x15 office very nicely.', 'Very nice heater. It heats really good. I recommend it. Thank you.', 'I like it alot.  I already have another just like it so it was no surprise.  However, I did not expect the large dent on the side.  It was not mentioned in the description. ', 'I like the digital display thermostat. Be seem to work quite well and of the heaters out there this is one of my favorite. It‚Äôs not instant heat but more consistent heatÔøº', 'I am using it in too large a room to make a huge difference but one the room is warm it stays warm.  Nice not to have fan noise, but the heat does not spread because there is not a fan.  I am using it in a shop and could not have a live wire or a flame, so it is meeting expectations and safely.', 'Lov it - safe& warm!  Perfect for my bedroom - which is approx. 12x16 - great!', 'Product will heat a small room. Allow at least 1/2 hour. It takes some time to reach warm temp but will maintain safely', 'It does exactly what I expected it to do, I love the quiet heat.']

column1: Comfort Zone CZ230ER Fan Heater 240V
column4: ["This replaced a 40 y/o unit that worked, but not well. Having the remote control makes temperature control much easier. The high mode provides instant heat when used and the guide vanes direct the flow well. I did replace the circuit breaker as this unit has a max draw of 31.4 amps (7500 watts)on high mode, and insured the wiring and connections were proper. It's below freezing outside and this unit cycles and maintains 63-68 degrees with a 72 degree setting. The area is an insulated 900 sqft and the temperature is read on the wall furthest from the unit. Until I get a better primary heat source this is a great unit to have till then.", "The heater is built pretty tough, which is a good thing. I also found it easy to connect, which interestingly enough was more expensive for the materials than it was for the heater. Only problem is that it doesn't heat as well as advertised. It claimed to heat an area (uninsulated) that was 30x30. my garage is 25x35 so I figured that was basically the same thing. after running for an hour or more it only brought the temp up from 45* to about 52*. I guess that if I left it running all the time it would eventually gey there, but that was not what I was hoping for. Plus, those temps were only for the emediate area around the heater, the far end of the garage was still ice cold. In any account it is a good heater for the price. especially if you already have a place wired for it.", "Havent used it yet, but looks nice. It's smaller than I thought but as long as it heats good then I'm ok with it. I was a little disappointed that it didnt come with the plug. Luckily I have an extra one. I will have it hooked up in a couple of days. Thanks. ", "Installed in my 2 car garage, used the correct 8ga wire and double pole breaker. On high setting, it trips the breaker. Tried a different breaker, no luck. It doesn't heat the garage as well as I anticipated, but better than having no heater at all. I like the remote, it works well. Heater is quiet. Not impressed but whatever. I may end up moving it to my basement, where I believe it may work better. ", 'After researching different heater I found this to be the best deal, but the heat sensor is on the inside witch makes it shut off sooner than it should so I located it on the outside and it now works good. I also looked on youtube to see how to hook up 220w and found it to be really easy but make sure you use 8/3 wire and a 40amp double pull breaker for safety reasons. I have a 24x30 insulated garage with 8 foot ceilings and at 32 degrees it will heat up at about 10 degrees an hour and after a while when the heat is up a little bit it seems to heat up faster so I use my kerosene heater to speed things up a little and when it gets around 68 degrees this heater can maintain very easy. now just so you know I have 4 metal cars in my garage that retain cold air for quite a while so your garage might heat up faster depending what you have in it', "I purchased this unit to replace my old one. The unit arrived very quickly. I think it took 4 days to get to me. Packaging was very stout, no damage to the unit. I did have a friend of mine help me install it but it wasn't really hard and could have done it in a pinch. Instructions were easy to read. I have a 25x25 sq ft shop, insulated to about R4 and this heater does a nice job of warming it with outside temps around around 32F. This unit is also nice in that I have a choice of hi or lo elements used to heat.I would recommend this and install it myself if I go to a larger building.", 'Great price, great size, easy to use', "Not happy with this heater. First of all, the thermostat is not correct, as it is located INSIDE the heater where it stays hot. Must be set much much higher for desired temp. Second, and worst of all, when the heater switches ON or OFF, it makes a extremely loud BANG. Really disappointing for the price and would return it if it wasn't hard wired in. Regret buying the warranty, as I don't plan on keeping past it's first breakdown.", 'The temperature sensor is mounted in a way that the heater cuts off way before room temperature is reached.  Believe the sensor is getting reading from the case rather than ambient temperature.  ', 'Well Made. Easy to use. Shipping was fast, with damage. Easy to install. Easy to hang. Would highly recommend it if the square footage is right and it is insulated.']

column1: - EdenPURE GEN3 1000 Quartz Infrared Portable Space Heater -
column4: ["No instructions so take pics of old one with wires attatched. Then hook up new one, need to bend an optical sensor middle of board before installing new board into front cover so Just bend like the old one, also make note of LEDs because they need to fit into their individual positions. Just bend like old ones as well. Before you re-install front panel back-on heater housing and have the board installed in the front panel, make sure all the font cover push buttons click on and release, in other words return to position once you have actuated them. My board had a slight bend in it and would not allow one of the push switches to actuate as it was jammed into actuated position and would not release due to the bend in the PCB of the board. I simply backed off two of the mounting screws allowing the PCB to float just a bit allowing the buttons to actuate and release like they should. Not a big deal in leaving the PCB a little loose as it will not be going anywhere once you complete the installation.At first I was a little disappointed with the cycling action of the heater once it was installed. But what I did not take into account was that the heater needed to cycle to sense the correct room temp for the new board and after 4-6hrsit was back working great. Don't be surprised if you show a different number of LEDs lit with the new board compared to your old one due to temp sensing differences from one board to the next.Overall I like these heaters. They work great to Supplement your houses main heat source. I have mine against an inside wall pointed toward my main entrance to the house. After owning it for about five years I know for a fact it is saving me $30-$40 per month depending on the price of home heating oil. When oil was 4.65per gal, I was saving well over $50-$60 a month. I live in Alaska for what its worth and it runs/cycles 12months out of every year, and might get turned totally off for a total of 2weeks out of those 12months.", "EdenPure's first heater endorsed by Bob Villa.  They no longer make this model which is over ten years old.  This model is reliable and energy efficient and safe in the home.  It has rollers and can be moved from room to room is necessary.  Heat is constant and comfortable.", 'Really like these heaters as this is my 2nd one. Very safe around pets and kids as there are no hot surfaces and it is whisper quiet. The remote control is very handy also.', 'Very fast shipment part was dead on easy to install and works great thanks. A+++', 'Works very well ', 'All I can say is that I love it!', 'Love this small heater box , can be transported anywhere ', 'This product was a gift to a disabled family member.  Its performance and ease of use demonstrate that this was a good buy as well as a wise choice.  I heartily recommend this heater. ', 'easy to install, saved me $200.00', 'Would be better if it had a thermostat ']

column1: Dyson Hot+Cool Air Multiplier, Jet Focus Fan Heater White/grey - AM05
column4: ["Good:-Quality product had me excited.-Size was perfect, over half the size of my old tower fan.-I could put it in a small out of the way area.-Oscillates with no chatter or noise.<br>Not So Good:-Fan is noisy! At #9 speed, it is 64db-Old tower fan was at 15ft, Dyson fan is at 12ft. but only a fraction of air gets to me compared to old cheapie tower fan. So much for this newfangled blade system.-At #7 setting, you have to start compensating for fan noise by raising TV volume.So before you know it, now this room is very noisy. I have tinnitus and want to keep what's left of my hearing for as long as possible, so this fan isn't going to cut it. I could use it in a spare room, but would rather buy a $49 Costco fan for that, instead of this $240 overpriced unit that doesn't perform as well as the $49 fan.-I waited years to buy a Dyson product, because of the prohibitive price. After this experience, I'll go back to the cheaper units, as when they malfunction you just toss them, and buy another. Now I'm out $240 and will -still- have to go buy a cheaper unit to meed my needs. VERY disappointed, Dyson, never again.", "Dyson makes some wonderful products, and this is one of them.  It is a great cooling fan during Summer months, and in Winter will warm and keep a room at a fixed temperature.  Once you have one of these, you'll wonder how you ever managed without it.  I ended up buying a second one to take into my office, and I freeze in the Winter.  No more - I now set the temperature at a toasty 74 degrees, and can work comfortably all day.  I'm very happy with these purchases.", 'Very nice heater for chilly moments. Variable fan speeds and temperature setting. Also how it disperses air flow from straight forward to a fan spray air flow. Works just as well with the same controls at the cool setting.', 'Pics were fine, as was description.  Attempts at Make Offer were not successful. Although unit works, it was not clean and took weeks of use to eliminate ‚Äúold lady perfume‚Äù oder. ', "We have had these fan/heaters before but when we moved 2 years ago and the disappeared. We loved them but the newer one seem to blow a lot stronger fan. Our heater doesn't quiet warm the living room so we decided to buy another Dyson. After it came in my husband wanted another one to replace the fan in the bedroom because of the size. Needless to say we love them.", 'I have not used much yet but it seems to be very good as a refurbished one. Hope to enjoy it year round.', 'This fan/heater is amazing...feels almost like a/c (for the fan) and is so quiet...had to actually turn it down to a lower setting since the highest level (10) was too cold!', 'A few minor cosmetic blemishes. But the fan works exactly like it should.', 'Very small but packs a awesome punch. I just wish they were taller', 'Love it! No issues! Happy customer!']

column1: Mr Heater 18,000 Btu Big Buddy Portable Propane Heater
column4: ["This heater is fairly large.  Don't expect it to fit under your legs in the bleachers.  The handle is really handy, but makes it pretty tall.This heater is very versatile. It can be like the smaller versions with just one element on at half power, full power, or both elements on full power.  It goes through propane about the same as all the other ones I've seen, and full power is a lot of power.  The fan (powered by D cells) blows warm air in your direction, which is nice because otherwise it just goes straight up.IMHO it's way handier than the smaller bottle mounted version because it doesn't tip easily and it's not as tall.  It puts the heat in a better location.It's not a small heater, but is powerful, well built, and looks like it will last.", 'this id the 2nd one I have owned  first one was 5 years old and used every day it was cold it keeps our coach warm enough on low  and very economicl to run do recomend getting the hose with regolator and using a 20 pound bbq grill tank outside  and keeping a couple of the one pound throw aways in reserve incase of a midnight run out of gas senero , teriffic for those emergencies and blizzards requires no electric to run just a couple batteries to run the fan but will still  produce  het with out fan not operating . has the o2 depletion piliot light that lifts off if o2 level gets to low plus tip switch incase it gets tipped over by accident , Like any heating device care should be taken to assure you are opperating it in a safe manner and following the instructions that states the clearences on ll sides ', 'Current house furnace is out and this unit has filled in amazingly well.  Live in MN and have 2 of these with a couple electric room heaters for 2000 sqft plus home and been heating for a month.  Do recommend the 20# Walmart propane tanks w/ gauge for $48 and conversion hose to unit for more economical heating that the small canisters.  CAn heat for nearly a week.  Have CO monitor and never have had it go off once.  They are made to be CO free .  We do not leave them running when not home for safety reason but never yet had an issue.  ', 'I bought this to be able to work in my 2 car garage during cold days. It works very well. The only drawback I could see is that the fan moves very little air. Otherwise, I would have given it a 5 star rating....  Made the garage able to be worked in with no jacket in about 2 hours (on a 15 degree day)  Well worth it...   And would be great thing to have if an ice storm hits and the power (heat) went out...  Costs less than a buck an hour worth of propane to run on High.  I bought a 15 lb tank and ran it for about 18 hours.....    I plan on getting a couple of portable 1 lb bottles and a refill adapter.....', 'Got Mr. Heater for a heater in my outside work area and as an emergency backup heater in case of power failure in a storm or the heat pump went bad in middle of winter. Works perfect and am using hooked up to 20lb propane tank and also little 1lb tanks. Either way is working perfect.  This thing will run you out of house on 18,000 btu setting.  Always vent from a window or door to keep oxygen fresh and will be good for indoor use, you will still be plenty warm and no worries about any pipes freezing. Great product', "This little heater is just the ticket for quickly warming up our home on those chilly mornings. ,I live where we seldom get any colder than 40 degrees at night , we don't run any heater at night for safety reasons ,although I feel this heater is safer than any electric one , no cords to overheat . I turn it on in the morning and in 15 minutes the chill is taken off the house. I use a small fan to circulate the heat more than the one that comes with the heater which is efficient for one room.  I also purchased the 12 foot hose and regulator so I can hook to a 30 lbs bottle out side the house. just ran the hose through an existing tv cable  hole. I can get about a week of heat out of one bottle at 16.00 to refill. That is much cheaper than running electric space heaters.", "The dogs and I have a very comfortable warm environment now that the heater is able to be used. They are so happy that the inside of the motorhome is a lot more comfortable. We have been having nights that are in the upper twenties and low 30s so we're really grateful to have a heater the prize this my cheat on low setting it it basically heats the Whole 30 ft motorhome it generates more than enough heat on low and will run for a hundred hours on that setting .  It is very warm at got my  farm in Coupeville Washington. thanks a lot for a great item!!", 'I\'ve been hunting deer for 42 years now and never worried about the cold weather when I was younger, mostly because pop-up portable blinds and portable heaters like these were not available back then. But my youngest daughter started hunting with me 6 years ago and after watching her brave a particularly cold opening day her first year I decided there had to be a better setup so she could enjoy going with me and I could insure I would get to continue to enjoy spending such moments with her, so I bought my first ground blind and my first Mr. Heater Little Buddy heater, and closing weekend of rifle season was soooooo much more enjoyable. Having a heat source to warm our feet made all the difference in the world being able to sit beside my daughter and just watch her scan our surroundings for her first deer, and did she take a beauty! After realizing how great the difference in the experience having shelter and heat made, I broke down and bought blinds for my Dad, nephew, and great friend who owns the property where we hunt, and then decided everyone should be able to stay warm and enjoy their time in the field as well, so I retired my Little Buddy heater and bought three of the Buddy heaters and one of the heater/cooker models and stocked each blind with a heater. The difference between the Little Buddy and the bigger Buddy models is very noticeably different! Running the bigger Buddy heaters warmed up a two person ground blind sufficiently enough to allow us to take off our coats, even with several windows open, and sit comfortably without creating undue noise or alerts to the deer as we watched many feed and browse around in the field in front of us. Hunting went from a cold and trying event to a greatly enjoyed experience spending time with my daughter, my Dad, my nephew, and friend! I\'ve always said a bad day hunting or fishing is better than a good day working anytime, but having Mr. Heater Buddy heaters warming our ground blinds has made such a difference in our time spent together so much more enjoyable that now my oldest daughter is joining in, and that alone made any expense paid for the equipment one of my best investments! Funny story: My Dad was using the heater I put in the blind he was using and after spending the morning hunting we all went to breakfast and I asked him how well he liked having heat, and his reply was, "great for about 20 minutes and then the damned thing quit and wouldn\'t re-light!" I asked him if he had opened any windows and he said "no, it wasn\'t light yet so I was just enjoying staying warm, until the heater went out!" I started laughing and he was taken aback by my reaction and asked why I was laughing, had I played a joke and given him the junk heater? I said no and told him he should be thankful Mr. Heater saved his life! Not knowing what I was referring to he had a puzzled look on his face, so I told him that the heater has a low oxygen sensor built into it and because he had the windows closed up fresh air could not circulate through the blind and the heater shut off before he could pass out from carbon monoxide poisoning! The look on his face was priceless! All he could say was "glad someone was looking out for him." After breakfast and getting some chores done we all went back to our blinds and my Dad made sure he opened some windows and lit the heater, and spent the rest of the day happy and warm. Moral of the story: The safety features built into Mr. Heater heaters work! Excellent design, quality built, and smart safety features all make Mr. Heater heaters great products you can trust and that make experiences during cold weather so much more enjoyable, and if having one gets a friend or family member to join in the fun, that\'s money well spent! Not to mention having the added insurance of staying warm at home should the power go out for an extended period of time during cold weather!   So, that\'s my experience with Mr. Heater heaters, and I can and do highly recommend to anyone needing and looking for a quality and dependable portable small heater, get one. You will be glad you did! ', 'Due to recently power outage frequently, I brought this protable heater for indoor use for emergency. I did not have chance to try it for hour long but I did try and find out it is very practical make and workable. Only issue to me is I don‚Äôt aware it need 4 D battery to run and how long one will last.Any how it is a very good product,I highly recommend it.', "Will be able to use it in my fish house, heat my area that I use for skinning and tanning the furs that I've trapped.  Like the fact that I can hook up to a larger propane tank.  The fan is a bonus and the 3 different heating levels are great also."]

column1: Dyson Hot+Cool Air Multiplier, Jet Focus Fan Heater White/grey - AM05
column4: ["Good:-Quality product had me excited.-Size was perfect, over half the size of my old tower fan.-I could put it in a small out of the way area.-Oscillates with no chatter or noise.<br>Not So Good:-Fan is noisy! At #9 speed, it is 64db-Old tower fan was at 15ft, Dyson fan is at 12ft. but only a fraction of air gets to me compared to old cheapie tower fan. So much for this newfangled blade system.-At #7 setting, you have to start compensating for fan noise by raising TV volume.So before you know it, now this room is very noisy. I have tinnitus and want to keep what's left of my hearing for as long as possible, so this fan isn't going to cut it. I could use it in a spare room, but would rather buy a $49 Costco fan for that, instead of this $240 overpriced unit that doesn't perform as well as the $49 fan.-I waited years to buy a Dyson product, because of the prohibitive price. After this experience, I'll go back to the cheaper units, as when they malfunction you just toss them, and buy another. Now I'm out $240 and will -still- have to go buy a cheaper unit to meed my needs. VERY disappointed, Dyson, never again.", "Dyson makes some wonderful products, and this is one of them.  It is a great cooling fan during Summer months, and in Winter will warm and keep a room at a fixed temperature.  Once you have one of these, you'll wonder how you ever managed without it.  I ended up buying a second one to take into my office, and I freeze in the Winter.  No more - I now set the temperature at a toasty 74 degrees, and can work comfortably all day.  I'm very happy with these purchases.", 'Very nice heater for chilly moments. Variable fan speeds and temperature setting. Also how it disperses air flow from straight forward to a fan spray air flow. Works just as well with the same controls at the cool setting.', 'Pics were fine, as was description.  Attempts at Make Offer were not successful. Although unit works, it was not clean and took weeks of use to eliminate ‚Äúold lady perfume‚Äù oder. ', "We have had these fan/heaters before but when we moved 2 years ago and the disappeared. We loved them but the newer one seem to blow a lot stronger fan. Our heater doesn't quiet warm the living room so we decided to buy another Dyson. After it came in my husband wanted another one to replace the fan in the bedroom because of the size. Needless to say we love them.", 'I have not used much yet but it seems to be very good as a refurbished one. Hope to enjoy it year round.', 'This fan/heater is amazing...feels almost like a/c (for the fan) and is so quiet...had to actually turn it down to a lower setting since the highest level (10) was too cold!', 'A few minor cosmetic blemishes. But the fan works exactly like it should.', 'Very small but packs a awesome punch. I just wish they were taller', 'Love it! No issues! Happy customer!']

column1: DeLonghi Space Heater Electric Portable Dragon Radiant Room Heat 1500W USA
column4: ['Takes a little getting use to in that my last one had a temperature display but this one is excellent in its output and will stay on for 24 hours (continuously).  I am becoming a DELONGHI brand type of guy, I guess. The only reason I did not give it a 5 was because there is no visible temperature display so it takes a little longer to figure out where the setting should be.', "This Heater works well, but there are a few 'clunky' things about it:- The extension chord comes from the front of the heater.  This may be a safety thing - maybe?   It is inconvenient having the chord in the front- Also, the 'timer' is manual, very clunky and directly from the 1970's.   Wasn't expecting digital, but something more advanced than this.  Also, if the unit gets unplugged (which I try to do for safety reasons when not in use), the timer does not run and needs to be reset......bummer.Overall, it is a nice unit, does what it is supposed to do!", 'Compact and easy to use. Heats my 10x15 office very nicely.', 'Very nice heater. It heats really good. I recommend it. Thank you.', 'I like it alot.  I already have another just like it so it was no surprise.  However, I did not expect the large dent on the side.  It was not mentioned in the description. ', 'I like the digital display thermostat. Be seem to work quite well and of the heaters out there this is one of my favorite. It‚Äôs not instant heat but more consistent heatÔøº', 'I am using it in too large a room to make a huge difference but one the room is warm it stays warm.  Nice not to have fan noise, but the heat does not spread because there is not a fan.  I am using it in a shop and could not have a live wire or a flame, so it is meeting expectations and safely.', 'Lov it - safe& warm!  Perfect for my bedroom - which is approx. 12x16 - great!', 'Product will heat a small room. Allow at least 1/2 hour. It takes some time to reach warm temp but will maintain safely', 'It does exactly what I expected it to do, I love the quiet heat.']

column1: Dyna-Glo Portable Forced Air Heater- Propane- NEW
column4: ["I won a auction for two Dyna Glo 30k-60k heaters for 75.00 shipped . Obviously by reading the description they were returned to the store for some issue and they were. The thermocouple didnt work in either one which always goes out and i always bypass anyway. They only came with one hose and regulator so i ordered another one for 8 bucks shipped. After watching a 2 minute video ( because these were different then the one i already own) it took me about 10 minutes to bypass the thermocouple on each unit and attach both hoses. I hooked both of them to a propane tank and they both worked perfectly. So i got two like new heaters for $85.00 . I read a few post before i purchased that complained about the heaters not staying lit they should have assumed they had a issue by the listing and the fact they are returns from the store. By watching a 2 minute video they couls have fixed the heater and got a great deal. A brand new thermocouple doesn't cost but 10 bucks shipped if you wanted to fix it , i prefer to bypass it . I don't like having to hold the button in for 5 minutes untill it gets hot enough to run on its on. By bypassing the thermocouple it stays lit as soon as you light it . I'm not sure how you buy a product described as returned to store and leave a bad review because it doesn't work correctly . I would have bypassed the thermocouple even if mine did work correctly but i never would have assumed it worked fine. If you looking for a brand new product work a warranty go to Lowe's arw home depot. If you have a philip head screw driver handy and you are looking for a deal like i was these work great .", 'Pretty Quiet per se. arrived Fast. Compact with good output. Your not heating a large space Quickly with this but.. it is great for maintaining the warmth after the larger space is up to temp. Using it in a 1000 Sq. Ft 14‚Äô side wall shop as 3rd Heater the 2 larger Kerosene jets get it toasty I shut them off and just run this propane Heater! Works Great even in Single digits outside in an Insulated Shop.Would buy again if needed.', 'Bought this heater to help supplement heat in our large informal office. We are presently using an 80,000 BTU kerosene heater but the fumes were bothering us when it shuts off other than that it warmed the large office space very quickly and evenly.We wanted to use the Dyna Glo because it is propane hoping there will be far less fumes. While we were attempting to get the heater to stay lit it was producing heat but not nearly as much as the kero 80K would. Nor did the fan push the heat throughout the office space as fast. This is only 20K BTU less but it felt far less than that.We had to return the Dyna-Glo. Maybe we will get another one or something a bit better and pay a few dollars more.', "It was not able to heat a one car garage on the highest setting, after about 3 hours of operating, temp. was the same inside/outside of building, could only feel the heat if standing directly 2 feet in front of it, also very loud, wouldn't recommend", 'Very good quality of product especially for the low price.', 'A very good heater  light weight  and would buy again', 'good product for the money', 'Compact /puts out lots of heat /easy set up', 'It dos the job very well !    I would buy again.', 'Work great. bought to replace a much older unit. These will heat up a small to mid size area quickley']

column1: Mr Heater Hunting Buddy Heater 12000 BTU Hr Standard
column4: ["we finally got to use our mr. buddy heater while camping in our pop up tent this past weekend. waking up around 4 or 5 in the morning with the temperature about 45 degrees....that's a little chilly for us desert dwellers. mr. buddy takes the chill off in just a few minutes. the small, green portable propane tanks do get a bit frosty after about 45 minutes and if they are almost empty the unit just stops. I'm not sure if the unit stopping is due to the oxygen sensor or the bottled propane tank chilling because I used a partially filled bottle first, assumed it was empty, but found it still had liquid in it. after a few minutes I reinstalled it and started right up and ran until it was empty. we did have ample ventilation as the old pop up is not so tight and also we had the vent cracked a little. we experienced no headaches or notice of any lack of oxygen. all in all we really like it and recommend this to anyone. even on the low setting this unit does the trick. we found our large propane tank was empty when we got there so we did not get to use with the hose. the built in fan does work but we didn't use it this time. on a scale of 1 to 10 I give this item an automatic 20! I like it that much.", 'I have only 20 amps in my live work space.After running lights, television and other stuff, I did not have enough current left to run a space heater. This little buddy heater solved my heating problem. It works indoors! I have a 5 lb. Propane tank feeding it. I get about two to three 1/2 days ( at night) running time per tank, about 36 hours. I have 6 tanks for backup.', "I purchased this heater for my campervan, kicks off some good heat but it has to be on the floor as the roof gets to hot if on kitchen worktop. Seems to be good quality and seems to be excellent value in the u.s.a, it cost me more as I'm in the uk. All round good heater but expensive to run if your planning on using it for a long period of time", 'This heater is a life saver if your kids play winter outside sports. This heater knock off the chill and make being outside during those cold games not so bad.', 'Easy start up. Works great. Super quiet on high and medium. On low makes some noise. Heats a 2 person hunting blind in a hurry in freezing temperatures. Highly recommend to stay warm siting in them hunting blinds on cool days', "I've always had good luck with mr heater but this one let me down. It's works great other than it wouldn't stay lit on low. The electric ignition is great! Not sure if my issue was a fluke or not.....thanks", 'mr heater has a good reputation and is quality built.......', 'Love the hunting buddy heater works great no problems at all üíØ ++++ from me !! üëèüëèüëè told all my friends about it ! Lol it will work great in my hay bale blind', 'Works good heats up my 38" boat nicely and is economical when refilling the 1 lb tanks about $40 a month', "This heater is plenty warm for ground blinds and very quiet so it isn't heard by the deer/turkeys. That's even without the fan which will be good for ice fishing."]

column1: Comfort Zone CZ230ER Fan Heater
column4: ["This replaced a 40 y/o unit that worked, but not well. Having the remote control makes temperature control much easier. The high mode provides instant heat when used and the guide vanes direct the flow well. I did replace the circuit breaker as this unit has a max draw of 31.4 amps (7500 watts)on high mode, and insured the wiring and connections were proper. It's below freezing outside and this unit cycles and maintains 63-68 degrees with a 72 degree setting. The area is an insulated 900 sqft and the temperature is read on the wall furthest from the unit. Until I get a better primary heat source this is a great unit to have till then.", "The heater is built pretty tough, which is a good thing. I also found it easy to connect, which interestingly enough was more expensive for the materials than it was for the heater. Only problem is that it doesn't heat as well as advertised. It claimed to heat an area (uninsulated) that was 30x30. my garage is 25x35 so I figured that was basically the same thing. after running for an hour or more it only brought the temp up from 45* to about 52*. I guess that if I left it running all the time it would eventually gey there, but that was not what I was hoping for. Plus, those temps were only for the emediate area around the heater, the far end of the garage was still ice cold. In any account it is a good heater for the price. especially if you already have a place wired for it.", "Havent used it yet, but looks nice. It's smaller than I thought but as long as it heats good then I'm ok with it. I was a little disappointed that it didnt come with the plug. Luckily I have an extra one. I will have it hooked up in a couple of days. Thanks. ", "Installed in my 2 car garage, used the correct 8ga wire and double pole breaker. On high setting, it trips the breaker. Tried a different breaker, no luck. It doesn't heat the garage as well as I anticipated, but better than having no heater at all. I like the remote, it works well. Heater is quiet. Not impressed but whatever. I may end up moving it to my basement, where I believe it may work better. ", 'After researching different heater I found this to be the best deal, but the heat sensor is on the inside witch makes it shut off sooner than it should so I located it on the outside and it now works good. I also looked on youtube to see how to hook up 220w and found it to be really easy but make sure you use 8/3 wire and a 40amp double pull breaker for safety reasons. I have a 24x30 insulated garage with 8 foot ceilings and at 32 degrees it will heat up at about 10 degrees an hour and after a while when the heat is up a little bit it seems to heat up faster so I use my kerosene heater to speed things up a little and when it gets around 68 degrees this heater can maintain very easy. now just so you know I have 4 metal cars in my garage that retain cold air for quite a while so your garage might heat up faster depending what you have in it', "I purchased this unit to replace my old one. The unit arrived very quickly. I think it took 4 days to get to me. Packaging was very stout, no damage to the unit. I did have a friend of mine help me install it but it wasn't really hard and could have done it in a pinch. Instructions were easy to read. I have a 25x25 sq ft shop, insulated to about R4 and this heater does a nice job of warming it with outside temps around around 32F. This unit is also nice in that I have a choice of hi or lo elements used to heat.I would recommend this and install it myself if I go to a larger building.", 'Great price, great size, easy to use', "Not happy with this heater. First of all, the thermostat is not correct, as it is located INSIDE the heater where it stays hot. Must be set much much higher for desired temp. Second, and worst of all, when the heater switches ON or OFF, it makes a extremely loud BANG. Really disappointing for the price and would return it if it wasn't hard wired in. Regret buying the warranty, as I don't plan on keeping past it's first breakdown.", 'The temperature sensor is mounted in a way that the heater cuts off way before room temperature is reached.  Believe the sensor is getting reading from the case rather than ambient temperature.  ', 'Well Made. Easy to use. Shipping was fast, with damage. Easy to install. Easy to hang. Would highly recommend it if the square footage is right and it is insulated.']

column1: Dyna-Glo RA18LPDG Portable Space Heater - Black
column4: ['A bit smelly at the beginning due that the paint is burning. Smell will go away in the 1st week. The front grill (chromed) will turn dark a bit but that‚Äôs to be expected. Enough heat for a 4x6m room when usign Liquid Propane gas. I used Butane and it was amazingly efficient (you feel the heat even with the pilot! Not even a single burner) but butane is difficult to find where i live.Comes with gas regulator, ready for a left internal thread. Easy to operate and very light to move around the house. Planning to buy another one for the 1st floor of the house. ', 'Amazing.  Really throws out a lot of heat.  Easy to set up, easy to use.  Cools off super fast too.  I use it on a front porch that has vinyl covers the open areas and open holes through the concrete base.  Maybe 100 square feet and on low it gets warm and toasty.  ', 'comes with wheels easy to install, and heat comes clean. tested with my CO (carbon monoxide) detector and is good for indoors. been using it on a rental property for couple days now. 3 settings for heat intensity. propane bottle doesnt go out as fast like other heaters.', "This is a dyna-glo brand 6-18K BTU.3 burner panels knob controls 1,2,3 burner lighted.This would create 6,12,18k btu of heating output.Easy to setup with 20lb tank counter clockwise to tighten.Heats my 5-700 sq ft up to 70+ with 2 burners active in less /hr 50F ambient.Be safe with enclosed spaces with this, needs adequate ventilation.Have a carbon monoxide detector in airspace proximity.Doesn't produce much of a smell when burning, only during first few hours of being new.", "this is my 3rd one, have one in my living room, one in family room. this one is just a backup. saw this advertised on five sights  3 said not for indoor use but others said that was just a disclaimer. i've used it indoors for 3 years with no problems.  i did disconnect the tipover device because it would not reset sometimes. great backup heating system", "This is a great heater. I have a 1500sq ft house that I heat with this heater and it will roast you out of the house. I usually run it on low and I put a little clamp on fan on top to push the heat out. The break in took awhile to burn off the new of it but after that there is no smell what so ever. It's easy to operate. I use it in the evening just to keep my electric bill down.", "the buddy company makes one similar but this one makes the same heat it is a construction heater so not intended for use in your home(but that is just for the lawyers it is meant to heat a small area but one without clutter since items should be away from a 3 foot radius of 180 deg of the front the pilot lighting can be confusing for the stupid since you have to constantly hold down the pilot position for a few seconds then click the ignitor and leave it held down till the thermocouple heats which takes about 15 secondsso if you are a moron just buy an electric heateri heat my front room on setting 3 till it gets as warm as i like it  than outside then switch it to position 2 only complaints are the wheels don't roll well(yes i have the locking wheels unlocked)and the tank fitting is the old left hand  type instead of the easier to use new plastic (righty tighty)acme type that is on all propane tanks made after 1996also taking off and putting on the flimsy rear tank retainer is a bit annoying it would be better if it had a hinge and latch  instead of tabs and slots", 'Needed something for back up heat due to our electricity being off frequently during storms and etc. This is an excellent source of quick and versatile heat. The ability to adjust from 6,000 to 18,000 BTUs makes it perfect. Build quality seems to be adequate. This is really a no brainer.', "By every measure, this is wonderful heater. This heater quickly heats a 144 sqft room in 3-4 mins when using it at full capacity going from 40F to 70F. Excellent starting with the pilot light and it is easy to move (but the castors are probably not the greatest). At minimum capacity keeps an entire 2000sqft house from going below 62F when it is 22F outside (but this will also be dependent on air allowed in and insulation as well). Unlike electric, this gives off a pleasant infrared light that will heat things it is pointed at. This is quite nice since heated air is lighter than colder air and rises, but a chair or clothing 3-10ft away will warm from the light emissions. You can sit 3 ft away from it and warm your hands as if it was a camp fire from this light. You can also feel the hot air going straight up into the air.  Make sure you keep clear of the grill as in loose clothes or your leg. Also according to directions you are not suppose to leave it on unattended. But, one of the first things we did was roast marshmallows using long metal rods. For s'mores, you can get the perfect golden marshmallow. (even though it's not marketed as a marshmallow toaster).Between medium-to-high quality, portability, cost efficiency, and the shear fact that it paid for itself in less than one month from switching away from heating with electricity, I give it five stars.  ", 'We have heat pumps in our house and on those really cold nights they just don‚Äôt do the trick. We got this heater just for a little extra warmth and we have been shocked on how easy and warm it is. I found out that we only need to run it on low because medium and height is way to much. Great product.']

column1: CONVECTION HTR 200K BTU
column4: ["I have a 24x30 building 720sq ft it got it up to 75 to 80 in about 30mins its really loud on low. I think it's to much heater for my garage its putting out to much gas fumes for this garbage. I would recommend the 80,000 btu for this size of garage.", "Works great. I have a 1200 square ft shop and it can heat it up in about 20 minutes on low. The only bad thing I would say is, it is loud and if you have a t.v. or radio in your shop you can't hear it. If you hook up surround sound then you probably could hear a tv then", 'Two connections easy instructions and started up on the first push! No matches just set on lowest setting and ignite. I left it on low the first time it works fast.', 'Perfect find for my large work shed...', "This is one of the best outdoor  Heaters I ever had don't take long for it to get warm inside give it a 5 star.", 'this unit is high quality strongly built and adjusts to fit demand I would recommend this to any and all construction outfits for it is dependable and of top quality. I also recommend this because the company who ships it is fast friendly and honest.', "This heater is amazing keeps my garage very warm in the cold Colorado winter days and also works great to cook with while I'm camping. ", 'excellent source of heat for my garage, works great', 'This heater is very compact , an hears my 3 car garage up n minutes on the lowest setting ! I would recommend this too anyone .', 'works very well,heats up room fast,great price']

column1: Dyna-Glo Portable Forced Air Heater- Propane- NEW
column4: ["I won a auction for two Dyna Glo 30k-60k heaters for 75.00 shipped . Obviously by reading the description they were returned to the store for some issue and they were. The thermocouple didnt work in either one which always goes out and i always bypass anyway. They only came with one hose and regulator so i ordered another one for 8 bucks shipped. After watching a 2 minute video ( because these were different then the one i already own) it took me about 10 minutes to bypass the thermocouple on each unit and attach both hoses. I hooked both of them to a propane tank and they both worked perfectly. So i got two like new heaters for $85.00 . I read a few post before i purchased that complained about the heaters not staying lit they should have assumed they had a issue by the listing and the fact they are returns from the store. By watching a 2 minute video they couls have fixed the heater and got a great deal. A brand new thermocouple doesn't cost but 10 bucks shipped if you wanted to fix it , i prefer to bypass it . I don't like having to hold the button in for 5 minutes untill it gets hot enough to run on its on. By bypassing the thermocouple it stays lit as soon as you light it . I'm not sure how you buy a product described as returned to store and leave a bad review because it doesn't work correctly . I would have bypassed the thermocouple even if mine did work correctly but i never would have assumed it worked fine. If you looking for a brand new product work a warranty go to Lowe's arw home depot. If you have a philip head screw driver handy and you are looking for a deal like i was these work great .", 'Pretty Quiet per se. arrived Fast. Compact with good output. Your not heating a large space Quickly with this but.. it is great for maintaining the warmth after the larger space is up to temp. Using it in a 1000 Sq. Ft 14‚Äô side wall shop as 3rd Heater the 2 larger Kerosene jets get it toasty I shut them off and just run this propane Heater! Works Great even in Single digits outside in an Insulated Shop.Would buy again if needed.', 'Bought this heater to help supplement heat in our large informal office. We are presently using an 80,000 BTU kerosene heater but the fumes were bothering us when it shuts off other than that it warmed the large office space very quickly and evenly.We wanted to use the Dyna Glo because it is propane hoping there will be far less fumes. While we were attempting to get the heater to stay lit it was producing heat but not nearly as much as the kero 80K would. Nor did the fan push the heat throughout the office space as fast. This is only 20K BTU less but it felt far less than that.We had to return the Dyna-Glo. Maybe we will get another one or something a bit better and pay a few dollars more.', "It was not able to heat a one car garage on the highest setting, after about 3 hours of operating, temp. was the same inside/outside of building, could only feel the heat if standing directly 2 feet in front of it, also very loud, wouldn't recommend", 'Very good quality of product especially for the low price.', 'A very good heater  light weight  and would buy again', 'good product for the money', 'Compact /puts out lots of heat /easy set up', 'It dos the job very well !    I would buy again.', 'Work great. bought to replace a much older unit. These will heat up a small to mid size area quickley']

column1: Mr Heater Hunting Buddy Heater 12000 BTU Hr Standard
column4: ["we finally got to use our mr. buddy heater while camping in our pop up tent this past weekend. waking up around 4 or 5 in the morning with the temperature about 45 degrees....that's a little chilly for us desert dwellers. mr. buddy takes the chill off in just a few minutes. the small, green portable propane tanks do get a bit frosty after about 45 minutes and if they are almost empty the unit just stops. I'm not sure if the unit stopping is due to the oxygen sensor or the bottled propane tank chilling because I used a partially filled bottle first, assumed it was empty, but found it still had liquid in it. after a few minutes I reinstalled it and started right up and ran until it was empty. we did have ample ventilation as the old pop up is not so tight and also we had the vent cracked a little. we experienced no headaches or notice of any lack of oxygen. all in all we really like it and recommend this to anyone. even on the low setting this unit does the trick. we found our large propane tank was empty when we got there so we did not get to use with the hose. the built in fan does work but we didn't use it this time. on a scale of 1 to 10 I give this item an automatic 20! I like it that much.", 'I have only 20 amps in my live work space.After running lights, television and other stuff, I did not have enough current left to run a space heater. This little buddy heater solved my heating problem. It works indoors! I have a 5 lb. Propane tank feeding it. I get about two to three 1/2 days ( at night) running time per tank, about 36 hours. I have 6 tanks for backup.', "I purchased this heater for my campervan, kicks off some good heat but it has to be on the floor as the roof gets to hot if on kitchen worktop. Seems to be good quality and seems to be excellent value in the u.s.a, it cost me more as I'm in the uk. All round good heater but expensive to run if your planning on using it for a long period of time", 'This heater is a life saver if your kids play winter outside sports. This heater knock off the chill and make being outside during those cold games not so bad.', 'Easy start up. Works great. Super quiet on high and medium. On low makes some noise. Heats a 2 person hunting blind in a hurry in freezing temperatures. Highly recommend to stay warm siting in them hunting blinds on cool days', "I've always had good luck with mr heater but this one let me down. It's works great other than it wouldn't stay lit on low. The electric ignition is great! Not sure if my issue was a fluke or not.....thanks", 'mr heater has a good reputation and is quality built.......', 'Love the hunting buddy heater works great no problems at all üíØ ++++ from me !! üëèüëèüëè told all my friends about it ! Lol it will work great in my hay bale blind', 'Works good heats up my 38" boat nicely and is economical when refilling the 1 lb tanks about $40 a month', "This heater is plenty warm for ground blinds and very quiet so it isn't heard by the deer/turkeys. That's even without the fan which will be good for ice fishing."]

column1: Comfort Zone CZ230ER Fan Heater
column4: ["This replaced a 40 y/o unit that worked, but not well. Having the remote control makes temperature control much easier. The high mode provides instant heat when used and the guide vanes direct the flow well. I did replace the circuit breaker as this unit has a max draw of 31.4 amps (7500 watts)on high mode, and insured the wiring and connections were proper. It's below freezing outside and this unit cycles and maintains 63-68 degrees with a 72 degree setting. The area is an insulated 900 sqft and the temperature is read on the wall furthest from the unit. Until I get a better primary heat source this is a great unit to have till then.", "The heater is built pretty tough, which is a good thing. I also found it easy to connect, which interestingly enough was more expensive for the materials than it was for the heater. Only problem is that it doesn't heat as well as advertised. It claimed to heat an area (uninsulated) that was 30x30. my garage is 25x35 so I figured that was basically the same thing. after running for an hour or more it only brought the temp up from 45* to about 52*. I guess that if I left it running all the time it would eventually gey there, but that was not what I was hoping for. Plus, those temps were only for the emediate area around the heater, the far end of the garage was still ice cold. In any account it is a good heater for the price. especially if you already have a place wired for it.", "Havent used it yet, but looks nice. It's smaller than I thought but as long as it heats good then I'm ok with it. I was a little disappointed that it didnt come with the plug. Luckily I have an extra one. I will have it hooked up in a couple of days. Thanks. ", "Installed in my 2 car garage, used the correct 8ga wire and double pole breaker. On high setting, it trips the breaker. Tried a different breaker, no luck. It doesn't heat the garage as well as I anticipated, but better than having no heater at all. I like the remote, it works well. Heater is quiet. Not impressed but whatever. I may end up moving it to my basement, where I believe it may work better. ", 'After researching different heater I found this to be the best deal, but the heat sensor is on the inside witch makes it shut off sooner than it should so I located it on the outside and it now works good. I also looked on youtube to see how to hook up 220w and found it to be really easy but make sure you use 8/3 wire and a 40amp double pull breaker for safety reasons. I have a 24x30 insulated garage with 8 foot ceilings and at 32 degrees it will heat up at about 10 degrees an hour and after a while when the heat is up a little bit it seems to heat up faster so I use my kerosene heater to speed things up a little and when it gets around 68 degrees this heater can maintain very easy. now just so you know I have 4 metal cars in my garage that retain cold air for quite a while so your garage might heat up faster depending what you have in it', "I purchased this unit to replace my old one. The unit arrived very quickly. I think it took 4 days to get to me. Packaging was very stout, no damage to the unit. I did have a friend of mine help me install it but it wasn't really hard and could have done it in a pinch. Instructions were easy to read. I have a 25x25 sq ft shop, insulated to about R4 and this heater does a nice job of warming it with outside temps around around 32F. This unit is also nice in that I have a choice of hi or lo elements used to heat.I would recommend this and install it myself if I go to a larger building.", 'Great price, great size, easy to use', "Not happy with this heater. First of all, the thermostat is not correct, as it is located INSIDE the heater where it stays hot. Must be set much much higher for desired temp. Second, and worst of all, when the heater switches ON or OFF, it makes a extremely loud BANG. Really disappointing for the price and would return it if it wasn't hard wired in. Regret buying the warranty, as I don't plan on keeping past it's first breakdown.", 'The temperature sensor is mounted in a way that the heater cuts off way before room temperature is reached.  Believe the sensor is getting reading from the case rather than ambient temperature.  ', 'Well Made. Easy to use. Shipping was fast, with damage. Easy to install. Easy to hang. Would highly recommend it if the square footage is right and it is insulated.']

column1: Mr Heater Hunting Buddy Heater 12000 BTU Hr Standard
column4: ["we finally got to use our mr. buddy heater while camping in our pop up tent this past weekend. waking up around 4 or 5 in the morning with the temperature about 45 degrees....that's a little chilly for us desert dwellers. mr. buddy takes the chill off in just a few minutes. the small, green portable propane tanks do get a bit frosty after about 45 minutes and if they are almost empty the unit just stops. I'm not sure if the unit stopping is due to the oxygen sensor or the bottled propane tank chilling because I used a partially filled bottle first, assumed it was empty, but found it still had liquid in it. after a few minutes I reinstalled it and started right up and ran until it was empty. we did have ample ventilation as the old pop up is not so tight and also we had the vent cracked a little. we experienced no headaches or notice of any lack of oxygen. all in all we really like it and recommend this to anyone. even on the low setting this unit does the trick. we found our large propane tank was empty when we got there so we did not get to use with the hose. the built in fan does work but we didn't use it this time. on a scale of 1 to 10 I give this item an automatic 20! I like it that much.", 'I have only 20 amps in my live work space.After running lights, television and other stuff, I did not have enough current left to run a space heater. This little buddy heater solved my heating problem. It works indoors! I have a 5 lb. Propane tank feeding it. I get about two to three 1/2 days ( at night) running time per tank, about 36 hours. I have 6 tanks for backup.', "I purchased this heater for my campervan, kicks off some good heat but it has to be on the floor as the roof gets to hot if on kitchen worktop. Seems to be good quality and seems to be excellent value in the u.s.a, it cost me more as I'm in the uk. All round good heater but expensive to run if your planning on using it for a long period of time", 'This heater is a life saver if your kids play winter outside sports. This heater knock off the chill and make being outside during those cold games not so bad.', 'Easy start up. Works great. Super quiet on high and medium. On low makes some noise. Heats a 2 person hunting blind in a hurry in freezing temperatures. Highly recommend to stay warm siting in them hunting blinds on cool days', "I've always had good luck with mr heater but this one let me down. It's works great other than it wouldn't stay lit on low. The electric ignition is great! Not sure if my issue was a fluke or not.....thanks", 'mr heater has a good reputation and is quality built.......', 'Love the hunting buddy heater works great no problems at all üíØ ++++ from me !! üëèüëèüëè told all my friends about it ! Lol it will work great in my hay bale blind', 'Works good heats up my 38" boat nicely and is economical when refilling the 1 lb tanks about $40 a month', "This heater is plenty warm for ground blinds and very quiet so it isn't heard by the deer/turkeys. That's even without the fan which will be good for ice fishing."]

column1: Dyna-Glo RA18LPDG Portable Space Heater - Black
column4: ['A bit smelly at the beginning due that the paint is burning. Smell will go away in the 1st week. The front grill (chromed) will turn dark a bit but that‚Äôs to be expected. Enough heat for a 4x6m room when usign Liquid Propane gas. I used Butane and it was amazingly efficient (you feel the heat even with the pilot! Not even a single burner) but butane is difficult to find where i live.Comes with gas regulator, ready for a left internal thread. Easy to operate and very light to move around the house. Planning to buy another one for the 1st floor of the house. ', 'Amazing.  Really throws out a lot of heat.  Easy to set up, easy to use.  Cools off super fast too.  I use it on a front porch that has vinyl covers the open areas and open holes through the concrete base.  Maybe 100 square feet and on low it gets warm and toasty.  ', 'comes with wheels easy to install, and heat comes clean. tested with my CO (carbon monoxide) detector and is good for indoors. been using it on a rental property for couple days now. 3 settings for heat intensity. propane bottle doesnt go out as fast like other heaters.', "This is a dyna-glo brand 6-18K BTU.3 burner panels knob controls 1,2,3 burner lighted.This would create 6,12,18k btu of heating output.Easy to setup with 20lb tank counter clockwise to tighten.Heats my 5-700 sq ft up to 70+ with 2 burners active in less /hr 50F ambient.Be safe with enclosed spaces with this, needs adequate ventilation.Have a carbon monoxide detector in airspace proximity.Doesn't produce much of a smell when burning, only during first few hours of being new.", "this is my 3rd one, have one in my living room, one in family room. this one is just a backup. saw this advertised on five sights  3 said not for indoor use but others said that was just a disclaimer. i've used it indoors for 3 years with no problems.  i did disconnect the tipover device because it would not reset sometimes. great backup heating system", "This is a great heater. I have a 1500sq ft house that I heat with this heater and it will roast you out of the house. I usually run it on low and I put a little clamp on fan on top to push the heat out. The break in took awhile to burn off the new of it but after that there is no smell what so ever. It's easy to operate. I use it in the evening just to keep my electric bill down.", "the buddy company makes one similar but this one makes the same heat it is a construction heater so not intended for use in your home(but that is just for the lawyers it is meant to heat a small area but one without clutter since items should be away from a 3 foot radius of 180 deg of the front the pilot lighting can be confusing for the stupid since you have to constantly hold down the pilot position for a few seconds then click the ignitor and leave it held down till the thermocouple heats which takes about 15 secondsso if you are a moron just buy an electric heateri heat my front room on setting 3 till it gets as warm as i like it  than outside then switch it to position 2 only complaints are the wheels don't roll well(yes i have the locking wheels unlocked)and the tank fitting is the old left hand  type instead of the easier to use new plastic (righty tighty)acme type that is on all propane tanks made after 1996also taking off and putting on the flimsy rear tank retainer is a bit annoying it would be better if it had a hinge and latch  instead of tabs and slots", 'Needed something for back up heat due to our electricity being off frequently during storms and etc. This is an excellent source of quick and versatile heat. The ability to adjust from 6,000 to 18,000 BTUs makes it perfect. Build quality seems to be adequate. This is really a no brainer.', "By every measure, this is wonderful heater. This heater quickly heats a 144 sqft room in 3-4 mins when using it at full capacity going from 40F to 70F. Excellent starting with the pilot light and it is easy to move (but the castors are probably not the greatest). At minimum capacity keeps an entire 2000sqft house from going below 62F when it is 22F outside (but this will also be dependent on air allowed in and insulation as well). Unlike electric, this gives off a pleasant infrared light that will heat things it is pointed at. This is quite nice since heated air is lighter than colder air and rises, but a chair or clothing 3-10ft away will warm from the light emissions. You can sit 3 ft away from it and warm your hands as if it was a camp fire from this light. You can also feel the hot air going straight up into the air.  Make sure you keep clear of the grill as in loose clothes or your leg. Also according to directions you are not suppose to leave it on unattended. But, one of the first things we did was roast marshmallows using long metal rods. For s'mores, you can get the perfect golden marshmallow. (even though it's not marketed as a marshmallow toaster).Between medium-to-high quality, portability, cost efficiency, and the shear fact that it paid for itself in less than one month from switching away from heating with electricity, I give it five stars.  ", 'We have heat pumps in our house and on those really cold nights they just don‚Äôt do the trick. We got this heater just for a little extra warmth and we have been shocked on how easy and warm it is. I found out that we only need to run it on low because medium and height is way to much. Great product.']

column1: CONVECTION HTR 200K BTU
column4: ["I have a 24x30 building 720sq ft it got it up to 75 to 80 in about 30mins its really loud on low. I think it's to much heater for my garage its putting out to much gas fumes for this garbage. I would recommend the 80,000 btu for this size of garage.", "Works great. I have a 1200 square ft shop and it can heat it up in about 20 minutes on low. The only bad thing I would say is, it is loud and if you have a t.v. or radio in your shop you can't hear it. If you hook up surround sound then you probably could hear a tv then", 'Two connections easy instructions and started up on the first push! No matches just set on lowest setting and ignite. I left it on low the first time it works fast.', 'Perfect find for my large work shed...', "This is one of the best outdoor  Heaters I ever had don't take long for it to get warm inside give it a 5 star.", 'this unit is high quality strongly built and adjusts to fit demand I would recommend this to any and all construction outfits for it is dependable and of top quality. I also recommend this because the company who ships it is fast friendly and honest.', "This heater is amazing keeps my garage very warm in the cold Colorado winter days and also works great to cook with while I'm camping. ", 'excellent source of heat for my garage, works great', 'This heater is very compact , an hears my 3 car garage up n minutes on the lowest setting ! I would recommend this too anyone .', 'works very well,heats up room fast,great price']
